description: Our company is expanding, and we are looking for driven individuals who are not afraid to step up to new challenges. As a team player, you will gain valuable experience in the industry while learning indispensable skills.  Responsibilities - Increase Brand Awareness for our Clients - To acquire new and retain existing customers  Requirement - Singaporean/PR - Strong Interpersonal & Communication Skills - Immediate Starters Preferred  You should be - Solution Driven - Be committed to improvement & growth - Be committed and responsible  We are excited and looking forward to working with you if you possess the qualities above. No experience is required. One-to-one coaching will be provided!  We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Possess strategic acuity, passion for and excellence in sales, and a desire to make real impact in classrooms all over the world?  Come join us as an APAC Account Lead International and help grow the LEGO Education business in future growth markets!   Core Responsibilities  Understand and map out the total potential for LEGO Education (LE) the APAC region, and track insights to identify target addressable market. Work with key colleagues from marketing and adoption to ensure we have end to end mapping of the channel and customer value propositions. Partners are effectively managed to deliver maximum impact in that region – challenge partner deliverables at any point, and objectively identify the partners of the future who should also be in our stable. Bring a growth and challenger attitude to the business, committed to delivering commercial and learning impact.   Relationship management - Responsibility for high-potential group of ~4-8 partners who can offer the greatest growth potential to LEGO Education. Lead the relationship and are responsible for driving as well as challenging the LE business performance. Provide added value to partner operations to enhance mutual business, using the LEGO system approach and through active shadow management, to generate long term, sustainable value. Ability and presence to represent LE partnership at the highest levels, supporting strategic relationships with key customers, including national/regional MOEs. Revenue growth management – Proven track record in identifying growth opportunities, and making value chains deliver the best bottom line. You challenge the norm, and look for upsides. Take a meticulous approach to data to identify trends and themes that inform plans and commitments. Provide insights that allow to inspire and lead our partners to new business generation and growth. Responsible for forecasting and execution of account plans; in partnership with marketing colleagues, support partners with the design and activation of campaigns and account-based marketing to maximise growth potential. Able to challenge and reinvent partner plans via connecting the right dots and data points and insights to map out future growth opportunities. Annual and longer-term business planning – Bring ability and experience to craft and hone the Big Idea with our partners, and then bring that down into a highly structured plan that holds teams focused and accountable. The plan blends partner and LE objectives and strategy, utilizing market, sector and customer insights to uncover opportunities and unlock potential. Driving and improving capabilities across the team to think more strategically about business planning, able to synthesis channel insights to inform 3-year roadmaps. Performance excellence – Succeed in a performance driven culture; performance tracking is a routine and habit, and challenges are pursued thoughtfully and directly. Expect a lot from self; from those around in enabling roles, and drive a one-team mentality, regardless of reporting lines. Commit to continuously monitoring results, quantitive and qualitative, to ensure that targets remain both realistic and stretching. Conduct return on investment evaluation of activities, and proactively course correct when plans are not delivering. Focus on outcomes, and apply learning and experience from previous initiatives to improve future plans – proactive when a landmark is missed, and capture success that can be further demonstrated. Bring a strong legal and framework attitude to performance execution – follow process and protocol to conduct business with standards and quality. Cross-functional execution and indirect people leadership Thrive in a collaborative, matrixed organization, bring functional expertise to the table with colleagues from other functions, and deliver great results together. Working with a Marketing Manager and Adoption Lead, model great competencies whilst displaying a commitment to improvement, and help to shape the next level of talent in the business through skills development, coaching, and active shadow collaboration.   Play your part in our team succeeding  This is a key position and leadership opportunity to drive the exciting business growth of LE in Asia Pacific. The Account Lead will manage a handful of business plans with key partners who can achieve our sales ambitions for LE in specific markets. This role demands strong strategic acumen and channel expertise, and passion for targeted sales.  Do you have what it takes?   Bachelor’s degree in business related field Experience/qualifications in Business Administration a plus Experience of working in the education industry, most preferred 7-10 years account/market leadership experience in FMCG / Mobile Technology industry with top-class brands Passion for channel management and business execution Demonstrate and model critical thinking; be choiceful in growing our business with the partners. Strong and proven strategic and result oriented in approach Curiosity and humility – a passion for learning, improving, and building stronger capabilities in oneself and those around Strong digital skills and fluency with data and CRM, and the confidence to act on the data. Strong attention to detail with excellent and professional verbal communication and writing skills Team orientated and can work with teams globally, with ability to show indirect management and development with team members Ability to travel (1-2 weeks in 4) Knowledge Languages like Korean or Japanese would be a plus to support APAC market Must be confident working in a matrix and multi-cultural environment   Join the global LEGO® family  Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued, and they belong.  The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”  The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.  Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.  Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.  #LEGOEDU
industries: Consumer Goods

description: Sales & Business Development Intern [Full-Time/Part-Time]  This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a fast-growing PropTech start-up. You will gain insight and great experience into an internet start-up, experience life as an entrepreneur, and get involved in all aspects of the company’s development.   The position covers mainly the Singapore market and will primarily consist of handling sales inquiries, managing and developing our space partners inventory in Singapore as well as provide occasional support to partnership teams across the region.  Responsibilities:  Account Management: Being the first point of contact for sales and operational queries from our merchants/ partners.  Sales: Making sure that business leads are properly taken care of.   Business Development: Be actively involved in finding new business.   Merchant Acquisition: Be actively involved in finding and acquiring new space partners which include event venues, coworking spaces, serviced offices, and other landlords.   Merchant Relationship: Develop and maintain merchant relationships, monitoring initiatives to improve merchant engagement, applying problem-solving skills to effectuate solutions. Be the first point of contact for all matters relating to space partners.   Market research: Monitoring up-to-date information, research on traditional real estate, and flexible office market.   Support the marketing team with partner-related content. - Minimum Education: Diploma (Bachelors and Masters Graduates are encouraged to apply as well).  - Availability from October 2021 for min. 6 months  - Males must have completed NS (unless exempt).  - All applicants must have their own visa or sponsorship with eligibility to work in Singapore for the entire duration of the internship.  - Previous experience in a start-up and/or corporate environment is ideal.   - Experience in real estate would be an added advantage.  - Outstanding communication skills and fluency in English.  - Natural sales instincts, driven attitude, and “rainmaking” mentality best describe the ideal candidate for the role.  - Hands-on mentality, excellent analytical skills, proactiveness is a must.  - The remuneration includes a salary of $800 - $1000/month (Full-time), commission, and CPF for eligible applicants.  You may also apply for this position by sending your CV to partnerships.sg@flyspaces.com and cc singapore@flyspaces.com

Coty is a world leader in beauty and home to an illustrious roster of cosmetic, skincare and fragrance brands. And our company has a mission: to challenge the definition of beauty, to encourage authenticity and celebrate diversity. Because to us at Coty, beauty isn’t about conforming to somebody else’s ideal. It’s about inclusion and liberating everyone to shine in their unique way.  Coty helps millions of people around the world express your beauty, your way through our rich portfolio covering fragrance, skin care, colour cosmetics, and body care. Our brands include global icons like Gucci, Burberry, Hugo Boss, Calvin Klein, Philosophy, Max Factor, Rimmel, Bourjois, Sally Hansen, Adidas, David Beckham, etc. With more than one billion products shipped each year, the possibilities for self-expression are endless.  THE ROLE  About the Role… Through this role, you’ll be able to gain an understanding of: Luxury Beauty from the ground up – the best marketing campaign can only come to life if the team’s operations are robust enough to support the campaign. How to assess retail productivity, and the tools to drive retail excellence Project Management, Process Improvement skills and mindset How to sharpen commercial acumen – understand how different stakeholders view the business, see a direct correlation between sales, marketing plans and sales delivery  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES   BA App stabilisation BA App (Primary Use: sales tracking app intended for timely sales reporting by brand by counter, by BA. Basis for BA commissions. Secondary Use: counter SOH management) Ensure ongoing data accuracy and data integrity. Support RO and TM on missing item upload, master data maintenance, special buy creation. Understand scenarios and limitations not captured in app but needed on ground. Devise workarounds, improvements with IT and RO (within cost and app limitations). Document FAQs in User handbook Key User for backend report generation. Work with IT and RO to develop auto reports, understanding analytics required by TM (frag vs MU).  Retail Analytics & Reporting Harmonise various data sources: BA App, Scorecards, Adecco Sales Data and Daily Sales Trackers. Ensure each are updated on time and accurately, discrepancies at month end resolved Extract data across various sources to facilitate monthly cycle meeting and APAC MBU Brick & Click Sales performance : active tracking of transaction metrices, what works, what doesn’t, to enable RO to be able to work with KAs and Marketing to strengthen B&C Devise trackers on best-sellers and OOS status for RO and BAs to trigger replenishment as this is currently performed by TM on an ongoing basis. Understand market trends, consumer demographic, store traffic flow Consolidate feedback from BAs/KAs on promotions, mechanics, store/competitor performance to objectively analyse drivers of performance.  BA Productivity Monthly compilation of BA scorecard (BA IPT and AUS, average unit sale, BA ranking), identify productivity improvement to improve upselling and cross-selling Understand BA performance, as a collective and individually: between OTC and Animation, and overall. Attend Trainings scheduled by Trainer, acquire feedback from TM and KA. Sales $ brought in vs Cost $ per BA. Understand drivers (store location, brand allocation, shift changes, Quarter/Period). Work with RO, TRG to get BAs to deliver more.  Competitor Analysis Monthly consolidation of competitive action (Trade, PR) at DS and Sephora and island-wide: Chanel, Dior, YSL, Tom Ford, GA, Hermes, Bvlgari, D&G, Jo Malone, Diptyque, Versace, Montblanc, Coach Online and B&C  WHAT YOU’LL BRING ESSENTIAL: Able to commit for at least 6 months (Jan to Jun 2022) of full-time internship. Strong computer knowledge skills (Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Words, Outlook and Power BI) Ability to synthesize and interpret technical data Enjoy doing research and analysed data for consumer goods, makeup and beauty products. Strong oral and written communication skills People and task oriented Salesforce knowledge/experience a plus Self-Motivated, with a strong work ethic and a sense of confidentiality. Possesses cross-cultural awareness and high emotional intelligence. Able to work independently, demonstrate initiative and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Persuasive, resilient and flexible, able to easily adapt to new challenges. Passionate, enthusiastic and driven to regularly follow-up with loose ends. Able to thrive despite challenges while adopting a positive attitude under pressure.  Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you’re the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible – we’d love to hear from you.  Interested applicants may also send an email directly to LiFang_Tng@cotyinc.com.

description: The BD Intern role will be a key in achieving this goal, since the person would be assisting in managing an important pillar of the business, our cleaner partners. The individual should have both the ability to think sharply and execute at a fast pace. You will be reporting to the Business Development Manager of the home cleaning business unit, and the BD intern would be expected to:  · Connect with our cleaner partners to understand areas of improvement, and scale high quality service  · Assist in the process of onboarding cleaner partners, maintaining quality of partners  · Manage inventory purchasing, and weekly/monthly financial reporting to our partner companies  · Assist in business planning and implementing needle moving initiatives for the category  · Create service delivery norms and processes for the category, and help implement them  · Work cross functionally with product, marketing, and finance to drive business needs  · Able to commit for a min. of 4 months    A bit of you:  · You are an undergraduate  · You’re a self-starter who is comfortable working autonomously  · You're relentless and will not easily give up after a few setbacks  · You have a growth mindset  · You have past B2C/B2C sales experience (preferred)  · You are not looking for a 9-6 job    What you will learn from this job:  · Communication with different stakeholders and external partners  · Building up a strong sales funnel to achieve monthly targets  · Fast execution on different projects and tasks  · Strategic thinking to optimise processes and create new business plans  · Trying fast and failing fast, taking key learnings from each iteration

The ideal candidate will have experience in all stages of the sales cycle. They should be confident with building new client relationships and maintaining existing ones. They should have evidence of strong skills and possess good negotiation skills.   Responsibilities Build relationships with prospective partners Design and execute account plans to build deeper relationships and grow sales for each key customer. Generate new business leads to establish high acquisition numbers on a monthly basis. You will be expected to develop service, retain our existing partners as well as acquire new business opportunities via phone call. Manage the portfolio of existing partners and potential partners via phone call. Liaising closely with relevant departments to ensure that their queries, problems or issues are dealt with appropriately. Analyze the market and establish competitive advantages Track metrics to ensure targets are hit Identifying and evaluating partnership opportunities

Fonterra Singapore is hiring interns. Apply today!  We are recruiting the next batch of interns to start from mid- December. There are more than 10 vacancies to be filled across different business units – marketing, sales, foodservice etc.  Our internship program is designed to give you a hands-on experience in the corporate world which will give you the extra edge in your future job application.  What we are looking for  Candidates must be undergraduates in their final year of study at a local University in Singapore. Graduates will not be considered for this program. Self-starters with the ability to work independently with minimum supervision. Proactive, passionate, innovative, possess a "can do" attitude and have critical analytical thinking skills. Team players with excellent communication, presentation and project management skills. Able to commit to a 6-month internship from 15 December 2021 to 30 June 2022. Advanced Excel and Powerpoint skills All applicants must have eligibility to work in Singapore without sponsorship of a work visa.  Vacancies available   Active Living Marketing Intern -https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6296&company=C0001206658P  AFP Developing Markets Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6268&company=C0001206658P  Chef Trainee  Chilled DF Marketing Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6327&company=C0001206658P  Foodservice Development Market Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6328&company=C0001206658P  Global Channel - Marketing Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6361&company=C0001206658P  Data & Analytics Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6269&company=C0001206658P  Global Marketing Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6325&company=C0001206658P  Global Sales Strategy Intern - DCM  Global Sales Strategy Intern - RTM - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6418&company=C0001206658P  Regional Marketing Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6326&company=C0001206658P  RGM & MT Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6318&company=C0001206658P  Sales Capability Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6319&company=C0001206658P  Strategic Business Development - Data Analytics Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6269&company=C0001206658P  Trade Marketing & Ecommerce Intern - https://career10.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=6267&company=C0001206658P  Our Story Fonterra Cooperative Group is a farmer owned co-operative dairy company and the world’s largest dairy exporter. Our New Zealand-made dairy products are enjoyed in 140 markets across the globe. Our products are loved by people for their balanced nutrition, quality craftsmanship and sheer indulgence. Anlene™, Anchor™, Anmum™, are among the best known dairy brands in Asia and the rest of the world. With more than 150 offices and sites around the world, Fonterra can offer a great range of career pathways across our business.  Let your internship journey start here!  Please submit a copy of your CV and a cover letter specifying the position you are applying for, thank you.  Note:  1)  Only students who are able to commit for the entire period of internship from 15 December 2021 to 30 June 2022 will be considered. 2)   Selected student will be required to apply for a “Leave of Absence” to complete this internship if you are applying for a non credit-bearing internship.  3) Position will be closed as soon as a suitable candidate is identified.

For the role as a Corporate Sales Intern, the job scope will be as below: Handling of corporate customer inquiries, purchases, and fulfillment. Attain new corporate customers Build and maintain good relationships with existing and/or new corporate customers and vendors. Prepare reports for payment history and tracking, sales, and sales summary. description: Who we are:  At One Good Team, we believe in making technology simple and accessible for everyone. Our pilot product to the market, One Good Card, Singapore's first and only Smart Name Card, born to eradicate the wastage of paper name cards.   We deeply believe that the world needs smarter, safer and more sustainable means of digital connectivity, especially in the pandemic.  Our team is young, dynamic, and bold. As our company name suggests, there is nothing we embody more than team excellence. We believe in team collaboration and value every input, no hierarchies. If this is what you are looking for, read on!   What you can look forward to:  Liaising, building rapport and managing clients and relationships Identifying new clients and potential business growth opportunities Maintaining and achieving customer satisfaction in pursuit of business targets Building key sales funnels for effective inbound and outbound lead generation Gaining new experiences in crafting cross-functional campaigns  Opportunities to pitch ideas and solutions to prospective clients   What you’ll need:  Good written and verbal communication skills Strong customer-centric and success driven mentality A creative eye with strong attention to details Ability to understand and cater to clients’ needs Highly adaptable with good critical thinking Knowledge of image manipulation tools and software (e.g Canva, Adobe Photoshop etc) Ability to work efficiently in a hybrid/remote environment Preferably possesses a background in business-related courses    You will be an awesome fit here if:  You are passionate about personal growth and career development You are a self-motivated individual and takes initiative to solve business problems You want to expand your knowledge on real and applicable cross-functional skillsets used in the workforce You believe in making the best out of any opportunities that comes your way You are a good communicator and genuinely enjoy interacting with people You are keen in experiencing work in a fast paced and dynamic start-up environment Believe in accelerating the future of Digital Transformation with us!  We welcome you even if you have no prior experience in Business Development or sales, as long as you are hungry for growth and keen to learn the ropes.  If this describes you, a One Good Hello because we want you!

You will be reporting to the Business Development Manager of the home cleaning business unit,  Responsibilities: · Connect with our cleaner partners to understand areas of improvement, and scale high quality service · Assist in the process of onboarding cleaner partners, maintaining quality of partners · Manage inventory purchasing, and weekly/monthly financial reporting to our partner companies · Assist in business planning and implementing needle moving initiatives for the category · Create service delivery norms and processes for the category, and help implement them · Work cross functionally with product, marketing, and finance to drive business needs · Able to commit for a min. of 4 months  A bit of you: · You are an undergraduate · You’re a self-starter who is comfortable working autonomously · You're relentless and will not easily give up after a few setbacks · You have a growth mindset · You have past B2C/B2C sales experience (preferred) · You are not looking for a 9-6 job  What you will learn from this job: · Communication with different stakeholders and external partners · Building up a strong sales funnel to achieve monthly targets · Fast execution on different projects and tasks · Strategic thinking to optimise processes and create new business plans · Trying fast and failing fast, taking key learnings from each iteration

What you will do Spend time in a hands-on training environment learning how to execute on the top priorities of Gartner’s sales organization Work with a Gartner sales team and their clients/prospects to understand best practices for engagement, retention and growth Hone your skills by participating in sales and retention activities alongside your aligned sales team Gain real-time sales experience through shadowing sales associates and practicing different components of Gartner’s sales process What you will need Enrollment in a Bachelor’s degree program with expected graduation date within a year of successfully completing the internship program Exceptional communication skills Financial motivation, driven by working in a results-based, goal-focused environment A competitive nature and curiosity, demonstrated by extracurricular involvement in clubs or the community Leadership or work experience to supplement strong student achievement What you will get Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) and more! Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities Who are we?  Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s most critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have nearly 16,000 associates globally that support our 14,000+ clients in more than 100 countries .  What makes Gartner a great place to work?  Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a variety of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner  What We Offer  Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.  The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.  Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. description: THE ROLE We are looking for a Brand Assistant Intern who is committed for a 6 months internship program. The individual will be equipped with marketing skills and provide with knowledge of various marketing strategies under a fast-paced work environment.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Work across multiple brands in the Southeast Asia and Korea region spanning the B2B and B2C channels to drive brand awareness and growth.  Data Analysis & Reporting: Support the brand team in tracking and analyzing monthly reporting including competitor and market research, trend updates and sales reports Brand & Product Marketing: Building launch and promotional plans for B2B and B2C brands across various channels at a regional scope, work with multiple countries on execution and tracking of KPIs, engage in Performance and eCommerce marketing Social Media: Strategize and plan social media calendar including social media management, community management and reporting Channel Management: Assist in brand marketing and visual merchandising across various marketplaces: professional salons, premium retail, drugstores and e-Commerce Marketing Collateral: Assist in the creation of regional brand assets for B2B and B2C brands including digital, retail and salon assets, brand video shoots and photo shoots PR: Assist in the planning, creation and seeding of PR kits to influencers General Administration: Assist in sampling/tester management, collaborate with internal teams and external agencies to execute projects in a timely fashion, handle ad-hoc marketing tasks when required  QUALIFICATIONS Strong desire to learn along with professional drive Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent knowledge of MS Office and Social Media (Facebook, Instagram) eCommerce and Performance marketing experience is a plus Must have excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize in a fast-changing environment Passion for the FMCG and Marketing industry Ability to work independently and as part of a larger team Proactive problem prevention and issue resolution ability Diploma / Degree in marketing - related discipline

description: Nonic is an FMCG brand based in India and have launched its range of eco-friendly bamboo toothbrush and garbage bags in Singapore. The company will be launching other plastic alternative products as well soon. Our aim is to help consumers to make a shift towards a zero-waste lifestyle. We make products which are good for our environment and customers. Currently, we are selling through Lazada and shoppe.   While working for this internship you will get an opportunity to work towards sustainability and gain industry experience  Intern's day-to-day responsibilities include:  Work on e-commerce strategies Formulate strategies for retail and online sales Run digital marketing campaigns on Lazada and Shopee Implement Sales development strategies Handle Social Media Accounts  This is a Work From Home Internship. Duration- 1 month

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  The intern will support selected initiatives involving the key areas of Field Sales Channel priorities through research, analysis, creative input, reporting, and coordination as required per initiative.  Responsibilities Develop and automate dashboards, analysis and reports to support business functions Collaborate with a team to make data-driven decisions Maintain the integrity of the data as the "single source of truth" Assess KPIs, perform root cause analyses, take charge for the accuracy of the calculations of these KPIs Support on Sales Program Initiative Requirements Minimum commitment period for 3 months, starting as soon as possible from October/November 2021 onwards Undergraduate pursuing a data related degree Excellent analytical skills and stakeholder management Experience with G-suite products, Excel, data visualization tools is a plus Prior internship experience with Marketing Campaign or Digital Marketing is a plus Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

description: About Lendor  Lendor is a marketplace platform with an extensive library of things that users can rent from partner businesses and share with trusted peers for short term use.  By enabling item owners to share their library of things with others, Lendor encourages collaborative consumption, less wastage, and allows purchases to go the extra mile.  We are a startup in the sustainable urban solution vertical looking for passionate and like-minded individuals to be part of an exciting period of penetrating the market.  Fancy working in an exciting and promising tech marketplace Startup based in Singapore with the power to effect change in consumer patterns? We are located in a highly energetic One-North area to Immerse yourself in the latest tech and media startups. Amongst its key investors are Rocket Internet, Mangrove Capital, Lakestar, Unilever and Accel Partners. It currently operates in 10 strategic markets: Australia, Germany, Italy, France, Ireland, UK, UAE, the Netherlands, Switzerland and Singapore.  Job Description As our Sales and Marketing Intern, you tackle the challenges of scaling up our business and strategically planning its expansion. You will gain an inside perspective on internet ventures and will be given the opportunity to build up deep functional expertise. You will be placed in a team of very motivated and talented A-players who are driving our business forward. Our Venture Development internship is a unique opportunity to learn, experience and join a first-class team.  At Helpling, no two days are the same. The following tasks will be part of your new role: You work on scaling up the Helpling business in Singapore, exposing yourself to key aspects of the business - mainly Sales and Partnerships. To establish and maintain a framework to scale up our existing partnership programs. Collaborate with internal stakeholders and identify strategic partners and key suppliers. To build and monitor partners' development plans with strategic partners and key suppliers with target engagements initiatives.  Remuneration $800 per month

We are looking for someone motivated, detail-oriented and customer-centric to support our Sales and Customer Care Team as we scale up. If you believe in delighting customers, have high standards, and are resourceful, we want to hear from you. Help create a world class customer experience for external and internal stakeholders. Build and maintain a documented system of order-to-invoice procedures. Provide best-in-class customer support to our key corporate and residential customers. Constantly think about how to improve our internal sales operations processes. Reply and resolve customer conversations. Work effectively with cross-functional teams to communicate insights from customer interaction and feedback for product and service improvement. Meet customer satisfaction score and average response time targets. Follow and assist in improving communications guidelines and policies. Always go the extra mile to delight customers.  We’re looking for someone with: Preferably an existing student in local school (university/polytechnic/ITE) Strong management and communication skills. Detailed oriented. Desire to go the extra mile to delight customers. Intellectual curiosity. Ability to start and get things done. Ability to handle ambiguity.  What’s in it for you: Work with a fast growing, at the same time, lean and mean team, to make real world impact. Have a lot of ownership and drive your own results and progression. Smart people who sweat the details and push for the highest standards.

description: Job Reference #  235814BR  City  Singapore, Singapore  Your role  Do you want to help our clients buy and sell equities, foreign currencies, interest rates and credit? You’ll help our clients buy and sell on the phone and using our online systems (on a client team) be promoting products and trading opportunities to clients based on an in-depth understanding of their needs and investment styles (as a sales trader) be the link between clients and traders, giving clients useful information about what’s happening in the markets and executing their trades at the best prices (as a trader) seek the best prices to execute our clients’ sales orders and make markets in listed and over-the-counter equities, equity derivatives and equity-linked securities  Your team  You’ll be working in Global Markets, looking after professional investors like asset managers and fund managers. You’ll give them advice and do everything that’s needed to buy and sell securities for them. From start to finish. You’ll be able to draw on the strength of our platforms, products, services and people worldwide to give your clients whatever they need.  Diversity helps us grow, together. That’s why we are committed to fostering and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion. It strengthens our business and brings value to our clients.  Your expertise  You need to be graduating in Dec 2023 to Jun 2024 (after deferring your studies to join the program), and with less than two years of work experience. You also need to have the legal rights to work in the location you have applied to.  It doesn’t matter what you’re studying. (Really, it doesn’t.) But we’d like to see evidence that you can analyze a problem, take a view and come to a decision plan, organize and communicate well make things happen stick with a task work in a team come up with ideas Perhaps you’ve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or persevered and passed an exam in a subject you found challenging? Think about how things you’ve achieved match the skills we’re after.  About Us  Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.  We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?  Join us  We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.  Disclaimer / Policy Statements  UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.
industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking

description: About Have Halal, Will Travel (HHWT)  HHWT is the leading lifestyle and travel platform for Muslims in Asia, with a reach of almost 10 million monthly. More about us: Forbes 30 under 30 award Our work with STB Our work with Microsoft  Key Responsibilities  We are a start-up that embraces talent from diverse backgrounds. We hire regardless of race, gender, language or religion. Be prepared to roll up your sleeves and work in a dynamic and exciting environment!  This is a position based in Singapore. All the best!

description: Moët Hennessy Diageo Singapore (MHDS) aims at making our commercial organization agile and efficient to deliver on our promises to shaping change, cultural and operational transformation. Our vision is to lead the future of luxury wines and spirits from nature to communities. Our company success will be created by pioneering people with passion for crafting experiences and turning challenges into opportunities to innovate.   Our strength comes from being diverse, yet we are unified by five core values: Sharing, Elegance, Epicureanism, Integrity and Spirit of conquest. It starts from creating an efficient and caring work environment where all can reach their full potential. Being respectful, inclusive and embracing diversity makes others feel valued. In MHDS, we strive to search for harmony, moderation and concentrate on the essential. We always open up new territories and push the limits. Our commitment to the planet, to our Maisons, and to our employees is what we believe in and makes us different.  As a Trade Marketing Intern, you will be required to plan, execute and monitor programs / Point of Sales Materials for Off & On -Trade channel and ecommerce platforms; delivering on time, in full and within budget. You will be working closely with Brand team to ensure all Point of Sales Materials adhere to branding guidelines. You will be responsible to ensure that branding and merchandising are delivered on time, in full and to agreed budgets. Your key responsibilities include:-  Wholesaler/Traditional Off-Trade Management: Work with wholesalers /sales team to ensure excellence in execution for Traditional Off-Trade (Convenience Stores, Mom-and-Pop Stores)/ On Trade. Ensure that all visibility and Point of Sale material is placed in appropriate outlets and is optimally placed to influence shopper choice eCommerce: Work with key account manager to discuss on promotions and displays monthly; ensure promotion forms and artwork are submitted on time; New product listings – to maintain price page with new product listings, create contents to list into eCommerce platforms Reporting: Track and monitor RSP and competition activities for key customers in all Off-Trade accounts including eCommerce sites; Track and analyze weekly Off-Trade depletion data Events: Manage and arrange participation of wine and whisky fairs, dinners & events Daily admin matters   In MHDS, we are fully devoted to becoming a place where people aspire to work by ensuring our people are empowered and all voices are heard. We continue to strengthen our commitment to building our company which values inclusivity, honesty and authenticity. You will have the opportunity to be part of an innovative and cross-cultural environment, where you will be encouraged to develop your entrepreneurial and pioneering spirit. We encourage our people to pursue their career aspirations as well as mobility opportunities across countries and within both Moët Hennessy and the LVMH Group.   Preferred Period of Internship : Dec 2021 – May 2022  If you are:- Highly motivated individual, self-starter, energetic and enthusiastic Passionate about brands and consumers Sensitive to trends and styles Results and quality orientated Able to plan, organize and prioritize well Team oriented yet independent Creative problem solving Able to communicate effectively at all levels, both internally and externally  Join us for an exciting career journey with Moët Hennessy Diageo Singapore!
industries: Wine and Spirits

description: Sales / Marketing internship – (Paid role) Duration: 6 to 12 months. Role to be filled in as soon as possible. Format: part time to Full time, depending on the candidates. Location: Singapore Role open to Singaporeans, SG PR, or foreign students holding a permit to work in SG (or with approved university internship program).  The PFEIFER Group is a 450-year-old German based company, involved in the Building & Construction industry. PFEIFER Structures is a division of the PFEIFER Group, present in Asia, USA, Dubai, and Europe.  PFEIFER Structures is the leading single-source partner for innovative lightweight structures, building envelopes, and kinetic structures around the world. Our expertise starts with decades of experience in tensile structures including cables, tension rods, and membranes but does not end there. As pioneers in lightweight architecture, we consult, provide, and install ambitious projects in any material from steel to wood to membranes, glass, or other materials that are yet to be invented. https://pfeifer-structures.com/  Our Singapore office is looking for a Sales & Marketing intern who enjoys analyzing data or trends for the purposes of planning, forecasting, advising, budgeting, reporting, or sales opportunities. You will support the APAC team to manage digital marketing presence for Pfeifer Structures (SG) Pte Ltd.  Responsibilities ·        Participate in 6- 12 months internship ·        Support leaders in developing growth strategies for the B2B in APAC and to identify key clients (contractors, main contractors) & influencers (architect / engineering firms / consultants / developers) ·        Managing the CRM tool (Salesforce) relating to database, digital marketing campaign and leads ·        Conduct research and analyse CRM data and recommend strategies for customer acquisition  ·        Any ad hoc duties as assigned  Requirements ·        Bachelor in sales / marketing / digital marketing or above ·        Strong in English communication ·        Interested in technical / engineering / building & construction environment ·        Curious and independent with strong passion for marketing and business development ·        Experience working with Salesforce will be an added advantage ·        Strategic-minded and detail oriented Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please send in your resumes to info.pss@pfeifer.de to apply before September 30th, 2021  PFEIFER STRUCTURES (SG) Pte. Ltd. | 341 B, Beach Road, Unit #03-00, 199567 Singapore

Job Description  About the company:  Water is a global issue, where less than 3% of the earth’s remaining water are clean. Fluidlytix is a water tech company that specialises in sustainable water solutions. With our solutions, our clients save up to 30% on their water bills and observe up to 6% reduction in water usage.  Roles and Responsibilities   Fluidlytix Asia is a water technology company with the main goal of promoting sustainable solutions for optimal water consumption. This includes physical pipeline technological solutions coupled with our cutting-edge IoT water solution. The company is looking for driven individuals that are willing to work in a start-up environment with diverse learning opportunities.   The interns will work closely with our founders and will be taking responsibility in multiple roles to drive the growth of our business. Some insights into the role will include the formulation of expansion strategies for our newly developed IoT solution and the expansion of the pipeline for our WAVE valve technology.  Commitment 3 times a week (Flexible working arrangement)  Requirements   Good written skills in English  Bilingual in both English and a mother tongue will be a bonus Meticulous and detail-orientated  Ability to work in a diverse environment  Proficient in Excel and Powerpoint  Interest in sales and business development

About Us  We pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated, omni-channel women's fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010, we have grown to 250 people strong, with our headquarters in Singapore, and country offices in Indonesia, and Malaysia, omni-channel presence across the 3 markets, retail franchise in Cambodia, and international e-commerce to 11 other markets - Hong Kong, China, Australia, New Zealand, US, Canada, Japan, Philippines, Vietnam, Thailand and Brunei.  We are taking our definition of new female retail global, with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman.  The team  The Love, Bonito team is a passionate, dynamic, innovative and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers, savvy marketers to tech whizzes, we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer, the Love, Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative, data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences, products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission, we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate, fearless and entrepreneurial.  If you’re looking for a dynamic, no corporate-BS environment to learn, grow, and really make an impact, we could be the perfect fit for you!  The role  As an intern in the Commercial team, you’ll have a front seat experience in impacting women across the globe. Learn how we bring our assortment from ideas to market and experience how the team uses hard data, consumer insights and commercial instinct to make impactful decisions for our Love, Bonito Community.  You should have / be A Love, Bonito Culture Fit Good grasp of the Love, Bonito brand and unique proposition An interest in Fashion and Merchandising A self starter, get-your-hands dirty attitude Enjoy learning new things and pick them up quickly Knack for solving problems with agility and creativity Strong communication skills Numerically inclined, data-savvy and able to leverage on data to make decisions Main Responsibilities  Assortment Support in collection development Assist in styles grading summary tabulation after monthly assortment alignment meeting with design team Gather data and put together market research on competitors, pricing & assortment Support in maintaining accurate & consistent information updates in various internal tools for assortment planning Generate order sheets for all buys and arrange into requested format Liaise cross functional departments for launch plan information dissemination Support in project management. Close follow ups with cross functional departments on to-dos in order to achieve seamless launch of assortment/ key projects Merchandising Support team in monthly assortment curation such as impulse items to be sold in our retail stores Assist to compile historical performance data to aid buyers in decision making Support the ECOM buyer in managing the ECOM portfolio which include, but is not limited to, requests submission to internal teams for onsite feature enhancements that impacts sales, assist in curated pages product shortlisting Prepare monthly sharing decks to educate the Retail team on selling points in the upcoming month’s collection as well as review previous month’s Top and Bottom sellers Requirements Availability for at least 3 months High attention to detail, logical and analytical Knowledge in fashion industry landscape is a plus Preferably final year student or recent university graduate with coursework related to merchandise planning, category management and/or similar discipline Benefits Market level internship salary and benefits provided
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Retail

description: Job Description Assist in conceptualising, developing and executing marketing campaigns for at least one category (e.g. Electronics, Health & Beauty, Fashion, Home & Living). Collaborate and coordinate across stakeholders, including working with internal key account managers, business intelligence, and other marketing functions (e.g. social media, partnerships, PR, online marketing, offline marketing, graphic designers) for campaign creation and optimisation. Conduct data analysis on campaigns performance (including against order and GMV targets) and offer ongoing recommendations for campaign optimization, such as innovative ideas, partnerships and activations that enhance campaigns performance. Keep abreast of trends on social media, e-Commerce, digital marketing and industry developments, and leverage trends and developments to optimise campaigns. Depending on capacity and capability, opportunity to support planning and execution of Big Campaigns, including major sales (e.g. 11.11), seasonal festivals (e.g. Chinese New Year, Christmas) and other major cross-category campaigns.  Requirements Currently pursuing a/enrolled in Bachelor's Degree or Diploma in Communications/ Marketing or related field. Excellent stakeholder and project management skills. Strong ability to manage expectations, drive for performance and collaborate with internal stakeholders under tight timelines and pressure. Independent and self-motivated, with good end-to-end ownership of projects. Open to taking on new and ambiguous projects. Able to multi-task and prioritise under pressure. An analytical and structured thinker, strong with understanding and deriving insights from data. Strong communication and writing skills. Good command of English. Prior internships in marketing, e-commerce platforms, creative agencies will be a bonus. Please state your availability clearly in the comments section (Start date, End date, part-time or full-time) Only full-time interns will be considered (6 months, around January to May/July 2022)

Job Responsibilities and Duties: (Minimum 3 months)  We are looking for a highly motivated person who can work with all levels of the organization - senior business and technology leaders, product, operations, sales, and finance teams, and be considered as a high-level expert in the credit cards, eWallet and payment domain.  As a Business Analyst, the candidate will need to leverage a consultative approach to enable business teams to meet our customer and internal stakeholder needs. He / She will act as a liaison between the business client and technical organization by planning, conducting, and directing the analysis of complex business problems to be solved through the payment platform.  Assist requirements gathering sessions to understand business problems. He / She must understand how the proposed system enhancements will address these problems while assessing impact to existing functionality and business processes.  Some Of The Work You Will Be Learning Translate business requirement into confluence, user stories and other relevant documentation. Create wireframe or prototype Perform user acceptance testing where necessary. Assist relevant stakeholders for integration and implementation. Essential Requirements Degree in IT-related discipline (Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Business Analytics or other relevant majors Some experience with Agile project methodologies Ability to develop partnerships, negotiate and collaborate with other business and functional areas within a matrix environment and build effective business partnerships with all levels of team members Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Conflict management and decision-making skills Basic Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) skills Basic hands-on experience on SQL to select and analyse the teething issues during implementations Desired Skills: Some experience in Agile framework and writing user stories Experience with Jira/Confluence/Trello Experience with mockup design tools such as Balsamiq, Adobe XD, etc. Knowledge and understanding of Use Cases Ability to draft and define negative or exception cases for every user story that is being groomed Ability to present effectively to both business and technical audiences at all levels of the organization Ability to present and communicate effectively through remote virtual tools like Google Meet, Skype, Teams, Zoom Application procedures Email Resume transcript Red Dot Payment is a payment gateway/solutions company founded in Singapore, with footprints in various countries such as Indonesia, Thailand, Australia and more to come. We are a part of PayU - a leading financial services provider in global growth markets, with operations in Asia, Central and Eastern Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa.  Our mission is to provide solutions to our clients' online payment needs. Designing a Payment technology system around a solid understanding of our clients' specific business process is one of our core competencies. We believe that the people in our team is the core of the Company. Join us in our exciting journey as we expand and grow our business.  About Us  At PayU, we are a global fintech investor and our vision is to build a world without financial borders where everyone can prosper. We give people in high-growth markets the financial services and products they need to thrive. Our expertise in 18 high-growth markets enables us to extend the reach of financial services. This drives everything we do, from investing in technology entrepreneurs, to offering credit to underserved individuals, to helping merchants buy, sell and operate online. Being part of Prosus, one of the largest technology investors in the world, gives us the presence and expertise to make a real impact. Find out more www.payu.com  Our Commitment To Building A Diverse And Inclusive Workforce  As a global and multi-cultural organization with varied ethnicities thriving across locations, we realize that our responsibility towards fulfilling the D&I commitment is huge. Therefore, we continuously strive to create a diverse, inclusive and safe environment, for all of our people, communities and customers. Our leaders are committed to create an inclusive work culture which enables transparency, flexibility and unbiased attention to each and every PayUneer so they can succeed, irrespective of gender, color or personal faith. An environment where every person feels they belong, that they are listened to, and where they are empowered to speak up. At PayU we have zero tolerance towards any form of prejudice whether a specific race, ethnicity, or of persons with disabilities or the LGBTQ communities.

description: Interested in a career in Sales? Work hand-in-hand with our global sales team and gain hands-on experience. From business development projects to client meetings, we are looking for somebody who can help us drive our sales activities to the next level.  The Company  Bambu is a Fintech company with 70+ peeps. We are B2B, which means we only develop tech for financial institutions. Our platform helps users save and invest for their future, so we like to think we’re helping people in some small way. The plan for us is to make the platform intelligent piece-by-piece, to help people manage their spending and money every day.We’re a fast-growing startup based in Singapore, with branch offices in Kuala Lumpur, Hong Kong, London, San Francisco, and Dubai. Founded in 2016, and largely privately owned by the founders and employees, we have the financial backing of one of the world’s leading players in our industry in Franklin Templeton. We have clients in every continent except Antarctica. Yeah, we’re still working on that. Oh, and we also launched Singapore’s first robo-advisor platform back in 2016 with Crossbridge Connect.Did I mention the awards? No? Well… We won the Best Early Stage Startup at Fintech Finals 2017 and the Best Show Award in FinovateAsia 2017 for our machine learning algorithms. We are also Alumni of SuperCharger 2.0 Accelerator program and finalist at Jumpstart organized by Alibaba Entrepreneurs Fund.More about the culture at Bambu: https://medium.com/bambu-life/the-selfless-startup-e5130c6d9aa5  What we’re offering A chance to interact and work with key Bambu players (don’t be surprised if you find yourself having a casual chat about your favorite hobbies with our CEO). An experience that will help you determine if this is the right career path and industry for you! A space to develop and execute your own ideas. We are always looking for a fresh perspective. Killer office with pretty decent perks. We take care of our people. What you need to do to manage your own lead generation project including research & qualification of new clients to help managing databases in our CRM (Hubspot) to assist in maintaining, updating & translating sales materials to work with our sales team on the strategy of new product launches to create sales reports for our global sales team to attend our weekly global sales meeting and client meetings to assist in market & industry research Required Skills And Experience You will be business-minded, be passionate about sales & tech and have the ability to work in a high-energy sales team environment You are confident and have excellent communications skills Having experience in the fields of admin & sales would be advantageous but NOT required Good communication skills in English (written & verbal communication) Min. 6 months of internship, full or part-time possible

description: About Action X Action X is a fast-growing company based in Singapore that has international market presence in SE Asia and China. Action X aims to inspire and enable individuals to maximize their potential through gamification of sports and fitness training. Action X understands the importance of technological capabilities and data science for to improve quality of human lives and allow people to unlock their potential to achieve their dreams and goals. We created a technology master plan that builds on our expertise in sports entertainment and gamification. In view of the Covid-19 global pandemic, sporting events and way of life have greatly transformed, and it has greatly impacted Action X's core business of engaging the public with our events. Thus, Action X wants to achieve digital transformation of our offline running events to online business through the creation of online fitness app. This digital transformation will continue to allow us to address our target audience social needs which is to socialize through a large-scale sports activity. The digital transformation by adopting new technological product will help Action X to continue delivering our services to targeted customers and to stay relevant and competitive in the sports industry.  Job Description： We are looking for talented and motivated people to work with us together. You will have the opportunity of working closely with a team of top-tier investors who have inspiring ideas for the VC industry in Southeast Asia. During the program, you will build a good understanding of the venture capital industry, discover in-depth knowledge of the SEA startup landscape, and gain hands-on investment experience.  Responsibilities: Take charge of research and establishment of the Investment Fund with Support from  CEO and Hd Strategic Partnerships. Provide admin support in the establishment of the Investment Fund. Support CEO and Hd Strategic Partnerships in developing Pitch material for Fundraising. Execute Fund Raising Campaigns and pitching at investment roadshows. Support the development of Investment Strategies and fundraising strategies for the investment fund as well as Action X portfolio companies. Ability to converse well with customers Preferably with skills of customer service, sales, marketing, customer relations  Working hours 9:00am-6:00pm The 3 months will be a probation period for observation and getting to know the company operations better Job Types: Full-time /Part-time /Internship Salary: Market Rate  Work Remotely

jobTitle: TD Internship - Fixed Income & Foreign Exchange Sales (Front Office) (January 2022 to June 2022)
description: TD Bank Group  Headquartered in Toronto, Canada, with approximately 90,000 employees in offices around the world, the Toronto-Dominion Bank and its subsidiaries are collectively known as TD Bank Group (TD). TD offers a full range of financial products and services to over 26 million customers worldwide through three key business lines: Canadian Retail including TD Canada Trust, Business Banking, TD Auto Finance (Canada), TD Wealth (Canada), TD Direct Investing and TD Insurance U.S. Retail including TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank, TD Auto Finance (U.S.), TD Wealth (U.S.) and TD’s investment in Schwab Wholesale Banking including TD Securities  TD had CDN$1.7 trillion in assets on July 31, 2021. TD also ranks among the world’s leading online financial services firms, with more than 15 million active online and mobile customers. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges under the symbol "TD". In Singapore, TD operates as The Toronto-Dominion Bank, Singapore Branch and Toronto Dominion (South East Asia) Limited, which are collectively known as “TD Singapore” since 1979. The key business in Singapore is TD Securities which is part of Wholesale Banking.  Internship Program The successful intern will have the opportunity to sit within the Fixed Income and Foreign Exchange sales teams during a 6 month-internship. They will gain real life experience in a dealing room environment. Learning what it takes to interact with trading teams, work as team and observe what it takes to be a top performing salesperson in financial markets. They will acquire broad banking knowledge and improve their technical understanding of financial markets products.  Objectives The intern will aim to gain a strong understanding of the following:  Exposure to a wide variety of fixed income and foreign exchange markets Fixed income and foreign exchange product pricing -FX: Spot, Forwards, Swaps, NDFs -FI: Rates, Credit, Derivatives Fixed income and foreign exchange trading and risk management Fixed income and foreign exchange sales and distribution Primary fixed income markets Macroeconomics, the fundamental driver of fixed income and foreign exchange demand and supply The importance of fixed income and foreign exchange at Toronto Dominion Bank  Attributes The intern should possess the following attributes: Team-oriented attitude Strong communication skills Interest in financial markets with a specific focus on fixed income and currencies Prior experience in a financial institution will be advantageous Demonstrates initiative, flexibility and commitment Ability to handle pressure and work in a fast-paced environment Ability and willingness to learn tasks quickly Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, including WORD, POWERPOINT and EXCEL Proficiency in VBA will be a plus Good command of English  Requirements Year 2 and Year 3 Undergraduates Ability to commit for a 6-month full time internship from January 2022 until June 2022  Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.
industries: Investment Banking

description: Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 800 employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we’ve set out to build the future of AI.  We are looking for 2 results-driven and hands-on Business Development Associates (Interns) to support our Business Development Team! Our Business Development Team leads the initial part of the sales funnel and they are responsible for lead generation activities, sales qualification of inbound leads as well as running targeted outbound campaigns on target accounts. Each member in the team works closely with our team of Account Executives as well as collaborates with internal functions like Marketing.  Located in Singapore, the interns will be trained to source and consolidate leads for the APAC team. You will report and be mentored by our Director of Business Development, APAC who is also based in our Singapore location. This role is great for someone with little to no work experience, as we are looking to develop individuals who are keen to learn.  This internship will be a hybrid of remote working and in office. We require a minimum commitment of 4 months for this internship in order to ensure that we have ample time to train, invest in your learning and witness your performance.  You will contribute to the team by Proactively identify decision makers in the focused markets through creative research Utilize resources such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator and other external data sources Identify new leads in non-target accounts in specific target markets Collaborate with Business Development Representatives to execute focused market/vertical plans according to business priorities Work towards weekly targets in line with team goals Analyze and report on your weekly activities to identify potential optimizations You will be a great if you have Positive with a good learning attitude Interested in being a part of a fast-paced sales environment Exceptional organisational and planning skills and ability to prioritize Experience with Excel will be an added advantage Experience with LinkedIn Sales Navigator will be an added advantage Competitive with a desire to succeed Fresh Graduate are welcome to apply About Dataiku  Dataiku is the platform for Everyday AI, systemizing the use of data for exceptional business results. By making the use of data and AI an everyday behavior, Dataiku unlocks the creativity within individual employees to power collective success at companies of all sizes and across all industries. Don’t get us wrong: we are a tech company building software. Our culture is even pretty geeky! But our driving force is and will always remain people, starting with ours. We consider our employees to be our most precious asset, and we are committed to ensuring that each of them gets the most rewarding, enjoyable, and memorable work experience with us. Fly over to Instagram to learn more about our #dataikulife.  Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment.

description: Coty is a world leader in beauty and home to an illustrious roster of cosmetic, skincare and fragrance brands. And our company has a mission: to challenge the definition of beauty, to encourage authenticity and celebrate diversity. Because to us at Coty, beauty isn’t about conforming to somebody else’s ideal. It’s about inclusion and liberating everyone to shine in their unique way.  Coty helps millions of people around the world express your beauty, your way through our rich portfolio covering fragrance, skin care, colour cosmetics, and body care. Our brands include global icons like Gucci, Burberry, Hugo Boss, Calvin Klein, Philosophy, Max Factor, Rimmel, Bourjois, Sally Hansen, Adidas, David Beckham, etc. With more than one billion products shipped each year, the possibilities for self-expression are endless.  THE ROLE About the Role… Through this role, you’ll be able to gain an understanding of: How the SEA Distributor Business Unit functions and how to work with all markets to ensure best-in-class campaign executions. The Marketing Intern will play an integral role in enabling the business unit to achieve its business goals through operational and execution excellence for both online and offline channels. You will have the opportunity to work with multiple SEA Distributor Markets and with all brands under Coty. Your scope will cover a broad range of marketing projects such as building a marketing plan, managing PR activations, media and e-comm plans as well as rolling out various trade activations while ensuring maximum ROI. You will be involved in campaign ideation with the local teams, having regular connections with Global/Fashion House for plan approvals, and eventually bringing the plans to life.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Marketing Communications Activations Support the marketing team in building a robust 360 marketing communications plan with the Distributor Markets on upcoming Q3 & Q4 launches – primarily on Gucci Bloom EDT, Gucci Guilty Intense, Burberry HER EDT and CK Everyone EDP. Ensure all communications plans on PR, media and retailer platforms follow Global guidance and receive Global approval before execution. Maintain and disseminate marketing assets to relevant parties in a timely manner. Track, analyze and report on campaign effectiveness. Have regular connections with the Distributor Markets and be a strong source of support to enable them to meet the business objectives.  E-comm Planning & Activation Support the marketing and e-comm team to set up brand pages on potential sites. Work with Distributor Markets on suitable ad packages, paid KOL engagements and social content to drive awareness, consideration and ultimately, sales. Stay abreast of the competitive landscape and develop new initiatives such as sampling or special mechanics to drive trials.   WHAT YOU’LL BRING ESSENTIAL: Able to commit for at least 6 months (Jan - Jun 2022) for a full-time internship. Skilled in the use of MS Office tools including Outlook (or related email tool) Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Self-Motivated, with a strong work ethic and a sense of confidentiality. Possesses cross-cultural awareness and high emotional intelligence. Articulate, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Good balance of a professional attitude while having fun. Strong interest in consumer goods, makeup and beauty products. Strong desire to learn along with a strong sense of ownership. Persuasive, resilient and flexible, able to easily adapt to new challenges. Passionate, enthusiastic and driven to regularly follow up with loose ends. Able to thrive despite challenges while adopting a positive attitude under pressure.  DESIRABLE Agility to move quickly and easily in response to changes and challenges. Resilience and determination to see a project through to the end.  Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you’re the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible – we’d love to hear from you.  Interested applicants may also send an email directly to LiFang_Tng@cotyinc.com.

jobTitle: Regional Marketing Intern, Global Business Solutions
description: Internship Period: 1 January 2022 to 30 June 2022  This opportunity is for students who are available for a full-time internship, from January - June 2022 only  Reporting to the Regional Trade Marketing Manager, you'll be working closely with the Global Business Solutions team, responsible to contribute to the strategy, growth & earnings model for the portfolio.  Roles & Responsibilities:  Develop and execute marketing calendar and toolkits such as campaign playbooks, across key markets in partnership with sales teams and distributor teams in the ASEAN region such as Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Develop, review & implement changes in improving the sales funnel right up to the conversion. Engage with IMEX teams to understand their needs & deliver best-in-class execution. Conduct the deployment, monitoring, and impact assessment of the execution of related campaigns and toolkits. Support in analyzing the performance of the related campaign & materials deployed. Proactively provide suggestions to continuously improve performance. Work closely with Legal, Regulatory, and R&D team to ensuring alignment with country IMEX teams for effective implementation of the toolkits.   Requirements:  Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Business, or related disciplines. Proficient PC skills including MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Inquisitive, curious, and great at dealing with ambiguity. Possess strong analytical skills. Entrepreneurial, fast learning agility, and result-oriented. Strong communicator capable of building strong working relationships. Good team player with a positive outlook on work and Can-Do attitude. Focus on the outcome and be comfortable working in a lean organization. Fast decision-making.  Equality  In Return Reckitt offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation. Reckitt is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.
