description: Who are we? Crater Merch is a sharing economy platform for local artists to leverage on resources to build their own brand. Our mission is to empower local artists to create and sell their own merch easily.  We have successfully launched our first merch collection with 17 local artists, receiving local and international support from artists and the public.  As a youth-led startup, we are growing rapidly in our early-stage and are looking for part-time/full-time marketing and communications interns to support us in our mission.  If you are inspired to play a key role in building a one-stop platform to redefine how artists interact with their consumers, we would love to hear from you!  Duration of Internship: Part-time internship will be a minimum of 2 months, for 2-3 days a week Full-time internship will be 3-4 months from May-Jul/Aug 2022  As we are still early in our journey, please note that all of our internships are unpaid.  Job description: Assist in content strategy, creation and management on social media channels such as TikTok/Instagram/Linkedin Support in brand and marketing campaign strategies to increase sales and website traffic Participate in the creation of marketing collaterals for website or other ad-hoc design tasks if any Strategise for email marketing and craft newsletters to improve existing customer relationship  Requirements: Basic knowledge of the social media sphere (TikTok/Instagram/Linkedin), passionate about creating content is a plus! Good writing and interpersonal communication skills Able to work independently and in a team environment Strong sense of responsibility  How to Apply? Drop us an email along with your resume at marcus@cratermerch.com. Please also include your potential start date and internship duration. Let us know what you want to takeaway from this experience!   At Crater Merch, we're always on the lookout for like-minded team members who are proactive and dream big. No formal working experience is needed, students are welcome to apply!  For more information, visit our website at www.cratermerch.com/careers

This position reports to the General Manager, and interfaces with various stakeholders of the business.   The management trainee role provides the best opportunity for fresh graduates to undergo cross-functional rotations to gain optimum exposure to different facets of the business. The deserving management trainee can look forward to an accelerated career track to a middle management permanent role, and Dashmesh will be keen to sponsor the accelerated high-performer for further studies or professional qualifications after one year of traineeship.  Trainee to be involved in:  1.   Dashmesh e-Commerce activities - identifying customer needs and market trends; analyzing performance of e-Commerce platforms for improvements; Bring forward suggestions as to improve Dashmesh’s online efforts.  2. Dashmesh sales fulfilment activities - Accurately capturing customer orders; executing order creation, packing and delivery processes at back-office; invoicing customers and addressing their queries; performing incident or crisis management for gaps arising from order fulfilments 3. Dashmesh SCM operations - executing established and small-scale supply chain operations for customers; supporting sales, operations and accounting for suppliers; learning and applying operational policies, standards and procedures; assisting with contracts and documentations for trade transactions 4. Dashmesh warehouse operations - learning and supporting operations according to different warehousing situations and contingencies; performing stock-take, stock control, arrangement, rotation, and housekeeping of warehouse items 5. Dashmesh business IT projects - contributing to key activities and milestones in technology implementation projects for enhancing logistics and SCM processes

Or persevered and passed an exam in a subject you found challenging? Think about how things you’ve achieved match the skills we’re after.  About Us  Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.  We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?  Join us  We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.  Disclaimer / Policy Statements  UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

description: Sales & Marketing Intern  Casa Mia Coliving is looking for an enthusiastic Sales & Marketing Intern to join our team and provide creative ideas to help market and sell our services and build our brand. This internship exposes you to a new segment of the real estate industry, and requires a passion for problem solving and an innovative mindset. The internship will be structured around one or more projects. The duration date of internship can vary depending on the projects.  Responsibilities  Prepare promotional presentations and materials Help distribute marketing materials online (through social media) Collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data from online marketing campaigns Support all steps of the sales process Other job responsibilities to be determined based on skills and interests  Requirements  Currently enrolled in the penultimate year of a Bachelor's program. Concentration related to real estate is a plus Background or courses taken in marketing and/or sales Ability to speak and write in English fluently. Knowledge of one or more European languages (French, Spanish, German or Italian) is a plus Familiarity with marketing computer software and online applications (e.g. CRM tools, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, blogging tools) and social media networks (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter) Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to implement ideas Having a blog portfolio is a plus.

Internship Period: 1 January 2022 to 30 June 2022  This opportunity is for students who are available for a full-time internship, from January - June 2022 only. Application period: 22 September - 11 October 2021   Reporting to the Regional Head of General Trade, you will be responsible for the development and execution of Sales scorecards for the ASEAN region. This will involve collaboration with IT and Sales team to ensure all trackers are timely and accurate.   Roles & Responsibilities:  Work with Regional Sales and IT team to deliver Sales reports and other regional data formats Lead Sales validation of country sales scorecards, working with IT and In-market Sales teams Compiling ASEAN sales data charts for monthly/weekly reporting Coordinate with ASEAN Country teams for compiling data charts Use the fragmented data systems across ASEAN to combine IMS reports  Requirements:  Pursuing a degree or master's in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field Microsoft Office literacy essential (strong excel skills in data compilation and aggregation, e.g. sumifs, indirect function, pivot table, v/h lookup, etc.) Possess strong analytical skills Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Power BI, Excel, and other necessary tools, etc.  Equality  In Return Reckitt offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation. Reckitt is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.

description: Coty is a world leader in beauty and home to an illustrious roster of cosmetic, skincare and fragrance brands. And our company has a mission: to challenge the definition of beauty, to encourage authenticity and celebrate diversity. Because to us at Coty, beauty isn’t about conforming to somebody else’s ideal. It’s about inclusion and liberating everyone to shine in their unique way.  Coty helps millions of people around the world express your beauty, your way through our rich portfolio covering fragrance, skin care, colour cosmetics, and body care. Our brands include global icons like Gucci, Burberry, Hugo Boss, Calvin Klein, Philosophy, Max Factor, Rimmel, Sally Hansen, Adidas, David Beckham, etc. With more than one billion products shipped each year, the possibilities for self-expression are endless.  THE ROLE About the Role… Through this role, you’ll be able to gain an understanding of: COTY’s Asia Pacific business across 18 markets in the Luxury and Consumer Beauty Division and the Asia Pacific Beauty market across the Fragrance, Make Up and Skincare category.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  KPI data collection & performance review Support monthly Sell Out (Retail sales) and Sell In (Net Revenue) data collection from markets Support monthly performance review through preliminary analysis on key performance trends  Pricing & market intelligence Support FY23 luxury division pricing review Support quarterly collection of market intelligence data from Beaute Research and Euromonitor  WHAT YOU’LL BRING ESSENTIAL: Able to commit for at least 6 months (Jan – Jun 2022) for a full-time internship. Skilled in the use of MS Office tools including Outlook (or related email tool) Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Self-Motivated, with a strong work ethic and a sense of confidentiality. Possesses cross-cultural awareness and high emotional intelligence. Articulate, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Good balance of a professional attitude while having fun. Strong interest in consumer goods, makeup and beauty products. Strong desire to learn along with a strong sense of ownership. Persuasive, resilient and flexible, able to easily adapt to new challenges. Passionate, enthusiastic and driven to regularly follow-up with loose ends. Able to thrive despite challenges while adopting a positive attitude under pressure.  DESIRABLE An interest in DATA Background in Commerce, Finance, Engineering or Mathematics Entrepreneurial and Builder mindset  Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you’re the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible – we’d love to hear from you.  Interested applicants may also send an email directly to LiFang_Tng@cotyinc.com.

description: Job Description SummaryBD Diabetes Care business is looking for an e-commerce intern to support us in taking the brand to exciting new frontiers in terms of online selling and enable BD solutions to patients with Diabetes (PWD) through online marketplaces, online retailers, e-pharmacies and telehealth platform across South Asia, South East Asia and Australia.Job Description  Key Responsibilities  The person in this role will support the regional team in centrally executed campaigns in multiple languages and coordinates and support the execution of strategic directions across markets & platforms. The person should have a willingness and ability to jump in, take the lead, learn, and inspire others.  Operations Support the day-to-day marketplace E-commerce operations, customer service, updates, post listings, promotions, merchandising, maintenance, and performance. Develop and execute promotional campaigns to drive lower funnel demand fulfilment across BD marketplace stores (such as Shopee, Lazada, Tokopedia, etc.) and online retailer platforms (such as Guardian, Watsons, Big pharmacy, etc.) Create, plan, and execute digital marketing plans for campaign launches, collaborate with stakeholders to put together a plan of actions for successful execution and to maximize revenue and profit. Monitor reviews, inventory, and end – to -end store performance and working closely with distributors and enablers to ensure Inventory are Inbounded and Orders are Shipped-On-Time. Ensuring the BD is performing above marketplace/category KPIs across all the commerce channels. Strategy planning, management, forecasts, and results. These include short and long-term objectives, customer metrics, and overall performance. Develop reports and reporting formats. Campaign Support Executing cross-channel campaigns based on the overall strategy to acquire new visitors, engage them with relevant content and convert them. Channels include search, programmatic display, social, email and strategic 3rd party partners Coordinating campaign launch to ensure all timelines are met by working with all relevant parties internally and externally (agencies, stakeholders, creative team, etc.) Ensuring all digital touchpoints adhere to best practices while maintaining good experience across the consumer journey Conducting research on audiences, best practices, competitors, latest marketing technologies etc. to inform campaign direction to drive engagement and conversions Working with external agencies to execute, manage, optimize, report and analyze campaigns to ensure seamless execution leading to optimized performance Performance Marketing Supporting initiatives on traffic acquisition to BD website and other relevant pages to drive conversion and other campaign related targets across all business units in all key markets Optimizing conversion rates and KPIs through data driven performance marketing Supporting test & learn initiatives for creatives and media strategies / approaches to further improve messaging and delivery Ensuring seamless end-to-end consumer journey to drive quicker decision making and conversions Analytics Responsible for monthly reporting, profit & loss reporting, setting of performance measurement/matrix to measure the well-being of the marketplace launch. Monitor and Analyze competitor product sales to provide insights to marketers for them to make effective business decisions. Analyzing the results and effectiveness of campaigns to identify insights that can improve future campaign performance by extracting information (ex: seller center) Job Requirements  Education & Certification Applicant must be a full-time matriculated student Internship should contribute to school graduation requirements Competencies Passion for digital marketing and customer experience Strong analytical skills Ability to troubleshoot and problem solve in a fast-paced environment Well organized and pro-active with excellent attention to detail Possess excellent communication skills (verbal and written) Primary Work LocationSGP The StrategyAdditional LocationsWork Shift

description: Individual contributor role, opportunity to manage a team in 1.5-2 years Be part of a successful business  About Our Client  PageGroup has been bringing the world's best employers and brightest professionals together for over 40 years. Operating through three internationally recognized and respected brands: Page Executive, Michael Page and Page Personnel, we have the global strength to think and act beyond the boundaries of location or business function.  We are a B2B group within the 'information sales' space, serving most Fortune 500 organizations. We have an outstanding market lead in APAC. Singapore continues to be an important regional hub for most organizations though the landscape has changed dramatically in the last year - becoming more competitive and sophisticated. Our Financial Services, Finance & Accounting, Sales & Marketing, Human Resource, Digital, Technology, HealthCare and LifeScience, Engineering & Manufacturing, Supply Chain & Procurement, Business Support and Customer Service desks are well established businesses in the SEA region and is specialized across IT & Financial Services, Media, Fintech, E-commerce, Healthcare & LifeScience, FMCG, Manufacturing, Engineering. As we continue to invest in this business, we are looking to hire new Consultants for our desks.  Job Description  Reporting to the Manager for this business, the role will be responsible for new and existing business development within our client base.  The key measures of success in this role will be (but not limited to): Sourcing - be a key point of contact for the internal (HR) talent acquisition needs Lead Generation - drive activities, events, meetings for the purpose of networking and generating leads that are commercial important for the business Key Account Management - we partner with most top brands with their recruitment needs for the Singapore market so this role will be responsible for managing some of these key relationships Team Management - if you are someone with a passion to lead a sales business, this role will have the opportunity to manage a team of 1-4 people in the next 24 months Engagement - use social media, events, cold calling as an engagement tool to drive new business development Closing - we are looking for someone with strong negotiation skills as this role requires an ability to close  The Successful Applicant  Bachelor Degree in business, marketing, economics or related field, no minimum experience required. For recruiters with people management experience, managerial role will be considered. Passion for a commercial role and what you have done in your career to demonstrate such passion. Strong values that are in line with ours. High level of energy and ability to build rapport with C-level executives as business development activity is focused on targeting global/regional leaders from the sector.  What's On Offer  We provide unlimited international career opportunity within our worldwide network of offices. You will receive development throughout your career and work with a dynamic team that are proud and passionate about what they do and enjoy having fun too! Excellent basic salaries Performance based bonus - potential to earn between 6 and 12 months bonus 20 days annual leave Dynamic, flexible work environment Fast track into management opportunities Industry leading training program - come and learn from the best! Individual and team based incentives Exposure to the world's biggest multinational brands and industry leaders Recognition as an industry expert Opportunity to move to international office locations  Contact: Celeste Goh  Quote job ref: JN-092021-3601489
industries: Events Services, Financial Services, and Facilities Services

description: At 3M, we apply science in collaborative ways to improve lives. With $32 billion in sales, our 91,000 employees connect with customers all around the world.  3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. We are primarily looking for students who are willing to take on work and accept assignments and tasks, with immense desire to get involved.  Characteristics Of a Good Intern  Willing to roll up his/her sleeves and collaborate with employees in a number of projects Willing to take on new and difficult assignments Eager to take on challenging tasks and at times, routine activities Able to meet deadlines and take responsibility/ownership Consistent dedication to complete a given task Proactive and able to ask questions  Send in your application and our Talent Acquisition team will reach out soon.  Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.  Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.  3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement  Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.  Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

description: Background The Asia Toy and Play Association (ATPA) is a non-profit organisation whose mission is to provide all children with access to safe and educational toys. Supporting the sustainable growth of the toy sector value chain in the Asia region and advocating the importance of learning through play, ATPA brings companies and stakeholders together to share knowledge, respond to industry issues, raise public awareness, and engage with policymakers and influencers to find solutions for the toy industry. Our daily work helps to put a smile on children across the world!  Position The Intern will join our secretariat and support our team on various aspects of internal work, research, marketing, and liaison with members and prospective members. You will have the opportunity to learn about the fascinating toy industry, its engagement with government, regulators in Asia. In addition, you can expect to increase your understanding of how geopolitical and regulatory developments impact supply chains, manufacturing and sales.  The Intern will be tasked not only with drafting position papers, publications, media monitoring reports, etc but also with leading projects and meetings with different stakeholders and cover the marketing and social media aspect of the activities. It will be 360 degree experience.  Internships are generally 4-6 months long but may vary. We are looking for exceptional students nearing the completion of their undergraduate or advanced degree. Recent graduates are welcome to apply.  Qualifications ·      Solid research and writing skills ·      Genuine interest in geopolitical and business developments in Asia Pacific ·      Good design, marketing and social media skills (CANVA, MailChimp, Wordpress, LinkedIn, Twitter) ·      Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and work independently ·      High level of organization and attention to detail ·      Excellent written and verbal skills in English  The Internship Program is tailored for students recently graduated or pursuing an undergraduate or advanced degree in analytical programs, or fields such as economics, politics, business or public policy interest in political and economic development in Asia, with focus on Southeast Asia.  For applicants based in Singapore, you must be: Singapore National or PR or with valid student visa. Remote working positions may be considered.  Interested candidates should send their applications to info@atpa.asia and indicate the position being applied for in the subject line.  In addition to your CV, please include a cover letter demonstrating interest and fitness for the position and a writing sample.

You Make It Great! Great Start Great Future.  At McDonald's, we're a big fan of passion. If you've always dreamt of running a restaurant, we'll gladly show you the way to lead and operate a food business like a seasoned entrepreneur. And when you get there, we'll get you ready for even bigger roles at one of the world's largest food service companies. You're gonna be great here!  As a Restaurant Management Trainee, you will learn to Shape the future of McDonald's Master million-dollar budgeting, cost management, and inventory planning Plan and execute sales building activities Take charge of Quality, Service, and Cleanliness assurance within the restaurant operations Supervise store operations, cash control, and shift management Manage a high-performance team and develop their talents Drive recruitment, training, and marketing campaigns We are looking for people who have A Degree, Diploma, Higher Nitec or Nitec in any discipline High energy and a strong passion for delighting customers Drive and resourcefulness to deliver results Strong management skills with the ability to lead and motivate a team Able to work shifts, weekends and public holidays (5-day work week)

description: Our Mission  Glints is Southeast Asia’s #1 tech-enabled talent and upskilling platform with the purpose of realizing human potential. We are passionate about empowering individuals to secure their dream jobs, matching employers with the best talent, and shaping the future of work.  We are currently in 5 markets: supporting over a million talents & 30,000+ employers. We have raised US$10M+ from investors around the world and are growing rapidly. This is the perfect opportunity to join a rocketship and accelerate your learning & career.  What You’ll Be Doing  The mission of this role is to solve strategic problems that arise in our scaling phase and assist in driving new projects through conducting rapid data analysis with fast turnarounds. You will be a key part of building new business units and scaling them from zero to one.  Key Responsibilities Include CLTV Expansion through add-ons Identify and prioritize areas to create value to existing clients including providing insurance, training, classifieds, etc. Test customer and stakeholder appetite for such add-ons Academy Fundraising and Operational Improvements Refine academy income-share-agreement financial model and projections Create pitch deck to social impact investors and support end-to-end process Understand current operational bottlenecks and work with teams on the ground to improve processes Geographical Expansion International expansion into markets including the Philippines, Thailand, and China Other High-Priority Projects Analyse past data and develop simple models for key indicators and metrics Examples of key indicators include: Client Lifetime Value, Customer Acquisition Cost, Efficiency-related metrics, Revenue Retention, Customer Concentration Prepare and build fundraising models, charts and documentations Example of models and charts include: financial model for business valuation, unit economics, whale chart, rule of 40 chart, cricket chart Support investor meetings as they occur, sitting in to take notes and supporting data requests by investors  What We’re Looking For Analytical skills Comfortable working with and manipulating data Work Ethic Strong work ethic with get-it-done growth mindset Proactive with proposing solutions and flagging issues Open to travel (subject to healthcare / COVID situation) Team work Collaborative: Able to work with different BUs and team members across geographies / cultures Excited about building and scaling new business units Attention to detailZ Zero-defect mindset Ensure no formula / excel / PPT formatting errors High Proficiency in: Excel modeling skills Microsoft PowerPoint Google Suite (Docs, Slides and Sheets) SQL and database languages [Good to have] Knowledge of accounting and finance Past working experience in sales and planning, strategy, or corporate development functions Past working experience in start-ups [Good to have] Bachelors in business (accountancy, finance) [Good to have]  What You Will Get  It’s a young team here. Young, hungry and maybe foolish. That’s what makes us so dangerous. We have a team of amazing investors and advisors backing and supporting us though - they fuel our growth not just with cash but also guidance and mentorship. These are people you will get to learn directly from too. If you can thrive in the uncertain and fast-paced nature of a startup, you will have an exponential learning curve. You will wear different hats and enjoy the thrill of building things from scratch.  Speaking about growth, 2020 was a tough year to navigate, but quick adaptations and sticking to our core strategy allowed us to maintain growth. LinkedIn recognized us in the 2020 Top Startups List in Singapore - an annual ranking of the emerging startups to work for, click  Powered by JazzHR  WN3f47koxb

Align with Worldwide Education team changes to channel training model Drive adoption of global tools & dashboards Operations Excellence Digital Transformation for channel partners and internal operations, standardize International Reporting & Simplify International Processes. Business analytics of Technology mix (unit, sales, revenue) trend. Performing analysis to assess quality and meaning of data. Design, develop, and implement appropriate data management systems. Develop visualizations and tools to improve the data analytics capabilities via automation and process improvements to improve decision making cycle time. Data analytics – provide insights on business intelligence to management and Sales team to make prompt and key decisions. Work across channels and functions to deliver reliable and timely information on leading sales indicators (sell-in, sell-thru, inventory and sell-out). Drive and implement regional/ global projects. Provide recommendations of improvement of key business process and tools. Work with cross functional teams to support the implementation of proposed processes that include creating the training/ support materials and developing business rules & monitoring their effectiveness.  Basic Requirements High analytic skills, with advance knowledge in Excel. Knowledge in Tableau and other analytics related programming is an added advantage. Good with numbers and attention to details Ability to present and articulate through process and data analytics Strong communications, presentation and influencing skills. Proven PM skills in managing multiple projects.  Company Overview At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.  Inclusion & diversity: At Motorola Solutions we value the diversity of our people. Motorola Solutions is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and is a proud sponsor of Females in Information Technology & Telecommunications.

THE ROLE About the Role… This internship will provide you with learning opportunities in a fast-paced multi-national company. The mission of the customer service intern will be to support the South East Asia customer service team in daily operations, order management, process improvements and projects, whilst at the same time learning how to use SAP and other supply chain tools.  This job provides learning opportunities to develop your supply chain skills, especially in the order management processes and with the use of SAP The candidate will learn analytical and reporting skills, including order & shipment tracking, daily & monthly sales reporting. Support the SEA Customer Service team in various process improvement and system automation initiatives The candidate will support projects with guidance from the manager to ensure maximum learning is acquired throughout the internship.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Daily Operations – support CS team with daily order entry into SAP with accuracy, creating order allocations, sending orders to warehouse for Pick-Packing / liaising with finance for credit limit order releasing Daily/Weekly/Monthly reporting – support CS team on various reports, including Daily Sales, Month End Closing etc. Projects – work on system and process improvements through automation, system enhancements, Excel enhancements.   WHAT YOU’LL BRING   ESSENTIAL: Able to commit for at least 6 months (Jan to Jun 2022) for a full-time internship. Skilled in the use of MS Office tools including Outlook (or related email tool) Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Self-Motivated, with a strong work ethic and a sense of confidentiality. Possesses cross-cultural awareness and high emotional intelligence. Articulate, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Good balance of a professional attitude while having fun. Strong interest in consumer goods, makeup and beauty products. Strong desire to learn along with a strong sense of ownership. Persuasive, resilient and flexible, able to easily adapt to new challenges. Passionate, enthusiastic and driven to regularly follow-up with loose ends. Able to thrive despite challenges while adopting a positive attitude under pressure.  DESIRABLE Strong interest in supply chain & operations (with BA degree relevancy)  Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you’re the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible – we’d love to hear from you.  Interested applicants may also send an email directly to LiFang_Tng@cotyinc.com.

description: Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative?  At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. We provide energy and automation digital solutions for efficiency and sustainability.  We are looking for a 6 months intern to join us for the period of January to June 2022.  What will you do?  Strategy Planning Support the management on generating and documenting actionable initiatives in the country and in charge of Global and Local Initiatives Get a clear & updated understanding of the market’s environment and our business performances Understand the country business and market landscape by supporting in data collection and intelligence gathering Support the business on matters related to the adaptations & execution of the Annual Marketing & Sales Plan  Channel Reporting and Database Management Support the management on all regular reports and cross selling activities Monitor Sales Dashboard to support internal & external stakeholders’ requirements Support the team in managing the EcoXpert Program / Channel Database Management (CDM) Consolidate data points and support the Business Intelligence analysis on the available CDM in order to generate and drive more strategic sales programs. Track market share, sales trends and gather market intelligence Specify and develop offer marketing and sales needs in terms of literature, sales tools and web presence.  Process Optimization and Leadership Initiative Analyze, review, revise, create new and innovative tools to improve existing database tools, method and work processes. Take initiative to learn related knowledge which can be applied to work and share with team mate, e.g. Advance Excel skill, Macro program, etc. Able to work under stress and tight schedule. Able to work with cross functional team.  What qualifications will make you successful? Any courses/ backgrounds are welcomed Ability to communicate effectively in oral and written form Fluent in English Excellent problem solving and organization skills Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with customers and company colleagues  What's in it for me? Competitive internship allowance Fliexible work arrangement - flexi-hours, office hoteling Medical coverage Blue Sky Friday Onsite gym and more!  Let us learn about you! Apply today.  Why us?  Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.  €25.7bn global revenue  137 000+ employees in 100+ countries  45% of revenue from IoT  5% of revenue devoted for R&D  You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled  It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

description: Company Description  Sleek.com is Asia's fastest growing corporate services platform - it helps entrepreneurs and SME owners to register companies in Singapore, Hong Kong & Australia, and assist them with the management of their accounting, audit and taxes, in a 100% digital manner. We build cutting edge technology to automate manual work, and provide a delightful experience to our 6,000+ clients. Naturally, we are continuously looking for great people to join our dynamic team!  We are a team of 200+ builders from 17 countries, with offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, Sydney & the Philippines, committed to delivering a great experience to our clients.  At Sleek, you will find a fast-paced environment focused on building great solutions, and endless opportunities for learning and knowledge sharing, whether it’s around a coffee with your colleagues at the office, or via video calls with your peers based overseas!  Job Description  Position duties  We are looking for a motivated and detail oriented intern to support our Managed Services team.  Sleek’s Managed Services is a brand new product line launched in May 2020.  Managed Services is a white labeled version of our Sleek platform and services that is now offered to high volume referrals partners, called MS Partner. The value proposition for these partners is that instead of sending their clients directly to Sleek, they can now keep their direct client relationships, diversify and deliver incorporation, corporate secretary and accounting services in Singapore under their own brand and charge a premium on top of our fixed fees.  This role presents an exciting opportunity to gain first hand experience of how to build up a new product from scratch and grow it into a scalable and profitable business line.  The role will encompass a wide range of activities and no one day will be the same: Business Development > Engaging in prospecting activities and helping to build and manage an exciting pipeline of Managed Service candidates (Law Firms, Corporate Secretaries, Consultants, Auditors, etc).  > Attending sales meetings with Managed Services prospects to pitch and demo Managed Services.  > Supporting with negotiations and signing up new clients. Operations & Innovation > Helping to improve internal processes and procedures to ensure the successful delivery of the Managed Services offering. Examples may include finding ways to refine MS Partner & MS End Clients onboarding, automating repetitive manual processes; creating guides; updating process documents.  > Coordinating with the other departments and teams in Sleek to obtain support when required. Key teams include tech, compliance, data, finance, accounting, payroll, partnerships & corporate secretary.  The Ideal Candidate Is  What we are looking for - - - - Studying or graduate in Business Administration Great interpersonal and communication skills Able to interact with personnel at all levels Detailed orientated  Agility, ability to multitask in a start-up environment  Come and join our dynamic, friendly, and always supportive team, to learn, grow, and develop yourself and the company!

jobTitle: Marketing Intern - Amazon Global Selling (July to December 2022)
description: Description The duration for this internship opportunity is from July to December 2022 Applicants to this internship opportunity will need the work authorization for Singapore Amazon is seeking a dynamic and motivated Marketing Intern for the Amazon Global Selling business. This individual will be responsible for developing new social media channels and offline opportunities to drive local seller awareness and engagement. This person will work with various marketing channels, which can enable scalable approaches to prospect Seller communities in South East Asia, especially Singapore, Malaysia and Philippines.  Background on Amazon Global Selling: The Marketplace or “Selling on Amazon” business exists in 18 countries and exceeds more than half of total Amazon unit sales and growing. Each year, tens of thousands of businesses join the marketplace adding millions of new products. Amazon’s vision is to offer the earth’s largest product selection and lowest prices for our customers. One way we deliver on this vision is by marketing to local country Sellers to persuade them to launch their products onto the platform thereby maximizing the quantity of items that they list while ensuring the highest quality of product images and information.  The ideal candidates will be an innovator, communicator and problem solver. Candidates will need to be analytical, think and act fast, and be apt at finding creative solutions to complex problems. This is a unique opportunity to play a highly visible role in an exciting and fast-paced business, make history while having fun!  Role And Responsibilities Work with internal stakeholders and analyze data points to identify key focus sellers. Oversee coordination with internal and external stakeholders, third-party engagements and support required for campaign success. Work with partners and internal stakeholders to identify new online and offline activities to build awareness for Amazon Global Selling Develop marketing content for social media channels i.e. Facebook. Oversee pre-event consultation and planning, event logistics, third-party engagements, related travel arrangements, staffing and support required for events Keep track of updated content creation guidelines and resources, develop communication materials for events, review and seek approval ahead of deadlines Develop new webpages to drive traffic and engage with potential sellers in South East Asia  Basic Qualifications Penultimate year student pursuing a Bachelor's degree Graduating after December 2022 Able to commit to a full-time internship from July to December 2022 Past work experience in marketing, marketing communications, preferably in the eCommerce, retail technology, or software industries Proven success in project management and communication skills Demonstrated track record in developing and crafting marketing content Ability to work in fast-paced environment and deal with ambiguity Strong written and verbal communication skills in English Preferred Qualifications Digital design experience and understanding for marketing design guidelines Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign  Company - Amazon Asia-Pacific Holdings  Job ID: A1726208
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Flash Coffee is Asia's fastest-growing tech-enabled specialty coffee chain. We aim to democratize high-quality coffee to make it accessible to Asia's rising middle class. We serve up an award-winning coffee menu at affordable prices in stores and via our mobile app for customers who prefer a quick grab-and-go. Already operating in five countries, we are on a trajectory to launch an additional five countries across Asia Pacific by 2022.  We're a Series A startup with funding from White Star Capital, known for backing the likes of food-tech giant Freshly and Dollar Shave Club, along with Delivery Hero, the parent company of foodpanda and one of the largest food delivery companies in the world. We also count Rocket Internet (known for incubating the likes of foodpanda, Lazada, Zalora, and more) as well as Global Founders Capital, which has backed global successes such as Facebook, LinkedIn, and Slack. THIS IS NOT A JOB POSTING   Be it school or your own entrepreneurial ventures, Flash Coffee would like to keep you recharged and ready to take on the day by joining our Student Affiliate Programme. As an NUS Student Affiliate, you'll get the chance to earn up to $350/month with us by leveraging your own expertise in sales and involvement with the NUS community. We're looking for 25 vibrant students to share their love for Flash Coffee on TikTok/Instagram and encourage app downloads.  Who we're looking for: 25 vibrant students; Opinion leaders with strong social media presence Ability to create engaging, organic content for social media Passion for tech and coffee  What you'll do: Drive downloads of the Flash Coffee app through your own means and connections Create engaging, organic brand-led content for your social media platforms following monthly required deliverable quotas  What we offer: Being part of a fast-growing startup and our first batch of student affiliates Earn commission ranging from $2-$5 (up to $350/month) with every successful first transaction your referee makes with your unique promo code Access to our Affiliate Tier (1 free drink every day for a month if you hit the KPI for the previous month) Potential to move up to our Ambassador program  Join us and together, we can continue serving great coffee to keep people recharged and ready for opportunities - allowing them to achieve their best, starting in NUS.  **  INTERESTED PARTIES PLEASE USE THIS GOOGLE LINK TO SIGN UP - here.  DO NOT APPLY BELOW.

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  2022 Summer Internship, Business Development  We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.  Do you want to be a part of a collaborative environment?  Are you motivated to be a part of driving a world beyond cash?  Are you motivated to stay on the cutting edge of technology?  The Mastercard Intern Program is a comprehensive program where students will gain hands on real work-life skills while having fun and contributing to a global company. As an intern, you will be challenged with completing projects that will enhance your skills as well as contribute to the department’s goals and objectives. Successful candidates will be assigned to a business unit within International Markets for 10 - 12 weeks.  Business Unit  SEA Commercial Payments team supports South East Asia division in growing and scaling SME and B2B payments leveraging our own assets and fintech partner platforms. Our job entails maintaining close collaboration and sharing thought leadership with our partners from Banks, Fintechs, Credit Bureau partners, Payment intermediaries and Governments. South East Asia market comprises of 6 country managers and spanning across 12 main geographies.  Specific projects you may be working on: The role is envisaged to provide learning and achievement objectives: Gain specific insights into how we approach Small and Micro businesses, how we enable their Bankability by helping them eradicate digital divide and become more approachable by traditional financial institutions; how do we work with partners and help accelerate our partner Banks profitability by embracing specific products and services. Work on ad hoc projects specifically linked to capturing incremental payments like ad/cloud/SAAS/Insuretech/gaming payments leveraging key Mastercard assets and fintech partner platforms Gain insight and skills into Commercial Cards P&L so as to formulate new dashboards or reports which may be used for senior management review. Will get an opportunity to work with Account teams and assist them in solution selling and roll-out new business initiative to potential customers across SEA markets  The role will require ability to work independently, demonstrate thought-leadership, show empathy and interpersonal relationships / influencing skills as there would be an opportunity to independently connect with people from diverse geographical and cultural backgrounds.  Program Dates & Components Impactful assignments that drive business results Networking sessions and leadership speakers series Volunteer and team building experiences  Program Qualifications Evidence of strong academics, penultimate year of study (graduating by June 2022) Project management, problem solving and planning skills with a demonstrated record of successfully managing multiple projects Ability to work on a team and independently Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment Experience of worked in technology roles in financial institutions is an added advantage.  Experience And Skills Needed Demonstrate interest in Payments Analytical, problem solver Excellent knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint.  Application deadline: 13 October 2021  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.
industries: Financial Services, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Nielsen Internship (Marketing Analytics) - 97164 Analytics - Singapore  ABOUT THE ROLE Immerse yourself in Nielsen Media syndicated products (and respective Nielsen proprietary software) which are the industry currency/common language used by media owners (such as publishers and broadcasters, platform owners), media agencies and advertisers to trade, and understand audiences’ media consumption behaviors and advertising trends e.g. Nielsen Media Index/ Nielsen Advertising Information Services/Nielsen Radio Diary Survey, etc. Be a part of Media-centric customized research projects.  RESPONSIBILITIES Hone your market research skills and understanding through (co-)management of assigned product/project i.e. project set up, design, processing, data checking & interpretation, analysis & translating, into meaningful insights. Engage with a wide array of clients, i.e. broadcasters, publishers, media agencies, advertisers, advertising agencies, etc., in software training, installation, troubleshooting, and responding to clients’ queries. As a stretch goal (depending on the readiness of individuals), the position may provide opportunities to manage a project independently (with the manager/director supervision).  REQUIREMENTS We are looking for a candidate who can commit to starting Intern with us effective Immediate for 6 months on a full-time basis (Mondays to Fridays, 9 AM - 5.30 PM) This will be a paid internship Preferably candidate graduating from the Media / Research / Data Analytics field of study  ABOUT THE TEAM Globally, Nielsen Media empowers media companies and advertisers to plan, activate and measure their content and related audiences in the new media landscape. Our Client Service and Sales team operate as a link between Production and Clients, covering all post-sales retail measurement services. We are aimed to provide our Clients best in class servicing and on-time data delivery, enhancing their satisfaction with the Nielsen core products.  ABOUT NIELSEN As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.  Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas, and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!  Job Type: Internship Primary Location: Singapore
industries: Market Research, Management Consulting, and Marketing and Advertising

At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. We provide energy and automation digital solutions for efficiency and sustainability.  We are looking for a 6 months intern to join us for the period of January to June 2022.  The Intern will assist the Power Products Commercial Transformation Team (EAJPHK) to evaluate data and provide support to enhance the channel operations dashboard for Specifiers, Contractors and Panel Builders. This role will work collaboratively across teams on developing meaningful initiatives and improvements that enables the team to accelerate.  What will you do? Collaborate on the creation and the development of a successful data insight dashboard Creation of data quality improvement and data discovery dashboards Refine and improve sales processes to drive excellence Ability to present and distribute data interpretations, forecasting models and metrics Work collaboratively across functional teams to develop quantitive analysis, translating data into actional insights Interaction with different key stakeholders to understand the needs and requirements Drive strategic and planning process through data-driven Develop sales analytics training documentation and deliver training to users on systems developed Manages ad-hoc reporting and analysis requests if required Strong analytic skills to manage effective implementations Strong teamwork, highly responsive and proactive attitude  What qualifications will make you successful? Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics/Mathematics/Economics/Computer Engineering/IT related or similar Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint Salesforce & Tableau experience preferred  What's in it for me? Competitive internship allowance Fliexible work arrangement - flexi-hours, office hoteling Medical coverage Blue Sky Friday Onsite gym and more!  Let us learn about you! Apply today.  Why us?  Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.  €25.7bn global revenue  137 000+ employees in 100+ countries  45% of revenue from IoT  5% of revenue devoted for R&D  You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled  It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

description: Description Du Poste  Within the business unit Trading, the Risk Middle Office Department is in charge of the financial valuation of the Liquefied Natural Gas portfolio and associated market risks. These calculations are performed on a daily basis on the first years to come. Risk middle analysts are based in Geneva, Houston and Singapore. The internship will be in Singapore (Frasers Tower).  The Middle Office Intern will work within the LNG team to measure, analyse and monitor the P&L and the market risk exposition. The Middle Office is mainly responsible for calculating profits and losses, managing risks, apprehending the global accuracy of the information present in the trading system and creating reports to analyse the movement of markets (prices, flows, …) Produce and analyse Exposure and Risk reports to monitor the portfolio. Calculate the daily P&L changes of the desk. Analyse market movements and impact on the risks held by the Trading Desks. Work closely with Traders to quantify and explain the sources of risk in their portfolios. Collaborate with Paris, Singapore and Houston teams. Look for and put in place process improvements. Be involved in the constant improvement of the risk monitoring framework. Liaise with IT teams to ensure the enhancement the trading software. Contexte et Environnement TGPA is the corporate structure in charge of developing the Gas & Power trading activities in the Asia Pacific area and is in the early stage of its development, staffing or organization. The LNG business environment is volatile and competitive. The environment also entails working over extended time zones (Asia, Australia, UK, France). Profil recherché Good analysis skills and ability to present complex problems in a precise and concise way Interest in commodity trading is a plus Ability to think critically about results Good communication skills and ability to work in a team environment Ability to multi-task and work under pressure Good knowledge of English is required Programming skills (Python, VBA) are optional but preferred. Réfèrence  45868BR  Métier  Financial Middle / Back Office  Type d’emploi  Internship  Durée du contrat  6  Unité de temps  Months  Niveau d’expérience requis  Less than 3 years  Société Employeur  TOTAL GAS & POWER ASIA LIMITED  Branche  Gas Renewables And Power  A propos de nous/Profil de l'entreprise  The global activities of the Gas & Power Branch of TotalEnergies SA, and its affiliates, subsidiaries and associated companies (“TotalEnergies Gas & Power”, "Group" or "TotalEnergies Group") include the marketing and trading of natural gas, liquefied natural gas ("LNG") and power, the trading of liquefied petroleum gas ("LPG"), natural gas transportation and storage, as well as LNG re-gasification and the production and sale of coal and petcoke.  TotalEnergies Gas & Power’s trading teams are responsible for optimising the purchase/sales portfolios of gas, electricity, coal and LPG via transactions (arbitrage, balancing and hedging) in all recognised markets, in compliance with Group trading guidelines.  TGPA participates and supports TotalEnergies Gas & Power’s efforts in developing its energy trading network of Asian and Australian counterparts and increasing market share, identifying new opportunities and complementing the expansion of TotalEnergies Gas & Power’s trading portfolio.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Oil & Energy, and Financial Services

description: Growth Hacker Intern  About the company: Our mission is to provide fair and transparent financial access to every business in the world regardless of how small or large they may be. We are one of few Fintech firms in Singapore who holds a Major Payment Institution license from the Monetary Authority of Singapore with a full suite of products to empower small and medium business owners across the region. We are rebranding and expanding our offerings. We are looking for individuals who are ready to make a real impact in this thriving FinTech industry. Growth Hacker Intern – based in Singapore. We are looking for someone who is enthusiastic about building smarter solutions in the ever-evolving FinTech space to work closely together with our team on a variety of cross-functional projects. This is a cross-functional role where you will be working closely with the marketing, sales, product management & technology teams to conceptualize and launch relevant features & campaigns to increase usage for the digital channels. Retention of talent for full time roles is one of our goals. You are creative and data driven with an appreciation for aesthetic and experimenting.  Scope: Developing and executing online and offline campaigns, including digital marketing, brand partnerships, on-ground activation etc. to drive traffic to digital channels Identifying, developing & optimising growth channels to drive revenues growth Analysing marketing data and user feedback (campaign results, conversion rates, traffic, etc.) to help shape future marketing strategies Proposing new initiatives to attract prospects and convert leads as well as testing new approaches to capture existing demand Providing inputs & expertise to drive efficacy of marketing activities (content development and optimization, advertising etc.) Planning and executing initiatives to reach the target audience through different channels Working closely across teams with other teams to share ideas, feedback & present results Knowledge in content creation, running social media campaigns and curious about how product and operations impact client acquisition. What you will be gaining: Experience in working in a cross-functional, multi-national team Hands-on experience managing a product backlog Experience in overseeing the end-to-end product lifecycle Communication and presentation skills Ability to develop, design and launch product features which achieve product-market fit Who we are looking for: Completed or ongoing tertiary education/training in Marketing, Business Administration or related fields Prior experience in a similar role Possess excellent analytical skills to leverage data, metric and consumer behavior trends to generate new ideas Highly goal oriented Able communicator with strong linguistic skills in both written and spoken English Happy with remote work, happier with on-site work Able to bring your own laptop Experience with startups is a bonus We are a fast-growing start-up. Be prepared for a dynamic environment where you will be taking on greater responsibilities within the team and getting your hands dirty in all aspects of the business. [What you need to do] If you're interested in this role, forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to clarence.p@opalpayment.com. Immediate joiners preferred.

As a Business Analyst, the successful candidate will provide insights and present information to support the regional sales team and senior management in making data-driven decisions and drive the sales. The ideal candidate is a team player who will be responsible for working with company transactional data in various business areas.  Responsibilities (including But Not Limited To) Ensure timely and accurate monthly reports by SEA regions are generated, prepare business analysis, customer analysis and product analysis. Perform day-to-day reporting to provide datasets and dashboard to track teams’ performance metrics to ensure the goals are met. Conduct data analytics and visualization with transactional data from the company and industry to generate insights on volume and profitability by region, offices, trade lanes and customers. Work closely with Senior Business Analyst and local sales teams, provide data support for ad-hoc business requirements. Collaborate with internal and external teams on sales-driven projects, provide and support data analysis for governance and reporting. Gather relevant data whilst collaborating with regional teams to build comprehensive views for senior management. Requirements A degree or master in Business Analytics, Engineering, Accounting or related fields Prior experience as a Business Analyst, experience in the shipping/logistics industry is a plus Passion for problem-solving, with good learning ability and interpersonal skills, detail-oriented person Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast paced and changing environment Advanced Excel skill is a must, experience with analytics tools such as Power BI, Python is highly advantageous Work independently or collaboratively on complex situations and tasks Fluency in English language is a must, fluency in several other languages/bilingual is a plus.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain, Wholesale, and Transportation/Trucking/Railroad

description: About Barclays  Barclays is a British universal bank. We are diversified by business, by different types of customers and clients, and by geography. Our businesses include consumer banking and payments operations around the world, as well as a top-tier, full service, global corporate and investment bank, all of which are supported by our service company which provides technology, operations and functional services across the Group. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are opposed to discrimination on any grounds.  About Markets Business Management  The Business Management function is broad ranging and involves responsibility for the infrastructure and administration of the business. There is particular emphasis on strategy, execution of initiatives/projects, budgeting, risk control agenda, and cost control.  Overall Purpose of Role  The traineeship is based in Singapore, to support the Macro (FX, Rates and EM) and Credit businesses in the region. The Business Management function is broad ranging and involves responsibility for the infrastructure and administration of the business. There is particular emphasis on strategy, budgeting, cost control, and risk and controls. The function involves constant liaison with, and often provides the link between, trading and IT, Product Control, Risk Control, Operations, Legal and Compliance, as well as working closely with Sales. As such, it is key to the smooth and efficient running of the business and touches the firm in most areas and at all levels.  Key Accountabilities Support Markets Business Management team on day to day logistics of governance and team meetings, colleague engagement planning and support. Assist in developing standard and ad hoc reports, templates, dashboards, scorecards, and metrics for Markets Asia. Assist in Research, analysis, and presentation of data as assigned. Assist in compiling reports and dashboards to stakeholders. Assist in rollout and implementation of Markets Asia programs. Assist in various Markets Asia projects and continuous improvement initiatives. Any other duties to assist the effectiveness of Markets Asia as required by the respective head of the Markets Business Management oversight. To Be Considered For This Program, You Must Be a Singapore citizen or PR. Have a Diploma/Degree in any discipline. Have at least 3 years working experience. Requirements Communication skills – both presentation and conversational. Ability to influence and negotiate. Excellent time management skills and ability to prioritize. Attention to detail. Strong ability to multitask and take initiative. Willingness to learn and help problem solve. Basic knowledge of Banking or Financial products (not a strict pre requisite). Competencies to learn Ability to navigate a matrix organization and confidently interact and engage with a diverse spectrum of stakeholders. Communication & Interpersonal Skills through Engagement with Business/Functions and Markets colleagues. Build strong analytical skills to independently research and develop a good understanding of Markets reports and dashboards. Understand the process, mechanics and implementation of a Markets Asia project. Duration of traineeship/attachment: 6 months  Our Purpose and Values  We deploy finance responsibly to support people and businesses, acting with empathy and integrity, championing innovation and sustainability, for the common good and the long term. Our values underpin everything we do: Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship.  Respect  We harness the power of diversity and inclusion in our business, trust those we work with, and value everyone's contribution.  Integrity  We operate with honesty, transparency and fairness in all we do.  Service  We act with empathy and humility, putting the people and businesses we serve at the centre of what we do.  Excellence  We champion innovation, and use our energy, expertise and resources to make a positive difference.  Stewardship  We prize sustainability, and are passionate about leaving things better than we found them.  For further information about Barclays, please visit our website home.barclays  It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.
industries: Capital Markets, Banking, and Financial Services

jobTitle: TD Internship - Research & Strategy (Front Office) (January 2022 to June 2022)
description: TD Bank Group  Headquartered in Toronto, Canada, with approximately 90,000 employees in offices around the world, the Toronto-Dominion Bank and its subsidiaries are collectively known as TD Bank Group (TD). TD offers a full range of financial products and services to over 26 million customers worldwide through three key business lines: Canadian Retail including TD Canada Trust, Business Banking, TD Auto Finance (Canada), TD Wealth (Canada), TD Direct Investing and TD Insurance U.S. Retail including TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank, TD Auto Finance (U.S.), TD Wealth (U.S.) and TD’s investment in Schwab Wholesale Banking including TD Securities  TD had CDN$1.7 trillion in assets on July 31, 2021. TD also ranks among the world’s leading online financial services firms, with more than 15 million active online and mobile customers. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges under the symbol "TD". In Singapore, TD operates as The Toronto-Dominion Bank, Singapore Branch and Toronto Dominion (South East Asia) Limited, which are collectively known as “TD Singapore” since 1979. The key business in Singapore is TD Securities which is part of Wholesale Banking.  Internship Program The intern will have the opportunity to sit with the business in the Front Office, mainly with the following departments: Fixed Income Sales, Foreign Exchange Sales, Syndication and Research & Strategy during the 6 month-internship. The intern will also gain experience on the operations and processes adopted by the teams. The intern will also acquire broad banking knowledge and have excellent opportunity to experience day-to-day life on the trading floor and to work together with an international team.  Objectives The intern will aim to gain a strong understanding of the following:  Assist the strategy team in updating existing spreadsheets, models and charts as well as develop/build new econometric tools/models. Contribute to daily, weekly, monthly and ad hoc publications. Work on ad hoc research projects with members of the economic, interest rate and emerging markets strategy teams. Utilise data providers such as Bloomberg and Haver to update presentations. Help to formulate economic/market forecasts. Develop an understanding of capital markets, economic analysis, research and publication tools.  Attributes The intern should possess the following attributes: Team-oriented attitude Strong communication skills Interest in financial markets with a specific focus on economic theory and principles. Understanding of econometrics concepts is desirable.  Prior experience in a financial institution will be advantageous Demonstrates initiative, flexibility and commitment Ability to handle pressure and work in a fast-paced environment Ability and willingness to learn tasks quickly Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, including WORD, POWERPOINT and EXCEL Proficiency in VBA will be a plus Good command of English  Requirements Year 2 and Year 3 Undergraduates Ability to commit for a 6-month full time internship from January 2022 until June 2022  Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.
industries: Investment Banking
