description: CrescoData is an exciting market leader in the Commerce space. Headquartered in Singapore, it delivers iPaaS services to enterprise customers across the globe.  This is a unique opportunity to work in an agile market-leading company in a fast growing sector and work with large global customers. At Cresco we work hard as an energetic tight-knit team, we are hustlers who pull together and have FUN! Come and join us on our journey.  Culture  Culture is something that is really important to us at CrescoData. You’ll be joining a friendly, inclusive team that values people, growth, development and fun! We regularly run weekly company initiatives like fitness bootcamps, team building days, monthly awards for going above and beyond and team events to reward hard work and a great attitude. Expect to join a unique market leading Singapore company with a global culture and mindset.  Responsibilities  CrescoData is seeking a motivated student or recent graduate to support our CEO. We are looking for someone who is ready to apply knowledge of business practices and processes in a fast-paced, real world environment.  The intern will assist the CEO by participating in the company’s day–to-day operations that include supporting the CEO, conducting research as well as owning a wide range of operational projects o. This internship is an excellent opportunity for a business administration student wishing to learn more about how a PaaS company scales. The intern will also have exposure to all areas of the company such as digital marketing, sales and business development and the eCommerce sector from a team of seasoned and highly talented senior managers.  This position is best suited for someone who has a strong interest in business administration, international business, software and technology companies.  Duties Will Include Assistance with sales creation of sales strategies and lead gen campaigns, proposals, under the guidance of the CEO, Assisting with business planning: market research, competitor analysis, building business cases , Data driven analysis Ability to take on and own a wide range of cross-functional projects Day to day support of the CEO Skills And Qualifications  We'd like you to have the following skills: MAC OS, PC, and Microsoft Office proficiency Data driven and analytical Excellent interpersonal, organizational and research skills To be studying or recently graduated in a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance or a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) discipline In Addition, The Following Skills Would Be Useful General interest in business and commerce A keen interest in e-Commerce Ability to prioritize and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail Strong problem solving and quantitative analytical skills The Successful Candidate Will Have These Personal Skills Energetic, pro-active & willing to learn in a dynamic environment Able to work well both independently & in a team environment CrescoData offers A unique opportunity to work in a PaaS company as it scales On the job training and personal development Mentorship and support from experienced, dedicated professionals to help guide your career A fun, stimulating work environment Flexible working Regular team building events (we’ve been on Cooking Challenges, Kayaking in Bintan, Beach clean with beach games), free Wednesday lunch, free weekly bootcamp and free Friday drinks! The intern should be able to commit for a minimum of 2 months.  Please send your CV, a covering letter outlining your experience, availability and why you are the best person for this internship; to jobs@crescodata.com

description: Traineeship Description  This position is for fresh graduates and mid-career individuals who are keen to explore and continue a career path in Sales and Telemarketing. This position reports to the Senior Business Manager/Business Manager under the Corporate Funding Department.  Excellence Singapore Pte Ltd is committed to provide graduates with outstanding and realistic experience and therefore train them to develop workplace skills and be the future leaders.  Specific Responsibilities  Trainee/Mid-Career Individual to be involved in: A full week training to learn about the various lending instrument offered by various Banks/Financial Institutions/ Angel Investors/ Private Equity Funding and etc. Speaking with SME Bosses to understand the problem/issues the businesses are facing. Trainee will also be taught on how to advise SME bosses on various options available in the market to assist on business cash flow. Day to day tasks ranging from cold calling/ assessing and analyzing on various company financial documents and proposing solutions to SME bosses with a Senior to guide them. Meeting participation with SME bosses together with a Senior. Understanding the common problems SMEs in Singapore are facing. Handling objections properly from various clients by applying various methods/ways. After a one full week of training, trainee will expect a short daily discussion for the senior/superior to check on their progression, to understand the issue they are facing and to guide them on how they can improve in their knowledge and skillset Getting familiarized and getting used to the corporate world structure and arrangement which will get them ready once they passed out from the traineeship period. Technical Skills and Competencies Trainee/Mid-Career will learn during SGUnited Traineeship Programme: To acquire Product Knowledge through full weeks training to learn and understand the process flow required for a loan application between the SME in Singapore and the banks. To learn how to communicate with SME bosses through telephone and email communication to understand the SME business cash flow needs. To learn Sales skill set through sales training and participation in client meetings. To learn how to be productive by using good time management skills through observation and day to day guidance from Superior. To learn how to become a team player by working closely with colleagues and being part of the team quarterly sales challenge. Duration Of Traineeship 6 months Approved Training Allowance Fresh Graduates - $2,500 Non-Mature Mid-Career Individuals - $2,500 Mature Mid-Career Individuals - $2,500 Education Qualifications Required for the Traineeship Role under SGUnited Traineeship  This position is open for both recent graduates and mid-career individuals (mature and non mature). Graduates interested in this position should possess a Degree Qualification. Mid-career individuals from any qualification level can apply.

jobTitle: Transaction Banking - Long Term Internship Program (Dec 21- Jul 22)
description: In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 17,000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets, BNP Paribas provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.  Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 73 markets with more than 196,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region.  BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced, diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits, as well as a working environment where you’re valued as part of the team. excluding partnerships https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/  Position Purpose  Intern May Shadow Multiple TB Positions And Train In a Variety Of Tasks Including  We are seeking energetic and responsible undergraduate to join our 6-month internship program. In this position, you will be exposed to the ins-and-outs of transaction banking (TB) business. You will discover how our Bank helps corporate to optimize its cash management operations, improve its trade/ working capital and liquidity management. sales management and mandate implementation analysis of Request for Proposal (RFP) product research, development and commercialization financial performance management brand & communication Please note that this is a internship that may require you to defer from university studies for the period of the assignment. Start date is early December 2021.  Responsibilities Assist in project management/ implementation Support the analysis and response to RFP/ sales pitching Analyze financial performance Support the organization of branding and marketing campaign/ event Organize meeting, prepare the discussion material and record the minutes Manage general tasks related to his/ her responsibility Participate in the Bank’s function and networking events Technical and Behavioral Competencies Pursuing an undergraduate business related degree Strong academic performance Excellent written and verbal communication skills Energetic, self-driven and responsible Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel) Primary Location  SG-06-Singapore  Job Type  Internship  Job  FINANCIAL AND TECHNICAL EXPERTISE  Education Level  Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)  Experience Level  Beginner

jobTitle: Internship / Apprenticeship Program in Business Development (Singapore)
description: OUTLINE OF OUR PROGRAMME  As An Intern You Will Be Assigned In Projects Encompassing One Of The Three Key Areas That We Focus On  At Frost & Sullivan you will have numerous growth opportunities and experiences available to you. As an intern at Frost & Sullivan, you will be part of a dynamic, global team that strives for excellence in work and social engagements. The average person spends most of their adult lives at work, yet few feel that their contributions are important or that they are being challenged. As an intern at Frost & Sullivan, you will be encouraged to develop your intellectual curiosity, will learn to leverage visionary innovation to address the global challenges of collapse, disruption, transformation and be provided the ability to collaborate across various levels of the company.  VISION & STRATEGY  The ability to visualize and articulate a possible future state for an organization or company has always been a vital component of a company's transformational growth. Disruption of the global economy, industry, companies and investments make it difficult to prepare for the future. As an  intern working on engagements related to this area, you will have the opportunity to learn research as well as analytical skills.  BRAND & DEMAND  Continually increasing competitive intensity creates infinite choices for consumers. It is becoming increasingly difficult to make a brand stand out in a densely crowded marketplace. Companies are looking for ways to connect with customers and develop lasting loyalty with customers that are  willing to advocate for their brand. In this area you will be exposed to digital and content marketing solutions.  TECHNOLOGY & IP  The rapid pace of industry convergence and the exponential creation of disruptive technologies are  providing unprecedented opportunities. Competitive innovation is the cornerstone for every business and that leads to the development of intellectual property. You will have the opportunity to work on research in new and innovative technologies and their impact on society and businesses.  Responsibilities To grow and maintain existing key accounts. Determine and understand clients’ needs through Frost & Sullivan Growth Strategy Dialogue. To support and update business activities on CRM platform. Work closely with the sales team to communicate leads and any information obtained pertaining to the business development. Utilize social networking tools to identify and pursue new leads within assigned accounts/territories. Make outbound prospecting calls and communicate via email and social media with C-level executives. Enter documentation regarding all client activities and communications into a company database system in an accurate and timely manner. Participate, as needed, in all aspects of the sale including; conducting qualifying activities and client meetings, needs assessments, delivering formal presentations and proposals, and closing new business. Qualifications Undergraduates / pre-university students Candidates should have good oral & written communication skills in English and be eligible to work in the country of application Benefits Participation in Company activities/ events. Mentorship with industry experts. Performance evaluation & feedback. Certificate upon successful completion.
industries: Management Consulting

description: Who are we?  Here at ADDX, we believe in a future where everybody can access financial ecosystems easily, fairly, and safely. That is why we’ve built the world’s first fully regulated platform for digital securities, licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.  In 2021, we raised USD 50 million in Series A funding led by Japan Investment Corporation and Development Bank of Japan. Among other esteemed investors, we are backed by Singapore Exchange and Heliconia, a subsidiary of Temasek.  We have gone through a total re-brand and promise this to be an exciting time. An integral part of a fast-growing team enabling investments in unicorns, pre-IPO companies, and hedge funds, your role is to innovate and discover new solutions.  If you believe in a future of fair financial markets, just like we do, we’ve been waiting for you at ADDX.  Who are we looking for?  We are looking for a highly motivated Client Relationship Intern to join our Business Development (BD) team. Your mission will be to support the BD team to grow our investor base sustainably.  You will be responsible for supporting the team to build a healthy pipeline of new investors and creating a robust investor acquisition process. Success in this role will lead to unparalleled on-the-job learning and a springboard to future career success in sales development and relationship management roles.  What we offer you? Competitive internship compensation Work in a top fintech, powered by blockchain, transforming the future of finance and wealth management Execute and learn with a team of industry veterans from UBS, GIC, P&G, Morgan Stanley, Credit Suisse, Oliver Wyman and BCG Responsibilities Support client acquisition strategy in a fast-growing private markets platform Help to organize data capture, data management, and insights to create scalable, tech driven sales strategy and tactics Contribute to a pipeline of quality prospects and engage for next steps Support Client Relationship Manager in nurturing client relationships from the first chat Opportunity to learn professional networking and sales pitching Maintain records in SalesForce (or equivalent CRM) with high levels of detail orientation Co-ordinate initiatives with the marketing team to develop scalable client acquisition strategy Support the ideation and organization of client friendly events, webinars, and meetings Build your fundamental skill sets in the wealth management and fintech space Requirements Penultimate year student or recent graduate Exceptional EQ and ability to instantly connect with most people you meet Strategic thinker with hunger to create impact from day 1 Strong data management and creative thinker who can drive actionable insights from data Interest to learn about working with CRM platforms Highly self-driven, well-structured yet ﬂexible, able to think strategically Excellent writing and verbal communication skills Hunger to excel in fintech, strategy, and wealth management Due to our limited capacity, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: We are looking for an energetic and entrepreneurial eCommerce Intern for the Global eCommerce team. The Global market for online grocery is growing rapidly, with the potential to realize 15% of the total turnover in terms of turnover within a few years. FrieslandCampina is leading in many markets across the world; ranging from Asia, Africa, ME, Russia, US and Europe. To get the most out of this growth, we are looking for an eCommerce intern to work with the team on further channel development.  What We Ask  Do you want to work in the world of eCommerce for 6-12 months within a large Global FMCG player? We are looking for someone who can work independently, who is committed as a fully-fledged team member, has a proactive attitude and can learn quickly. Additionally, are you a student in Business, Economics, Business Analytics, Digital Business, Creative Technology, Business & Innovation who aspires to start a career in a dynamic FMCG environment; Are you analytical and curious; Do you have ambition to develop in eCommerce or Digital; Do you have good communication skills and do you enjoy working in a matrix organization; You know how to finish a project from start to finish; Would you love to work in a Global Team?  What We Offer  You get close contact with Sales, Marketing and Shopper Marketing teams all over the world. You will be involved in all categories in which FrieslandCampina operates (dairy, cheese, butter, meat substitutes etc.) and you have to deal with multiple brands sold globally. As part of the Global team, you will be close to all our markets and in the fastest growing channel, there is no better way to get to know the full organization. Gaining experience within eCommerce also offers a good future perspective because eCommerce is only getting bigger and more important. This internship offers an all-round challenge where you will combine project management skills and stakeholder management with commercial insight and specialist eCommerce knowledge. FrieslandCampina not only rewards in money. We offer an interesting and educational internship where you develop within your field. You will be given a lot of responsibility and can of course count on good guidance and an appropriate internship fee. After all, that's how you learn the most.  Vacancy Description  This role is open for students who are available for a full-time internship for 6 months or able to do part time (2-3 days a week) for a full year  Reporting to the Global eCommerce Head in Netherlands, you will be working closely with the global eCommerce lead in both Singapore and Netherlands to assist the growth development of eCommerce Business for Consumer Dairy Business Group globally.  The ideal candidate is a self-starter, and a creative, critical thinker. You must be a strong communicator and be able to work independently to generate high-quality work while balancing multiple projects at the same time Support on data reporting and recommend actionable insights within the eCommerce team to grow brand market share and sales across multiple countries and multiple retailers Support on operationalizing scorecards to various performance KPIs. Regular monitoring of campaigns and reviewing against key performance marketing metrics. Craft and deploy content and operations hygiene standards through execution excellence on eCommerce platforms. Supporting the partnerships and operations among different players globally which include Shopee, Lazada, Pandamart, Getir, etc
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Market Research, and Consumer Goods

description: Job Description  Within the business unit Trading, the Risk Middle Office Department is in charge of the financial valuation of the Liquefied Natural Gas portfolio and associated market risks. These calculations are performed on a daily basis on the first years to come. Risk middle analysts are based in Geneva, Houston and Singapore. The internship will be in Singapore (Frasers Tower).  The Middle Office Intern will work within the LNG team to measure, analyse and monitor the P&L and the market risk exposition. The Middle Office is mainly responsible for calculating profits and losses, managing risks, apprehending the global accuracy of the information present in the trading system and creating reports to analyse the movement of markets (prices, flows, …) Produce and analyse Exposure and Risk reports to monitor the portfolio. Calculate the daily P&L changes of the desk. Analyse market movements and impact on the risks held by the Trading Desks. Work closely with Traders to quantify and explain the sources of risk in their portfolios. Collaborate with Paris, Singapore and Houston teams. Look for and put in place process improvements. Be involved in the constant improvement of the risk monitoring framework. Liaise with IT teams to ensure the enhancement the trading software. Context and environment TGPA is the corporate structure in charge of developing the Gas & Power trading activities in the Asia Pacific area and is in the early stage of its development, staffing or organization. The LNG business environment is volatile and competitive. The environment also entails working over extended time zones (Asia, Australia, UK, France). Candidate profile Good analysis skills and ability to present complex problems in a precise and concise way Interest in commodity trading is a plus Ability to think critically about results Good communication skills and ability to work in a team environment Ability to multi-task and work under pressure Good knowledge of English is required Programming skills (Python, VBA) are optional but preferred. Offer ID  45868BR  Metier  Financial Middle / Back Office  Employment type  Internship  Contract duration  6  Duration unit  Months  Experience Level Required  Less than 3 years  Employer Company  TOTAL GAS & POWER ASIA LIMITED  Branch  Gas Renewables And Power  About Us / Company Profile  The global activities of the Gas & Power Branch of TotalEnergies SA, and its affiliates, subsidiaries and associated companies (“TotalEnergies Gas & Power”, "Group" or "TotalEnergies Group") include the marketing and trading of natural gas, liquefied natural gas ("LNG") and power, the trading of liquefied petroleum gas ("LPG"), natural gas transportation and storage, as well as LNG re-gasification and the production and sale of coal and petcoke.  TotalEnergies Gas & Power’s trading teams are responsible for optimising the purchase/sales portfolios of gas, electricity, coal and LPG via transactions (arbitrage, balancing and hedging) in all recognised markets, in compliance with Group trading guidelines.  TGPA participates and supports TotalEnergies Gas & Power’s efforts in developing its energy trading network of Asian and Australian counterparts and increasing market share, identifying new opportunities and complementing the expansion of TotalEnergies Gas & Power’s trading portfolio.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Coty is a world leader in beauty and home to an illustrious roster of cosmetic, skincare and fragrance brands. And our company has a mission: to challenge the definition of beauty, to encourage authenticity and to celebrate diversity. Because to us at Coty, beauty isn’t about conforming to somebody else’s ideal. It’s about inclusion and liberating everyone to shine in their unique way.  Coty helps millions of people around the world express your beauty, your way through our rich portfolio covering fragrance, skincare, colour cosmetics, and body care. Our brands include global icons like Gucci, Burberry, Hugo Boss, Calvin Klein, Philosophy, Max Factor, Rimmel, Bourjois, Sally Hansen, Adidas, David Beckham, etc. With more than one billion products shipped each year, the possibilities for self-expression are endless.  THE ROLE About the Role… Through this role, you’ll be able to gain an understanding of: Commercial finance role: provide support to commercial team (sales & marketing) & working with cross-functional teams (custodian finance, supply chain, customer service, APAC finance team etc) to drive business growth & business operation Financial planning process (3 years plan, annual budget, monthly forecasting etc) Financial analysis, understand drivers of variances vs budget/forecast & last year, identify gaps & make recommendations Preparation of management reports for markets & total SEA region Financial control & SOX compliance Evaluating deals (pricing), promotion activities, capital expenditure investment, ROI etc Monitoring & tracking of expenses Managing collection & overdue Use of Accounting & Business intelligent systems such as SAP, SAP BI, HFM, Essbase & Kinaxis. Set-up RSP/invoice prices in SAP via Nintex  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Support Finance Manager in the co-pilot role for Singapore & Export markets Financial planning (Budgeting & Monthly Forecast) Prepare monthly key performances/management reports including identify variances & provide commentary on the key drivers Month-end closing process Prepare monthly/quarterly management reports for commercial team, SEA & APAC teams Monthly / Quarterly financial control & SOX compliance – monthly Balance sheet & accruals review, provide evidence/supporting documents etc Evaluating deals, promotion activities, capital expenditure investment, ROI etc Monitoring & tracking of A&CP spend, distributors’ A&CP commitments etc. Monitoring & tracking collection from customers & overdue (DSO) Set-up RSP / invoice prices in SAP via Nintex / Pricing controls Assist in new project  Consolidation & report preparation SEA region Monthly & Quarterly management reports Ad-hoc requests from the Global & APAC team Follow up with markets/business units on report submission, due dates etc Develop user-friendly templates for data collection  WHAT YOU’LL BRING  ESSENTIAL: Able to commit for at least 6 months (Jan to Jun 2022) for a full-time internship. Skilled in the use of MS Office tools including Outlook (or related email tool) Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Self-Motivated, with a strong work ethic and a sense of confidentiality. Possesses cross-cultural awareness and high emotional intelligence. Articulate, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Good balance of a professional attitude while having fun. Strong interest in consumer goods, make-up and beauty products. Strong desire to learn along with a strong sense of ownership. Persuasive, resilient and flexible, able to easily adapt to new challenges. Passionate, enthusiastic and driven to regularly follow-up with loose ends. Able to thrive despite challenges while adopting a positive attitude under pressure.  DESIRABLE Basic knowledge in Accounting/Business studies Currently pursuing tertiary studies in Accounting, Business studies or relates studies Hands-on, willing to learn attitude  Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you’re the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible – we’d love to hear from you.  Interested applicants may also send an email directly to LiFang_Tng@cotyinc.com.
industries: Cosmetics

jobTitle: Marketing Response Center (MRC) Intern (January to June 2022)
description: Description The duration for this internship opportunity is from January to June 2022 Applicants to this internship opportunity will need the work authorization for Singapore Do you have a desire to make a major contribution in the rapid growth environment of Cloud Computing?  Do you want to build your skills in marketing and sales for long term career growth?  If so, come build the future of tech as part of our Global Marketing Response Center (MRC) team! (Watch this video to learn more about the Global MRC team: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wo4bC0v2GgI  We are looking for talented builders to join the Global MRC team based in Singapore to engage with AWS new and prospective customers in ASEAN.  MRC is an important customer engagement arm in the Marketing organization. Our mission is to learn from customers, understand their needs, and educate them about the benefits of AWS and all the services we offer, in order to help them embark on their cloud journey quickly and easily. It is a critical function within the lead and demand generation process, with the objective to profile, nurture, and qualify marketing leads generated from various marketing events, campaigns, and activities.  Roles & Responsibilities  Work as part of the MRC team to: Build a stronger AWS leads database by interacting with customers by phone, email and/or live chat, and researching existing AWS leads to create a detailed view of the customer’s need for cloud technology. Educate customers that are in the beginning of the cloud journey and move them from warm or little interest to active interest; education to consideration. Nurture leads with tailored messaging to increase customer understanding of AWS services and unique differentiators with relevant customer use cases. Through nurture efforts, create higher value leads resulting in higher conversion rates. Work closely with Marketing and Sales stakeholders to achieve campaign goals. Opportunity to be part of a team to lead a global cross-functional MRC projects to drive operational excellence and better customer experience. description: Join Trustana and be a part of our mission to democratize access to import & export markets for all. We are working towards facilitating international participation from companies of all sizes, and supporting the evolution and modernization of SMEs globally.  Trustana is a curated B2B trade platform of verifiable, international traders. Designed to empower buyers and suppliers to grow their businesses with confidence, Trustana connects trusted trade partners and supports them through their end-to-end trade journey.  Trustana's goal is to enable buyers to bring the highest quality products to their customers by connecting them with pre-screened, curated international suppliers. It also helps suppliers to expand their customer base by supporting the internationalization of their products and connecting them with reputable buyers. The platform leverages decentralised technology to enable users to have control and ownership over their data.  Founded by Temasek, a global investment company headquartered in Singapore, Trustana is based in Singapore with a hub in China.  This position will be working closely with the go-to-market team to strategise and execute partnerships in Singapore and China.  If you are passionate about learning more about growth marketing / interested in zero to one startup challenges we would love to speak with you!  Responsibilities: Using online networking and messaging tools such as Wechat and LinkedIn to connect with potential customers Work closely with the GTM team to bring onboard customers to sign-up on to the digital platform Manage and respond to customer queries promptly Assist in drafting client marketing messages  Requirements: Preferably previous internship experience in sales and marketing function Familiar with various online messaging tools Good writing and communication skills

An excellent opportunity for a self-starter who is looking to kickstart his or her own career in the eCommerce industry.  Key Responsibilities: Assist Marketing and Sales Team for eCommerce-related responsibilities Produce SEO-Driven Copywriting for Product and Merchant Descriptions Provide Merchant Support Assist in Content Creation (photography, videography, editing, copywriting) for website, TikTok, Facebook & Instagram Assist in EDM Design & Development Support General Design Needs of the Company Other Ad-hoc Projects/Duties Assigned  Role Requirements: Ability to Commit for 3-6 Months Open to Singaporeans or PRs Qualification from Arts/MarCom/Design related industry Excellent command of English, especially in writing Ability to create TikTok videos Ability to execute basic photography and videography with editing Equipped with basic photoshop, illustrator and/or Canva design skills Passionate, vibrant, independent, fast-learner Strong sense of design with a keen eye for detail Working knowledge of content marketing principles and SEO techniques Good understanding of eCommerce (preferred) Digital marketing savviness and skill in CMS (preferred)  Giftano was built to make the world more generous, and every day more and more Singaporeans use our platform to give away gift cards. Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative?  At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. We provide energy and automation digital solutions for efficiency and sustainability.  We are looking for a 6 months intern to join us for the period of January to June 2022.  You will support sales-facing Finance Business Partners on analytical work that will guide/inform on business plan execution. Additionally, you will also support Cluster CFO on continuous improvement initiatives for finance & business functions  What will you do? Set-up and leverage project/services financial system to enable accurate forecasts, improve revenues, margin and cash performance through better understanding and analysis of financial status & projection. Perform project review & analysis of financial metrics, forecasts and actions related to Delivery financials to achieve operation plan targets. Report, track and objectively advise potential financial exposures (risks, cost over-runs, execution slippages) Support month-end reporting interim of Percentage of Completion (POC) method, utilization, and ad hoc reporting Work closely with Finance teams to ensure reporting of orders, sales, margin are accurately reported and on time Support Finance & Control team in implementing the financial governance according to local and global standard Prepare the reports and presentation on financial performance of project execution such as margin slippage and cash performance. Align with various functions to streamline and set up proper review process.  What qualifications will make you successful? Business, Accounting or Mathematics majors are preferred. Strong Excel & PowerPoint competencies. Basic accounting understanding is not a must but will be advantageous. Experience & competency in simple programming (Visual Basic, Python etc) will be a plus. Strong analytical skills with the ability to sort & process large amounts of data into meaningful analysis. Track record of strong collaboration mindset with good verbal & written communication skills. Able to independently prioritize multiple responsibilities, balancing deliverables from multiple stakeholders. Able to self-learn with minimal guidance & supervision. Confidence to ask clarifying questions whenever there is ambiguity.  What's in it for me? Competitive internship allowance Fliexible work arrangement - flexi-hours, office hoteling Medical coverage Blue Sky Friday Onsite gym and more!  Let us learn about you! Apply today.  Why us?  Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.  €25.7bn global revenue  137 000+ employees in 100+ countries  45% of revenue from IoT  5% of revenue devoted for R&D  You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled  It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. description: We are looking for two highly motivated Marketing & Communications Interns to support the regional marketing team on a number of high profile key marketing / branding projects and campaigns scheduled for launch between the months of January to the end of June 2022. Applicants must be fully committed to work during this period to qualify for the internship. Applicants need to demonstrate a ‘can do’ attitude, with the ability to work to deadlines in a fast-paced environment, and possess an excellent grasp of the English language. Working on a broad range of marketing projects, you should be flexible, quick to adapt and comfortable with working on various tasks that range from website updates, social media, events management, email marketing, data entry, research and reporting. There will also be the opportunity to become involved in a few strategic marketing projects that span across Singapore, Hong Kong and Malaysia. There will also be a week of onboarding in December to set you up for success.   Key responsibilities:  Undertake planning and implementation for key marketing projects such as Randstad Employer Brand Research, Market Outlooks and the Workmonitor Assist the marketing team in planning and organising events (virtual or physical events in compliance with local guidelines) for the Employer Brand Research and other round tables  Assist the marketing manager/executive in driving lead generation campaigns using an AI tool or other social media channels Provide support for all other internal and external marketing campaigns, communications, digital marketing initiatives, editorial projects, branding, sponsorships and events - whenever necessary; event logistics and management (for roundtables, sponsored events, trade shows and internal staff events) developing marketing literature (brochures, press releases, creatives etc) prize fulfilment for contests Update spreadsheets, presentations and marketing reports for specific projects Provide support to the marketing team and help drive online traffic to our website through content marketing, social media and other online campaigns Undertake administrative duties such as managing mailboxes, managing inventory levels of promo items, folder management, liaising with suppliers and vendors, taking meeting minutes etc.  Requirements:  Highly organised with strong work ethics (commitment to delivering quality work) A high level of accuracy and attention to detail, proofreading and collating top level information into reports Excellent time and project management skills with the ability to juggle a wide range of competing demands PC literate with good working knowledge of Microsoft Office particularly, Word and Excel Experience with video-editing and design tools, Google Drive, Docs, Sheets, Slides etc would be an added advantage Strong people skills as well as written and verbal communication skills Demonstrated ability to multi-task and adhere to deadlines Has a sense of urgency and able to work under pressure High adaptability and willingness to learn, with a strong sense of self-motivation and the ability to work independently when necessary Most importantly, the ideal candidate should be passionate, enthusiastic and knows how to work hard and have fun!  Education:  Diploma/Degree in a marketing discipline, database management, communications or a related field.  About Randstad  Randstad is the global leader in the HR services industry and specialises in solutions in the field of flexible work and human resources services. In Singapore, we have more than 28 years’ experience in recruiting the best professionals in accounting and finance, banking and financial services, corporate and secretarial support, engineering, human resources, information technology, life sciences as well as sales and marketing. By combining our human touch with technology-driven solutions and tools, we aim to offer both clients and candidates the best tools and solutions for increased efficiency and engagement, connecting more people to more jobs. Randstad currently has 34,680 corporate employees and 4,715 branches and Inhouse locations in 38 markets around the world.   Interested applicants, please do send your resume to Geraldine Lau at communications@randstad.com.sg with the subject line “Marketing Intern H1 2022”

ABOUT BLACKROCK BlackRock’s purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being. As a global investment manager and a leading provider of financial technology, our clients—from grandparents, doctors, and teachers to large institutions—turn to us for the solutions they need when planning for their most important goals. We are building a culture of innovation, curiosity, and compassion, one that enables every employee to make an impact.  THE SUMMER ANALYST PROGRAM Our Summer Analyst Program is an 8-week internship designed to provide you with an exciting, supportive and fun experience which mirrors life as an Analyst at BlackRock. You’ll have real-world responsibilities during the summer, in addition to participating in professional development, networking and social events.  The Summer Analyst Program acts as a feeder to the Full-Time Analyst Program.   OUR BUSINESS AREAS Analytics & Risk Develop and deliver tailored advice, risk management and investment services to governments, corporations and many of the world’s largest investors.  Business Management & Strategy Drive key initiatives, collaborate with internal and external partners, and ensure coordinated delivery of our capabilities.  Business Operations Work with business areas across the organization to deliver a seamless end to end investment management process, providing operational support to our portfolio management teams and client groups.  Finance & Internal Audit Provide thought leadership across the firm’s control and risk management environment to improve decision making and help achieve the firm’s objectives.  Investments Build and analyze investment strategies, portfolios and products for a broad range of institutional and retail clients.  Human Resources Attract top talent and provide comprehensive benefits plus learning and career opportunities to help our employees thrive.  Legal & Compliance Understand and advise on the impact of regulatory requirements and best practices, protect the firm’s reputation and partner with the business to meet our clients’ expectations.  Marketing & Communications Develop strategies that grow our brands and company purpose to drive profit, build relationships with both existing and new clients, and solve systemic client needs in key areas across the firm.  Sales & Relationship Management Develop and deliver investment products and solutions for clients worldwide. Create marketing strategies around these solutions and use them to build new client relationships.  Technology Build and support Aladdin, the technology platform that powers our firm and the investment industry as a whole. Utilize sophisticated technology to develop applications, deliver custom solutions and ensure a superior user experience.  APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS Read about the variety of business areas you can choose to be a part of at BlackRock. You will be able to select up to two business areas you would like to be considered for as part of your application.  Once you’ve submitted your online application, you will be asked to complete a virtual cover letter. Think of this as an opportunity to give us your elevator pitch – it is not an interview but will be considered along with your resume. This must be completed within 72 hours of submitting the written part of your application and for each business area you apply for.  APPLICATION INFORMATION Candidates must have graduated or be graduating from an undergraduate or a master’s degree program between August 2022 and July 2023, with up to 18 months’ work experience. We welcome applications from candidates studying any degree subject.  Apply for Summer Analyst Program via: https://careers.blackrock.com/early-careers  APPLICATION DEADLINE Saturday, 16 October 2021  TO FIND OUT MORE For additional information on BlackRock early career opportunities, please visit careers.blackrock.com/early-careers | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock  BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.  BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

jobTitle: 2022 QSI Summer Internship Program in Singapore
description: We Offer  Our Program is a 10-week summer internship designed to give highly students a taste of life at the world’s leading integrated Wealth Manager and Investment Bank, with the potential to join the Full-Time Program upon graduation. At the end of the Summer, offers are made to interns who we believe will be successful as full-time analysts with the Singapore Quantitative Analysis & Technology team.  Your field of responsibility  Our internships are widely regarded as one of the best and most comprehensive summer programs. You will: undergo a structured summer program, get a first-hand experience of what it is like to be a Full Time Analyst, and enjoy networking opportunities such as the Summer Speaker series and Meet the Managing Director / Director initiative where you will hear from senior representatives across various divisions.  Throughout you will receive invaluable on-the-job training, guidance and mentoring that will further develop your skills and knowledge.  Your future colleagues  Quant Engineering  The Quant Engineering team's responsibilities are to drive the strategic direction and develop the quantitative analytics library, pricing platforms and core risk engine. These are essential for the firm's capabilities in trading and risk managing derivative products.  The team sits on the trading floor and works closely with the quant modelers, IT, control functions and trading desk.  Quantitative developers have a wide range of responsibilities: Building cutting edge components within the analytics library Improving the efficiency of the library to deliver more responsive analytics to the business and clients Designing the software architecture and improving software development processes Creating tools to improve productivity of the global Quant community  Quant Strategies  The Quantitative Strategies Group at Credit Suisse is a modeling, analytics and trading risk group. Our directive is to work as a coordinated part of the trading teams to develop and deliver: pricing models; risk analytics; trader tools for risk management, hedging, and relative value; electronic market making analytics; management tools and techniques used to optimize trading decisions across the Investment Bank portfolio risks and capital; market risk models used for capital. The group is organized along business lines and sits with the trading desks.  The role entails, developing and implementing the analytics that are used in pricing and risk management, of the firm’s portfolio of securities. You will support the trading desk in using the analytics and in performing quantitative analysis.  The quant group is an integral part of the Trading team as well as a key contributor to the global modelling initiative, offering maximum interaction with traders, sales and structurers.  You Offer  To apply for the summer program, you should be / have Bachelors, Master’s or PhD in highly quantitative fields such as (Applied) Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, graduating between December 2022 – June 2023 Strong programming skills: C#, or C++, with skills in F# and Python Strong skills in software design and architecture, good to have but not required - applied within the analytics library of a front office team Pragmatic and result-oriented with outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills An interest in finance and mathematical concepts, particularly calculus and probability theory Strong aptitude for teamwork and ability to learn Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English Knowledge / experience in the financial sector or past internships in a Derivatives related environment is helpful  Your new employer  Your growth is our priority. Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to start a successful career, attractive benefits, excellent training and managers to support your development.  We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for passionate people to make an impact for our clients and communities.  Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law. If you require assistance during the recruitment process, please let your recruiter know.  How To Apply  You will need to submit your application on the Credit Suisse job portal with your CV in pdf for consideration.  Application deadline  October 10, 2021 12:00pm Singapore Standard Time  Singapore-Singapore-Singapore
industries: Banking

jobTitle: 2022 Summer Internship, Operations & Technology - Markets & Transformation
description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  2022 Summer Internship, Operations & Technology - Markets & Transformation  We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.  Do you want to be a part of a collaborative environment?  Are you motivated to be a part of driving a world beyond cash?  Are you motivated to stay on the cutting edge of technology?  The Mastercard Intern Program is a comprehensive program where students will gain hands on real work-life skills while having fun and contributing to a global company. As an intern, you will be challenged with completing projects that will enhance your skills as well as contribute to the department’s goals and objectives. Successful candidates will be assigned to a business unit within International Markets for 10 - 12 weeks.  Business Unit  Operations & Technology – Service Delivery – Markets & Transformations  The team supports definition and socialization of technology product roadmaps with regional product and Operations & Technology leadership.  Specific Projects You May Be Working On Support the team in management of the portfolio of projects to be pursued in defined planning periods and provide technical consultancy as needed for business expansion and growth Coordinating O&T efforts in supporting major sales deals/RFPs Support building and maintaining effective communication channels across the regional team to share information, enhance team culture and ensure shared ownership  Program Dates & Components Impactful assignments that drive business results Networking sessions and leadership speakers series Volunteer and team building experiences  Program Qualifications Evidence of strong academics, penultimate year of study ( graduating by June 2021) Project management, problem solving and planning skills with a demonstrated record of successfully managing multiple projects Ability to work on a team and independently Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment Experience of worked in technology roles in financial institutions is an added advantage.  Experience And Skills Needed Self-starter with a desire to learn independently Project Management skills Understanding of payment transaction processing and industry business principles Ability to seamlessly integrate and implement technical solutions to meet business requirements.  Application End date will be: Wednesday, 13 October 2021  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

description: Who are we?  Here at ADDX, we believe in a future where everybody can access financial ecosystems easily, fairly, and safely. That is why we’ve built the world’s first fully regulated platform for digital securities, licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.  In 2021, we raised USD 50 million in Series A funding led by Japan Investment Corporation and Development Bank of Japan. Among other esteemed investors, we are backed by Singapore Exchange and Heliconia, a subsidiary of Temasek.  We have gone through a total re-brand and promise this to be an exciting time. An integral part of a fast-growing team enabling investments in unicorns, pre-IPO companies, and hedge funds, your role is to innovate and discover new solutions.  If you believe in a future of fair financial markets, just like we do, we’ve been waiting for you at ADDX.  Who are we looking for?  We are looking for a highly motivated Client Relationship Intern to join our Business Development (BD) team. Your mission will be to support the BD team to grow our investor base sustainably.  You will be responsible for supporting the team to build a healthy pipeline of new investors and creating a robust investor acquisition process. Success in this role will lead to unparalleled on-the-job learning and a springboard to future career success in sales development and relationship management roles.  What we offer you? Competitive internship compensation Work in a top fintech, powered by blockchain, transforming the future of finance and wealth management Execute and learn with a team of industry veterans from UBS, GIC, P&G, Morgan Stanley, Credit Suisse, Oliver Wyman and BCG Responsibilities Support client acquisition strategy in a fast-growing private markets platform Help to organize data capture, data management, and insights to create scalable, tech driven sales strategy and tactics Contribute to a pipeline of quality prospects and engage for next steps Support Client Relationship Manager in nurturing client relationships from the first chat Opportunity to learn professional networking and sales pitching Maintain records in SalesForce (or equivalent CRM) with high levels of detail orientation Co-ordinate initiatives with the marketing team to develop scalable client acquisition strategy Support the ideation and organization of client friendly events, webinars, and meetings Build your fundamental skill sets in the wealth management and fintech space Requirements Penultimate year student or recent graduate Exceptional EQ and ability to instantly connect with most people you meet Strategic thinker with hunger to create impact from day 1 Strong data management and creative thinker who can drive actionable insights from data Interest to learn about working with CRM platforms Highly self-driven, well-structured yet ﬂexible, able to think strategically Excellent writing and verbal communication skills Hunger to excel in fintech, strategy, and wealth management Interested applicants are strongly encouraged to apply at: https://jobs.lever.co/addx/8a2a646c-feb9-453f-9146-5145a4eefb18  Do note that only applicants who apply via the above link will be considered. jobTitle: Long Internship Dec 21 - June 22 - Corporate Deposit & Liquidity APAC
description: In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 18,000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets, BNP Paribas provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.  Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 68 markets with more than 193,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region.  BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced, diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits, as well as a working environment where you’re valued as part of the team. excluding partnerships https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/  Corporate Deposit and Liquidity (“CDL”) is a dynamic and high-profile Business Line within Corporate and Institutional Banking, reporting directly to the CEO of BNP Paribas APAC. The team is responsible for the self-funding of the Corporate Bank. This objective is achieved through deposits initiatives and strategies for corporate client segments, aiming at raising ambitious levels of deposits, at an acceptable overall cost and with an adequate level of granularity and stickiness, in all markets and currencies in which we operate. The team also contributes actively to the deepening and widening of our corporate clients portfolio. The role will be under CDL within the Business Development & Financial Management team.  Responsibilities Assist in deposits sales steering activities in CIB Corporate Banking Perform ad-hoc analysis on deposits evolution and pricing Maintain and improve existing processes and Tableau reports Build new tableau reports to support sales initiatives Provide support to Business Development team in system enhancement and upgrade Contribute to improve efficiency in communication to internal stakeholders Technical & Behavioral Competencies Strong academic record at bachelor level in business, economics, finance, financial engineering or related field Strong analytical skills Attention to details Good interpersonal skills and strong cross-cultural awareness Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications, particularly in Microsoft Excel Adaptability Quick learner Programming knowledge such as excel VBA is preferred Prior work experience in business intelligence analytic tool would be an advantage Primary Location  SG-06-Singapore  Job Type  Internship  Job  SALES DEVELOPMENT  Education Level  Not indicated  Experience Level  Beginner

description: About V-Flow Tech  VFlowTech (VFT) is reinventing vanadium redox-flow energy storage technology. VFT’s energy storage solution is a uniquely designed, long-lasting and reliable product for the utility and renewable energy industry. The battery works through the continuous reduction and oxidation reaction between the vanadium redox couples with no detrimental issues with the cross-mixing of the redox couples. Due to the unique setup, the electrolyte has no degradation, and the battery provides stable performance over 20 years.  VFT is a vibrant fast-paced start-up in a growth industry. We are looking for experienced individuals proud of their technical skills and applying their skills to one of the greatest challenges to mankind in this century: Climate change. Our energy storage solutions are the key to unlocking the potential of renewables. If you have what it takes and look forward to challenges, we welcome you to talk to us.  Roles & Responsibilities We are a local company in the green energy industry, first in Singapore to develop and deliver environment-friendly smart redox flow batteries to customers globally. We have a role for a candidate for Business Internship for the following responsibilities: Partner closely with business team to understand the market challenges and growth goals and build a multidimensional market research strategy to support the overall business objectives. Leveraging support from business team; drive competitive analysis, develop market intelligence strategies and support cross-partner sales campaigns include events, email programs, account-based marketing, digital marketing, and 3rd party programs to help team to achieve sales KPIs. Develop business plan for VFT in the Southeast Asia region. Identify hot topics and trends which support the business development strategy. Evaluate the feasibility of V-Flow battery in microgrid solutions. Perform a detailed competitor benchmarking and suggest a competitive pricing strategy for VFT product. Identify and qualify business opportunities, work closely with business team on pitches and capability statements, and track pitch outcomes. Supporting sales initiatives and lead generations. Assist with Proposals and Contract Negotiations. Support and coordinate with the corporate team for the internal and communications. Learning Outcomes & Objectives Learning on redox flow batteries and the company competitive edge in the market. Understand the key GTM strategy for vanadium redox flow batteries. Learn to generate, screen and qualify leads. Learn to initiate market research and sales operation. Requirements Degree in Business Administration/Marketing/Mass Communications/Engineering or equivalent. Currently enrolled in Master Business/ Accounting, MBA. Excellent communication, copy-writing and problem-solving skill. Networking expert communicates superbly and enthusiastically. Proven critical thinker and team-player who can make independent decisions and proactively helps others across other functions. Should be self-starters and be able to work with minimal direction. #Internship #Clean Green Technology #Local University
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Oil & Energy

description: Role Description  Growing Fin-Tech company looking for a candidate with strong interest in banking (leverage finance or trade finance), fin-tech, or other financial services. The right candidate will grow into a client facing position focused on the origination, relationship management, and onboarding of new clients across the globe including Large Cap Companies (Fortune 500), the world’s largest banks, asset managers, hedge funds, and other investors. The person will gain exposure to all facets of the company including client solutions, product development, origination, marketing, finance and operations. The ideal candidate will be motivated, entrepreneurial, flexible, willing to wear many hats and a fast learner.  Competencies  Assist client solutions and business development efforts through managing client communication and follow-ups, preparing client presentations and financial analysis within Asia Pacific and the Middle East region. The ideal candidate would possess strong commercial and financial acumen alongside solid communication skills in order to see through the customer life cycle efficiently. Customer set include large global corporates, asset managers and banks. As part of the role, you will work closely with the company’s sales and leadership team and will have the opportunity to collaborate with various stakeholders such as product, operations and legal teams to manage client experience.  You will be involved in providing market intel, research and analytics, trading support, and multiple other solutions to the international LiquidX client base, support deal origination and structuring by providing research and credit analysis (Bloomberg, CapIQ, etc.). The right candidate will have the opportunity to liaise with many parties (internal and external) for liquidity analysis, onboarding, support product development and platform buildouts as well as product roll-outs, develop and maintain marketing pitch materials.  Key Responsibilities Support onboarding and day to day relationship with clients in the Asia Pacific and the Middle East Region. Perform financial analysis and credit analysis to assess corporate credits. Conducting market research on clients to identify business opportunities. Working closely with product team to communicate and build solutions to address client pain points. Maintaining deal pipeline and communications with clients. Providing operational support for transactions including collection and preliminary review of onboarding and transactional documents. Develop and maintain pitch materials, consolidate responses to RFP and assist with other business development materials. Developing business case / plans for new ideas on an ad hoc basis. Qualifications Required Well-versed in domain areas of financial markets including credit/fixed income markets. Relevant experience in financial services and / or trade finance / trade credit insurance preferred. Fresh graduates welcome. Degree holder and above Detail oriented, resourceful and a self-starter who is proactive and takes initiative. Strong communication skills with the ability to influence outcomes. Willing/able to learn quickly in a challenging but rewarding environment. Good written communication skills Must have entrepreneurial spirit and be able to adapt in a dynamic environment. Approved Training Allowance Fresh graduates: S$2,500 Mid career below 40 years old: S$2,800 Mid career 40 years old and above: S$3,000 Duration  6 months, please indicate earliest start date.
industries: Capital Markets, Banking, and Financial Services

description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  What You Will Learn How a fast-growing E-commerce logistics start-up operates Hands-on experience working within the Operations and Fleet Management Functions Challenges of balancing delivery capacity with demand, and how to manage it Data analysis to solve problems and drive operational decisions Responsibilities Generation of key documents and deliverables as required by department management Planning, scheduling and implementation of plans for fleet operations Project management and coordination Ensure adherence to safety and quality standards, compliance to standards and maintenance of monitoring programs Identify and process potential process abuses, non-compliance to SOPs and adherence to service standards Management of internal and external stakeholders, including but not limited to customer service, shipper support, sales support, staff fleet personnel and all other relevant parties Ensure smooth day to day operations and upholding of monitoring and control system Requirements Outstanding verbal and written communication skills Ability to problem solve by rationally breaking down problems and conceptualizing solutions Highly motivated and willing to learn Can-do attitude Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.
