description: For our internship program, you will be involved in different industries and different tasks as below:  Industries: Franchise, trading company, cleaning companies, investment holding companies, services rendering companies, non-profit organisation (ex: MCST) and etc.  Tasks Daily updates on receipts into accounting software (Eg: Xero, Quickbook, SQL, and our AI system) Checking and filing of sales and purchase invoices Preparation of payment and updating it into the accounting system Prepare simple full set of accounts and monthly management report Preparation of Bank Reconciliation Assist in preparation of simple unaudited financial statement and tax computation Any other duties/tasks assigned by supervisors Candidates who have eagerness to learn and without experience are welcome to apply.  Preferred Singaporean And PR.  We welcome you to join our family, to learn and work in a fun accounting environment.

Entrepreneurial Internship  Fredrik Marine is a Maritime Technology company. Headquartered in Singapore, we design/develop/deploy cutting edge technological products and solutions for the global fleet. We build, deploy and maintain maritime technology systems such as satellite communication systems, long range microwave broadband systems, covert marine tracking systems that does not run on GPS/Glonass/Galileo/Beidou.  Our company partners with global maritime technology partners in integrating their technology and/or products into our solution offerings, serving a predominately European and Singapore clientele, and is now charting new frontiers for growth across the South-East Asia region. The company's website can be viewed here: http://fredrikmarine.com  The firm is headed by Nicholas Chan, a Singapore serial entrepreneur, business mentor and former early stage venture capitalist. His profile can be viewed here: http://linkd.in/nicholaschancj  What is the Entrepreneurial Internship  The Entrepreneurial Internship is currently into its 13th year, having first started with Azione Capital taking in its first apprentice in 2006.  Alumni of the Entrepreneurial Internship has went on to start (and sell) their own companies, others worked their way rapidly into leadership positions within other organisations and some stayed on to head up companies with Nicholas and his team.  Structured in the form of a classic 3 year apprenticeship with the focus on the transference of skills by the principal of "do as I say, learn from how I do", everything is practically taught by highly experienced businessmen and not by theoretical academics, corporate staff or government officials.  The Entrepreneurial Internship has a typical annual intake of 1 - 2 individuals. All shortlisted applicants will be put into a 3-phase interview spanning an average of 1 1/2 months. At the last phase of the interview, the individual will be asked on which track will he/she want to be primarily trained in, the duration of the training they are committing to (6 months, 1 year, 2 years) and the milestones they will be committing to achieve during the training period.  Since 2016, the Entrepreneurial Internship has opened up its multi-disciplinary training to allow outstanding long term 2-year apprentices to work across multiple companies that Nicholas and his business associates are involved in (business consulting, early stage investments, fashion apparel group, software development house, agriculture technology and supplies), spanning various SouthEast Asian countries (Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Myanmar, Vietnam).  Why would you want to work in Fredrik Marine You want to get your hands dirty and learn first-hand on the ground just how a small technology company really runs, and to be deeply involved in this process. You are the type of person whereby when you see a problem, you fix it immediately; you do not assemble a committee to discuss the problem for the next 2 years. You want to be recognised and measured by the results of your own two hands, and not be the paper qualifications you possess/not possess, and definitely NOT by the perfect 4.0 GPA you may/ may not have. In return, you will learn to measure a company not by how much money it raised, nor by the sheer amount of press coverage it gets, not by the "cool hip" factor of being associated with it, but by how much revenue it is making and will be making in the future, by the impact of how much value it creates for itself, its stakeholders and its clients. You have the insatiable need to get meaningful and productive things done rather than wasting your time on Facebook/Twitter/Instagram; you don't fancy being stuck behind a desk and abhor going for meaningless time-wasting mind-and-ego-inflating shallow events. You actively seize problems and seek problems to fix, and "getting things done" is as natural as breathing to you. To you, anywhere is an office as long as you can get your tasks done, and anytime is the measure of your capabilities and abilities to perform. You believe in results, focusing on "the mission first" as opposed to imagined outrage. Whatever your life situation and circumstances, you are constantly driven with the burning desire for success, pushing over and beyond your boundaries and limitations to achieve your mission objectives. Learning as you go is an ability that is second nature to you. Responsibilities and Duties  As an entrepreneurial intern at Fredrik Marine, you will be given multiple challenges to meet, genuine opportunities to learn and the ability to decide what you want to earn. As at August 2019, there are numerous ongoing product representation negotiations and contract signings, ongoing sector-segmented marketing campaigns, active expansion activities into 2 Asian countries and the USA, a massive overhaul operation on all corporate materials, a broader engagement strategy on maritime community engagement; there is never a dull moment.  Who will you work with and learn from  You Will Be Working Alongside The Managing Director, Operations Manager And R&D Engineer For a Minimum Of 6 Months Up To a Maximum Of 2 Years (we Are Fine With You Doing This Internship During Your School Term) On Any Combination Of The Belowmentioned Areas; Do Note That This List Is NOT Exhaustive  Business Development Structure existing and new products/services into sector-based solutions Create/rewrite/refactor product/services corporate collateral Work together with the direct mail staff on monthly campaigns Streamline and clean up the direct mail campaign regional databases Establish and nurture new channels in Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and Philippines for certain key product lines Work with existing clients to better understanding their needs (current and future), and structuring engagement plans for next 12 months for each individual client Re-work existing sales deck, re-factor into segment-based decks Meet with new clients and present together with either Managing Director or business development staff Design, deploy and maintain business development campaigns, including lead generation and relationship building Project Management Design, development and beta deployment of a cloud-based maritime services Launch of various brand distribution/technical representation into SouthEast Asia Expansion of yachting sector business scope and coverage Requirements  Having the Right Mindset  Ask not what your internship can do for you, but what you can do for yourself, your mentor and your own future. You are a person that measure your internship not by the hours you clock-in but by the number of opportunities you can seize and act upon. In your work, you ensure that your yes is yes, and your no is no. Your focus is on the needs of the customer, not on yourself or your personal comfort. You believe that if anything is to be done, it must be done to the very best of your abilities; you do not give excuses and find someone/something else to blame. You expect, and even demand that your internship to be one where you will stretch your limits and discover your potential to the fullest, outside your years spent in theory-based educational environments. You always seek to do what is meaningfully hard, not what is convenient and a easy addition to your "feather in your cap" collection. No Age and Gender Discrimination  Whether you are a fresh GCE O level graduate (Nicholas started his first company right after his GCE O levels when he was 16) or a corporate person looking into an entrepreneurial career and wanting to get your feet wet in a rapidly changing entrepreneurial environment, feel free to apply!  Less Emphasis On Educational Qualifications  We DO NOT scrutinize your educational qualifications. While we recognise that being able to communicate and write in basic English is important, these are the X-factors that we will really look out for: Ability to get things done, and done with excellence Self driven and work autonomously; this is an Entrepreneurial internship after all, not a job Have a great attitude; knowing how and when to say Please, Thank You and I am sorry is critical Always going the extra mile; we aim to please Continuous learning; we recognize that we learn by doing, and that making mistakes are fine as long as we correct ourselves. Listen actively and pro-active in finding solutions to problems rather than always waiting for instructions Have a good moral compass; we do business right. So GCE 'O' level, GCE 'A' level students, ITE graduates, Polytechnic and University graduates, are all welcome!  How to Apply for the Entrepreneurial Internship  If You Like What You Are Reading So Far, Send In Your Application And Tell Us The Following (a Paragraph For Each Question Is Good Enough, We Just Want To Know What Makes You Tick) Why you are the person we must have on our team, and what you bring to the table. Tell us about what you want to achieve in your life and how this internship would play a critical role in your life journey. Tell us what you want to take up (in the section "Responsibilities and Duties"), how you intend to work on these areas, and how long you are committing to the programme, should you be given the opportunity to do so. OPTIONAL: If you have any of the additional skills below, please do flag them out in your application: Language fluency in Bahasa Melayu, Bahasa Indonesia, Thai, Tagalog, Myanmar Prior experience and existing connections from working in the maritime and/or oil & gas and/or yachting sectors Designing of print and/or web materials Knowledge and experience in integrating administrative structures Corporate sales experience Technical skills in computer/mobile hardware and software (including troubleshooting) Note: There is NO internship allowance. As an Entrepreneurial Intern of our company, once you are past your Basic Business Training phase, you are free to negotiate on the area(s) of business/profit centres YOU will take responsibility to lead and run, and on the profit spilt you would receive from the work and deals that you successfully made and closed.  Should your experience with us be fruitful and meaningful, we are willing to explore the possibilities of retaining you in the company for full-time positions or encourage and assist you to proceed with your own start-up.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Life is different at N3. We are driven by our passions and propelled by our quest to innovate, thrive and learn. We are the tastemakers of technology, transforming the way the world works and shaping the future of business. We work hard. We play hard. We make moves. Here, success is no accident. It’s ours to grow.  N3, Part of Accenture, is a sales and marketing solutions firm dedicated to working with software and technology solutions providers. Our client base includes a range from small start-up companies to market leaders such as Microsoft, Cisco, Google, and more as well as their partner networks. N3 has sustained rapid growth since its founding in 2004.  We are a performance-based organization that rewards creativity, hard work, and success. N3 is not your typical corporate environment. Our business casual atmosphere and fast-paced workday make N3 a unique place to work.  Scope 1: QUALITY ASSURANCE  Responsibilities Ensure quality metrics are met by assessing accurate samples and monitor process improvement initiatives Responsibilities include agent-wise quality monitoring of transactions (chats, email, call recordings), team level quality analysis, conducting calibration, creative approvals, performing fraud audits and compliance audits, and defining and updating quality frameworks to match the workflows Often required to track team reporting, present audit findings to client and internal stakeholders, provide feedback and coaching to agents to improve quality, attend sessions with client stakeholders to provide insights on quality improvements and collaborate with training to help develop agent quality improvement plans Should have solid understanding of workflow, tools used for providing services Have experience working as an Agent in same/similar workflows Experience 3 years of work experience, with a desire to excel in a fast-paced work environment, adaptability to prioritize workload based on moving targets Experience working with CRM applications is a must Must be able to demonstrate proficiency in spelling, grammar, and overall business communication with or without the assistance of a word processor (spell check) Willingness to provide direct feedback to peers in a private environment with management approval (without management supervision) Scope 2: TRAINER  Responsibilities Conduct training for new and experienced employees Assist in the creation of eLearning courses, assessments, and certifications Meet with clients and stakeholders Perform needs analysis and make training recommendations Report on training activities to clients and stakeholders Create and schedule classes Establish and maintain an enthusiastic work environment and culture Counsel and provide guidance to managers on employee professional development Build relationships with managers and employees Recommend improvements and ways to streamline training sessions and methods Escalate issues posing business risk to management Utilize the Learning Management System to administer courses, surveys, register class participants, analyze training, and create training reports as needed Experience 3+ years of experience working in training in IT Sales / Tech Industry or position of primary training is required Experience using software such as Adobe Captivate, Articulate Storyline, Kahoot, and/or Mentimeter Good to have: Google AdWords certification or strong working experience with it Good to have: Experience with Digital Marketing or online advertising. Eg: Facebook marketing, Pinterest marketing etc Data Protection Requirement Adhere to all N3 Data Protection policies, standards, and procedures per your role. Take required continuing education courses in Data Protection at N3 for your role. Equal Employment Opportunity  N3 recruits, hires, and promotes for all positions without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, handicap or veteran's status. All terms and conditions of employment such as compensation, benefits, work assignment, availability of facilities and privileges of employment are administered on the same basis of equality.

jobTitle: 2022 Summer Analyst Program - Pathway to FinTech - Aladdin Client Services
description: About BlackRock BlackRock’s purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being. As a global investment manager and a leading provider of financial technology, our clients—from grandparents, doctors, and teachers to large institutions—turn to us for the solutions they need when planning for their most important goals. We are building a culture of innovation, curiosity, and compassion, one that enables every employee to make an impact.  Our Summer Analyst Program Our Summer Analyst Program is an 8-week (June - August 2022) internship designed to provide you with an exciting, supportive and fun experience which mirrors life as an Analyst at BlackRock. You’ll have real-world responsibilities during the summer, in addition to participating in professional development, networking and social events.  The Summer Analyst Program acts as a feeder to the Full-Time Graduate Analyst Program.  What's Aladdin Client Services? Aladdin Client Services role is part of the Aladdin Product Services within BlackRock Solutions’ Aladdin Business unit. BlackRock Solutions’ mission is to provide BlackRock with the best risk analytics and investment management platform, as well as to use this platform to offer a variety of tools and services to other large institutional investors. The Aladdin Client Services provides front line client services and training for Aladdin, BlackRock’s proprietary Investment and Trading management system.  Every day, the Aladdin Client Services Team tackles the hardest, most sophisticated analytical problems in FinTech. We utilize our in-depth understanding of Aladdin, our clients’ businesses, and the investment management process to provide exceptional client service to our rapidly growing, global client base. We all come from varied educational backgrounds, bring unique skills and experiences to the table, but share a serious passion for solving tough problems for our clients, adding value to their business and keeping our clients happy.  As a Summer Analyst, you will Answer questions and help our clients run their businesses on Aladdin: You will solve problems that matter, making direct and measurable difference to our clients. In the process, you will build technical, industry, and relationship skills. Have a good understanding of Fixed Income, Equity, Derivatives and Alternatives products and how they are modeled and traded in Aladdin.  Use technology to solve problems: Use technical skills (like SQL, UNIX, Python) to ensure the accuracy of large analytical data sets, automate processes with scripts and efficiently query information from a vast database.  Educate users, leverage service insights, and relay user experience feedback to improve the customer experience and our product: We believe that the best customer service is proactive, not reactive. We are students of our own data and engage with our clients to keep problems from arising, rather than dealing only with issues that are brought to our attention.  Work on a global team, with a local presence: Our support model follows the sun – if a market is open somewhere in the world, so are we! You will get to work with teams across the world, while still engaging with a vibrant local team.  Application Instructions If this is something of your interest, apply now! When filling out your online application form, please select "Sales & Relationship Management - Aladdin Client Services" under program.  Once you’ve submitted your online application, you will be asked to complete a virtual cover letter. Think of this as an opportunity to give us your elevator pitch – it is not an interview but will be considered along with your resume. jobTitle: Internship / Apprenticeship Program in Business Development (Singapore)
description: OUTLINE OF OUR PROGRAMME  As An Intern You Will Be Assigned In Projects Encompassing One Of The Three Key Areas That We Focus On  At Frost & Sullivan you will have numerous growth opportunities and experiences available to you. As an intern at Frost & Sullivan, you will be part of a dynamic, global team that strives for excellence in work and social engagements. The average person spends most of their adult lives at work, yet few feel that their contributions are important or that they are being challenged. As an intern at Frost & Sullivan, you will be encouraged to develop your intellectual curiosity, will learn to leverage visionary innovation to address the global challenges of collapse, disruption, transformation and be provided the ability to collaborate across various levels of the company.  VISION & STRATEGY  The ability to visualize and articulate a possible future state for an organization or company has always been a vital component of a company's transformational growth. Disruption of the global economy, industry, companies and investments make it difficult to prepare for the future. As an  intern working on engagements related to this area, you will have the opportunity to learn research as well as analytical skills.  BRAND & DEMAND  Continually increasing competitive intensity creates infinite choices for consumers. It is becoming increasingly difficult to make a brand stand out in a densely crowded marketplace. Companies are looking for ways to connect with customers and develop lasting loyalty with customers that are  willing to advocate for their brand. In this area you will be exposed to digital and content marketing solutions.  TECHNOLOGY & IP  The rapid pace of industry convergence and the exponential creation of disruptive technologies are  providing unprecedented opportunities. Competitive innovation is the cornerstone for every business and that leads to the development of intellectual property. You will have the opportunity to work on research in new and innovative technologies and their impact on society and businesses. To grow and maintain existing key accounts. Determine and understand clients’ needs through Frost & Sullivan Growth Strategy Dialogue. To support and update business activities on CRM platform. Work closely with the sales team to communicate leads and any information obtained pertaining to the business development. Utilize social networking tools to identify and pursue new leads within assigned accounts/territories. Make outbound prospecting calls and communicate via email and social media with C-level executives. Enter documentation regarding all client activities and communications into a company database system in an accurate and timely manner. Participate, as needed, in all aspects of the sale including; conducting qualifying activities and client meetings, needs assessments, delivering formal presentations and proposals, and closing new business. Undergraduates / pre-university students Candidates should have good oral & written communication skills in English and be eligible to work in the country of application Participation in Company activities/ events. Mentorship with industry experts. Performance evaluation & feedback. Certificate upon successful completion.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Management Consulting

description: Reports To  CPO  Job Overview  GoGMGo is a new, exciting F&B SuperApp looking to defragment the industry’s technology landscape. We are on the lookout for a Product Manager Intern to look after three key elements:  Business – Product Management is above all else a business function, focused on maximising business value from our product. This Product Manager Intern should be obsessed with optimising our product suite to achieve the business goals while maximising return on investment.  Technology – There’s no point defining what to build if you don’t know how it will get built. This doesn’t mean this Product Manager Intern needs to be able to sit down and code but understanding the technology stack and most importantly understanding the level of effort involved is crucial to making the right decisions. This is even more important in an Agile environment, such as GoGMGo’s, where this Product Manager Intern will spend more time day-to-day with the development team than with anyone else inside the business.  User Experience – Last but not least, this Product Manager Intern is the voice of the user inside the business and must be passionate about the user experience. Again this doesn’t mean being a pixel pusher but you do need to be out there testing the product, talking to users and getting that feedback first hand – especially in a start-up, to manage a higher level of customer satisfaction, aid in retaining customers, and demonstrate product usage. You are also required to understand the customer success criterion in and out, and come up with relevant, practical solutions and prove your mettle as a trusted advisor for our customers.  Finally, act as a core team member to ensure the success of a fast-paced and high growth start-up.  Responsibilities & Duties Determines customers’ needs and desires by specifying the research needed to obtain market information. Recommends the nature and scope of present and future product lines by reviewing product specifications and requirements with end users; appraising new product ideas and/or product changes. Assesses market competition by comparing the company’s product to competitors’ products. Provides source data for product line communications by defining product marketing communication objectives. Obtains product market share by working with Sales and Customer Success teams to develop product sales strategies. Assesses product-market fit data by calling on customers with field salespeople and evaluating sales call results. Provides information for management by preparing short-term and long-term product sales forecasts and special reports and analyses; answering questions and requests. Brings new products to market by analyzing and documenting proposed product requirements and product development programs; preparing return-on-investment analyses; establishing time schedules with the development team while coordinating any relevant User Acceptance Testing and release communications. Introduces and markets new products by developing time-integrated plans with sales, customer success, and development teams. Determines product pricing by utilizing market research data; reviewing acquisition, sales, & support costs; anticipating volume; costing special and customized change requests. Completes operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees; following up on work results. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field is a must. Proven work experience in the F&B and/or Retail industry is preferred. Previous exposure to the technical product development lifecycle is a must. Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done. Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience in implementing customer solutions in a direct engagement capacity. Should have a passion for benefiting customers and a desire to deeply understand their needs. Ability to maintain a high-valued outcome-based relationship with an eclectic customer profile base. Capability to gain trust and credibility by addressing customer’s needs and concerns.

description: To reinvent an industry, you have to build the best team. Join Formlabs if you want to bring groundbreaking professional 3D printers to the desktop of every designer, engineer, researcher, and artist in the world.  Marketing internship at Formlabs crosses all disciplines – content, operations, analytics, product, sales, and more. Whether it's analyzing data to drive revenue, creating compelling content, or exploring new opportunities in the market, your work will impact the business level goals and help accelerate our growth goals.  As part of the Channel marketing team in APAC your role is to support the overall marketing strategy for the region. You will be empowered to exercise creative thinking to solve problems on your own and develop new campaign ideas, and will be responsible to see them through.  The Job: Working closely with our network of channel partners across APAC to ensure they have the tools and resources required to run successful marketing campaigns. Assist new product launches, online and in person events and ad hoc promotional campaigns. Manage regular website content updates using our CMS system Support marketing automation programs including email setup, segmentation, and other aspects of lead collection and routing Explore opportunities in marketing outside of your field of study Contribute to and support PR and awareness efforts with research, deadline tracking, and content writing Help design, prepare and print marketing samples Manage sample production queues to maximise printer utilization  You: Are not scared to demonstrate creative thinking Are able work independently with minimal supervision Are fluent in English Are well-rounded marketing professional who is ready to tackle new challenges / tasks Have strong interest or prior experience with digital marketing Have agile mindset Are ready to get your hands dirty with hands on 3D printing  Bonus: Prior experience or knowledge of 3D Printing industry Korean language preferable  We build amazing things. Come join us.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Even if you don't check every box, but see yourself contributing, please apply. Help us build an inclusive community that will change the face of 3D printing.

description: Break into the data industry as Nugit’s next Customer Support Intern.  Headquartered in Singapore, Nugit is searching for a Customer Support Intern to join our growing Customer Success team.  In this role you’ll have the opportunity to learn more about data visualization, massaging, structuring while being exposed to lots of different types of complex data.  You will have the opportunity to work with all departments from Marketing and Sales to Product and Engineering.  What you’ll be doing: Support the data quality and product experience of Nugit through the review, analysis, and processing of large quantities of data provided by our clients. Assist in troubleshooting customer needs together with our Customer Support Executives Ensure data quality of Excel files received to allow a smooth upload onto Nugit. Generate customized data stories for Nugit users, allowing them to easily digest data and view actionable insights. Test new features and updates, and provide feedback to the Product and Engineering Teams using Nugit and 3rd Party tools. Support key accounts during their initial onboarding with Nugit.  Requirements This role is right for you if you: Are studying for a business, analytics, statistics, or math degree; have a right and left brain approach to problem-solving; are passionate about data but not necessarily an expert yet; want to break into the data industry by learning the ins and outs of data cleaning and harmonization; want to help build & shape an innovative software that challenges legacy analytics solutions such as dashboards and BI Tools; want to work with a wide range of different clients from enterprises, brands, tech companies, and agencies; want a pathway to Account Management at a tech company; are searching for a company culture that encourages and fosters learning and collaboration; want to work with some incredible people who are leaders in their field.  Preferred Skills: Basic knowledge of Javascript and/or SQL Familiarity with Excel formulas such as Vlookup etc. Exposure/knowledge on Google Ads, Facebook Ads, or any other digital/analytics platforms

Plan, produce and manage the content calendar across our social media channels (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Youtube, LinkedIn) to increase traffic to our website and app. Develop and execute a strong brand strategy and image for our incoming brands, with the long-term goal of developing the brands to be top household brands in the market Assist in the brainstorming, development and execution of branding and sales campaigns together with the sales and e-commerce teams Assist with streamlining social media accounts to ensure uniform content and tone of voice Track, monitor and understand content performance through insights and analytics Perform community building proactively by monitoring and replying followers  KEY REQUIREMENTS:  Excellent written English is a must; able to communicate effectively and creatively Good attention to detail and an eye for good composition and layout Eager to learn, self-starter and problem solver mentality Familiarity with social media: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and TikTok Basic knowledge of Esports and games (namely Valorant, Mobile Legends: Bang Bang) Must have video editting skills (Adobe Premiere Pro) Good to have photo editing, Canva and Adobe skills (Photoshop, Illustrator etc) Product photography and videography skills is a bonus Available PT/FT for at least 6 months Remuneration based on commitment period If you're keen in this role, please include a portfolio in your CV. Your Portfolio should include videos produced by you too.  ADDED ADVANTAGE:  Passion for Esports Love the start-up/SME culture Inclusivity and Compassion for Others

description: Own and develop your market and work as a specialist consultant Work with the world's biggest brands  About Our Client  PageGroup has been bringing the world's best employers and brightest professionals together for over 40 years. Operating through three internationally recognized and respected brands: Page Executive, Michael Page and Page Personnel, we have the global strength to think and act beyond the boundaries of location or business function.  We are a B2B group within the 'information sales' space, serving most Fortune 500 organizations. We have an outstanding market lead in APAC. Singapore continues to be an important regional hub for most organizations though the landscape has changed dramatically in the last year - becoming more competitive and sophisticated. Our Financial Services, Finance & Accounting, Sales & Marketing, Digital, Technology, HealthCare and LifeScience, Engineering & Manufacturing, Supply Chain & Procurement, Human Resource, Legal, Business Support and Customer Service desks are well established businesses in the SEA region and is specialized across IT & Financial Services, Media, Fintech, E-commerce, Healthcare & LifeScience, FMCG, Manufacturing, Engineering. As we continue to invest in this business, we are looking to hire new Consultants for our desks.  Job Description  Reporting to the Manager for this business, the role will be responsible for new and existing business development within our client base.  The key measures of success in this role will be (but not limited to): Sourcing - be a key point of contact for the internal (HR) talent acquisition needs Lead Generation - drive activities, events, meetings for the purpose of networking and generating leads that are commercial important for the business Key Account Management - we partner with most top brands with their recruitment needs for the Singapore market so this role will be responsible for managing some of these key relationships Team Management - if you are someone with a passion to lead a sales business, this role will have the opportunity to manage a team of 1-4 people in the next 24 months Engagement - use social media, events, cold calling as an engagement tool to drive new business development Closing - we are looking for someone with strong negotiation skills as this role requires an ability to close  The Successful Applicant  We Are Looking For Colleagues With Bachelors' Degree with at least1 year experience of having worked within recruitment and/or sales Individual contributor role, opportunity to manage a team in 1.5-2 years Managerial role available for those with people management experience Passion for a commercial role and what you have done in your career to demonstrate such passion Strong values that are in line with ours High level of energy and ability to build rapport with C-level executives as business development activity is focused on targeting global/regional leaders from the sector  What's On Offer  We provide unlimited international career opportunity within our worldwide network of offices. You will receive development throughout your career and work with a dynamic team that are proud and passionate about what they do and enjoy having fun too! Excellent basic salaries Performance based bonus - potential to earn between 6 and 12 months bonus 20 days annual leave Dynamic, flexible work environment Fast track into management opportunities Industry leading training program - come and learn from the best! Individual and team based incentives Exposure to the world's biggest multinational brands and industry leaders Recognition as an industry expert Opportunity to move to international office locations  Contact: Celeste Goh  Quote job ref: JN-092021-3601490

description: Marvable? Here's why you should bother  We are a high growth Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) e-commerce start-up.  Our mission? Help people create workspaces they actually love spending time in.  To achieve this, our team has built market-leading brands like ErgoTune (ergonomic chair) and EverDesk+ (standing desk).  Having grown more than 10x in the past 3 years, tens of thousands of consumers and companies alike now rely on our products to help them work better and live healthier.  If you want to make an impact at a high growth start-up, become an expert in the e-commerce space, or be part of building a great multi-generational brand — join us!  What's this role about? A passion for content marketing, brand perception/relations Working knowledge of priority social platforms including Instagram, YouTube, Facebook, TikTok and Twitter Strong tactical understanding of media consumption habits of an average consumer Good sense of visual communication and UX principles Strong understanding of social media trends, digital marketing concepts and strategies An ability to think & work strategically and systematically Currently pursuing a degree/diploma in Mass Communications, Marketing, or a related course of studies Bonus: High emotional intelligence and empathy for partners/ customers

description: At Pedro Group Pte Ltd, our mission is to offer high quality products and services with a commitment to perfection. We rely on each and every employee to help us meet this goal.  In the Management Associate program, we are committed to develop potential candidates to be our Shop Manager who will lead the success of our retail outlet towards greater heights. You will be exposed through an accelerated program that exposes you to the whole spectrum of the Retail Sales Career Path.  Programme Progression  Required  Management Trainees are required to successfully perform the following roles as part of their progression with the company in retail operations  Career Path for candidates  Customer Service Executive ->Senior Customer Service Executive -> Supervsior -> Training Assistant Shop Manager-> Assistant Shop Manager -> Training Shop Manager -> Shop Manager  Shop Manager  This program will take approximately 1 - 2 years depending on the performance of the management associate.  Our Shop Manager will manage a local retail store and the team.  The Program  Phase 1: Retail Exposure Program  Skills  Following are some hands-on skills that trainees will have to be competent at  Trainees will undergo OJT by assigned buddy and perform the roles of sales/service professional and Shop Manager. Shop Tour - Understanding the trading areas Selling Floor - Display standards, color coordination of products etc Stock Room - Inventory Management Pricing & Product Knowledge Promotion & Sales Process Customer Service Standards Sales / Targets Achievement People Management and Development Documentation and procedures Phase 2: Leadership Development Program  Leading & Coaching Sales Associate in the retail outlets for the day-to-day sales and operations duties Managing sales targets including setting and monitoring of sales targets Responsible for maintaining professional standards of customer care including managing customer feedback, performing customer recovery and etc. Managing inventories of the outlets including organizing the storeroom, ensuring adequate stock level & sizing Managing visual display Executing other administrative duties that include: conducting staff appraisal, staff scheduling and roster, setting of sales targets and etc. Quarterly presentations to the Operations Team and Management We Are Looking For Talent Who Are Must have a Degree in Business Management or related disipline Willing to work retail hours Willing to work in a fast-paced environment. Possess effective interpersonal skills and love to interact with people from all walks of life Sales oriented and passionate for achieving of sales targets Possess good salesmanship and sense of entrepreneurship Able to work effectively with a diverse workforce i.e. people of different ages, races and etc Maintaining a well-groomed, professional appearance while at work. Strong interest in fashion styling Fun, vibrant & outgoing personality with great personal style Keen sense of fashion and a passion for the fashion industry Interested candidates are invited to submit a detailed resume, stating current / last drawn salary, expected salary, and availability together with a recent photograph and click apply now.  We thank you for your application and we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. All resumes will be kept strictly confidential. Thank you very much.

description: JOB DESCRIPTION: CRM & OPERATIONS INTERN  DT One is looking for a summer intern to assist in operational support with the internal CRM tool, ZOHO. In this role, you will focus on building data sets to make sales team more productive and marketing initiatives more effective. You will be responsible for data collection from various sources and entry of data in CRM tool.  DT One has an inclusive and global culture that will empower your development both personally and professionally. Out team has diverse talents, backgrounds, and experiences to drive creativity, productivity, and growth.  If you are a self-starter, energetic, responsible, and eager-to-learn student, join our team to step into professional life, cumulate experience and gain valuable insights that can further your interest in your chosen career field or industry.  Key Role Responsibilities Define the information gaps on our CRM database and with the other integrated tools and software. Source the missing information to fill in the gaps. Ensure our CRM database consolidates all our customer information and provides reliable insights for the team. Develop lists and segment customers in the CRM. Provide further operational support in other tasks as needed. Essential Qualifications Bachelor’s degree student in engineering, finance, business administration, or any related field. Basic understanding of data or coding. Very good Excel, PowerPoint and Google Doc skills. Very good English language skills. Strong communication and organizational skills. Strong self-discipline to work remotely and independently, also, an exemplary team member at the times of collaborative actions. Does this sound like you? Apply now!  About Us  DT One operates a leading global network for mobile top-up solutions, innovative mobile rewards and airtime credit services.  We’re able to provide greater access to digital communications for over five billion people across emerging economies, resulting in more active participation in the global economy. Our global network interconnects more than 550 mobile operators across 160 countries and delivers smarter data-driven mobile solutions to ensure that no one is left unconnected.  Founded in 2005, the DT One team is headquartered in Singapore with regional offices in Dubai, Miami, Nairobi and London.  For more information visit www.DTOne.com
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Musiio is looking for a driven, music-loving intern to join our dynamic team of developers and music enthusiasts. This role is based in Singapore.  This internship is an opportunity to work at Singapore’s first VC-funded music tech company. We are a diverse and dedicated team passionate about our technology and products. You will be working closely with Musiio’s Founders and Senior Management who strive to provide a positive, fun and hard-working culture.  As our Design Intern, you will be contributing creative works for the world’s most accurate music discovery product. You will be expected to use your full range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills. You will support the team with visual solutions through design thinking to ensure our products look consistent and at its best. range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills, and you will own the full experience. You will also be responsible for designing, researching, prototyping, and implementing features for incremental changes as well as future iterations.  Who You Are  Requirements Experienced with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Google Slides and Figma/Sketch Visual Design skills with proficiency in typography, desktop/mobile UI, colour, layout, iconography/illustration and aesthetic sense Receptive to feedback and open to collaborating with multiple stakeholders Strong visual sense and interest in trends in visual design and usability Strong communication skills, ability to articulate and defend design decisions Have a portfolio that showcases your best work Passionate about music Nice to have: Familiar with JIRA and Adobe After Effects  What You’ll Do Create and design print and digital materials Support Sales and Tech team with design tasks Maintain a cohesive style and aesthetic across all customer-facing and internal platforms Work closely with Senior Product Designer to define and document our extensive design system within Figma Gather design requirements and communicate design decisions to stakeholders across the company  Portfolio Required. Please be sure to provide any relevant passwords!  Benefits  Entry-level, Full-time Internship.  This is a paid internship. We offer you flexible working hours, high autonomy and participation in mission-critical projects in a casual working environment. We also have a very diverse team!  We are looking for interns who can work full time for a minimum of 3 months. Interested applicants, please email with a detailed resume, date of availability and contact number.  About Musiio  Musiio is Singapore’s first VC-funded music tech company. We use Machine Learning and AI to solve problems of the explosion of content in the music industry, allowing large catalogues of music to be searched, categorized and customized at scale.  Musiio offers B2B tagging, search and playlisting solutions for streaming services, record labels, sync companies and more. “If you want to tag 1 song, do it yourself, it will take 10 minutes. If you want to tag 10,000 songs in one day, get an AI to do it,” says Hazel Savage, our CEO and co-founder. This is where Musiio comes in, performing tedious work that a machine can perform much more effectively than humans, and on a much larger scale. Our AI technology can find tracks that fit a certain sonic profile within seconds through sonic similarity search.  Try our tagging demo here: https://musiio.com/  Read more about Musiio below: Musiio Secures Funding At $10m Valuation As It Signs Hipgnosis And Expands Product Portfolio Vans ‘musicians Wanted’ Competition Uses Musiio To Ensure No Track Goes Unheard Musiio Blog

description: About Sleek  Sleek is on a mission to revolutionize how entrepreneurs operate their business. We want to give small business owners peace of mind and the power of online solutions to allow them to focus on what they do best - growing their business. As we work for our thousands of customers, we gather millions of data points about their business, and in turn we transform those into useful, actionable insights and recommendations to accelerate their growth through smart algorithms.  At Sleek, we work in a fast-paced, start-up environment. We value ownership and accountability. We consider the company’s growth and success to be a result of individual efforts, and are looking to onboard talented and creative people, who want to make a difference and contribute to the growth of the company. We have a strong commitment to make Sleek a great place to work at and grow with. Currently operating in Singapore, Hong-Kong & Australia, we have global ambitions.  Position duties  We are looking for a motivated and detail oriented intern to support our Managed Services team.  Sleek’s Managed Services is a brand new product line launched in May 2020.  Managed Services is a white labeled version of our Sleek platform and services that is now offered to high volume referrals partners, called MS Partner. The value proposition for these partners is that instead of sending their clients directly to Sleek, they can now keep their direct client relationships, diversify and deliver incorporation, corporate secretary and accounting services in Singapore under their own brand and charge a premium on top of our fixed fees.  This role presents an exciting opportunity to gain first hand experience of how to build up a new product from scratch and grow it into a scalable and profitable business line.  The role will encompass a wide range of activities and no one day will be the same: Business Development > Engaging in prospecting activities and helping to build and manage an exciting pipeline of Managed Service candidates (Law Firms, Corporate Secretaries, Consultants, Auditors, etc).  > Attending sales meetings with Managed Services prospects to pitch and demo Managed Services.  > Supporting with negotiations and signing up new clients. Operations & Innovation > Helping to improve internal processes and procedures to ensure the successful delivery of the Managed Services offering. Examples may include finding ways to refine MS Partner & MS End Clients onboarding, automating repetitive manual processes; creating guides; updating process documents.  > Coordinating with the other departments and teams in Sleek to obtain support when required. Key teams include tech, compliance, data, finance, accounting, payroll, partnerships & corporate secretary.  The Ideal Candidate Is  What we are looking for - - - - Studying or graduate in Business Administration Great interpersonal and communication skills Able to interact with personnel at all levels Detailed orientated  Agility, ability to multitask in a start-up environment  Come and join our dynamic, friendly, and always supportive team, to learn, grow, and develop yourself and the company!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: The Company Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 45,000 employees in more than 140 territories. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas — the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Unlock your potential at Willis Towers Watson.  The Segment Human Capital and Benefits High-performing institutions cultivate and grow talent, carefully balancing costs and rewards. In diverse areas like talent management, total rewards, benefits etc., we take a rounded perspective, based on leading-edge thinking, data, analytics and software, unearthing new ways to motivate people, foster wellbeing and implement solutions that work.  The Business Talent Line of Business The Talent Consulting team empowers clients to solve their most complex challenges through a combination of advisory, data and technology. We provide bespoke consulting services in a wide range of areas such as HR strategy, organisation design, talent strategy, design of talent programmes and processes, employee engagement, culture transformation and change management. Our work is firmly grounded in years of research and experience, while maintaining a keen eye on the changes in the business operating environment.  The Role Overview of the role: As an Intern in the Talent Consulting team, you will work beside some of the industry’s top consultants while you develop cutting edge technical knowledge and skills. You will have immediate exposure to real client assignments which will draw on your imagination and creativity as well as your ability to analyse information, draw conclusions and present results. These experiences will help build your technical knowledge and overall industry expertise in the business area you join. Performance Objectives: Clients - Partner with consultants on client projects across multiple industries and HR functional areas - Assist the consultants in research and support the delivery of consulting services in areas of HR strategy, organization development, talent management, performance management, career architecture and competency modelling etc. - Gather and analyse information, formulate and test hypotheses, and develop recommendations - Increase efficiency within client teams by identifying ways to improve processes - Demonstrate natural ease and effectiveness when dealing with clients/colleagues at all levels Excellence - Develop technical knowledge and skills in HR and Talent Management - Deliver on assigned work to exceed expectations Financial - Meet assigned client work targets - Contribute to sales and marketing efforts by supporting in research and proposal development and business development activities. People - Build relationships internally and collaborate effectively on cross-functional teams You will be expected to display exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills during your day to day work

description: The Company  Goldlink Asia Distribution Pte Ltd specializes in luxury menswear and accessories. For the past 18 years, the company has carried accessories from the most luxurious menswear designer labels from Ermenegildo Zegna, Tateossian, Lanvin, Church's, TecknoMonster, to A.Azthom.  The company is currently the largest men’s accessories distributor in Singapore, with points-of-sales in leading department stores, including Takashimaya  We are seeking highly driven and entrepreneurial individuals to join our team for expanding ventures.  To learn more about the Company, visit: http://goldlinkasia.com  The Opportunity  As a Fashion Retail Management Trainee (RMT), you will be embarking on a journey to hone your management and leadership skills in the world of luxury menswear accessories.  Selected candidates will undergo intensive on-the-job training on product knowledge, customer relations, management, and store operations.  There will be 3-month probation during which you will be assessed based on key performance indicators (KPI). After probation, you will be streamed to the department that you are best suited for - including merchandising, logistics, marketing, human resources, and store management.  The Expectations Handle store operations Provide fashion and styling advice suited to customer needs Provide excellent customer service (e.g. inquiries, sales purchase and after-sales activities, exchange & refund, etc.) Maintain and manage merchandise displays and inventory Lead the sales team to meet sales targets Undertake leadership roles in selected departments Handle ad hoc projects and administrative duties related to the store and office operations The Requirements Possess a minimum of diploma/ degree in local polytechnics/ universities, preferably in Retail/ Fashion Management, Business or relevant disciplines Good leadership skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Independent, confident and self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit Well-groomed and neat looking Able to multitask and adapt to a fast-paced environment Able to work retail hours, on weekends and public holidays Experience in HR and administration preferred Immediate availability and relevant work experience will be an advantage Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you.

Look no further, as we have the job for you!  We are looking for individuals who can adapt to the environment around them and work out solutions for more effective communication. Learn from our mentors on how to engage our clients and work on industry standard practices and formalities.  Responsibilities Responsible for the end-to-end recruitment process for insurance agents, intern and expansion of the sales team (placement of career advertisements to conducting interviews, selections, inductions, training etc.) Assisting in administrative matters Maintains the work structure by updating job requirements and job descriptions for all positions Maintain & update personnel file Support to design and deliver best practice models to develop capability and provide assurance that candidates have obtained the skills needed for the job Any other duties assigned by superior Requirements Unopposed to communicating with clients Proficient in Microsoft Office/Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, etc.) Independent and self-driven with high level of initiative to deliver KPIs Meticulous and organize to handle multiple tasks Minimum 1 month commitment (3 months preferred) Singaporean or PR Diploma awarded by a local Polytechnic, or GCE A levels or equivalent 21 years old and above No experience is required as training is provided Full-Time and Temporary position(s) available Able to start work immediately Salary: From $1,500 per month under Career Trial Scheme

description: Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative?  At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. We provide energy and automation digital solutions for efficiency and sustainability.  We are looking for a 6 months intern to join us for the period of January to June 2022.  You will join the regional Talent and Learning Team to facilitate the deployment of Sales and Business Growth-related development interventions to the East Asia and Japan Zone. You will experience the end-to-end learning process from needs analysis to facilitation to learning evaluation. You will also undertake special projects related to driving a learning culture and branding of learning activities.  What will you do? Conduct Learning Needs Assessment to work out the Zone Development Plan Support the Development of Learning Interventions to meet the Needs of the Zone Work with Different Stakeholders to Deploy the Learning Interventions into the Region Monitor the Progress of the Learning Interventions Creatively Propose New Way of Measuring Learning Progress and Effectiveness Provide reporting on learning progress Engage with different parties to inject new ways of Learnings Undertaken special Learning projects related to building a learning culture and branding  What qualifications will make you successful? Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Business / Human Resources / Psychology / Engineering / IT Must have: Excel; PowerPoints Good to have: Tableau, Klaxoon  What's in it for me? Competitive internship allowance Fliexible work arrangement - flexi-hours, office hoteling Medical coverage Blue Sky Friday Onsite gym and more!  Let us learn about you! Apply today.  Why us?  Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.  €25.7bn global revenue  137 000+ employees in 100+ countries  45% of revenue from IoT  5% of revenue devoted for R&D  You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled  It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: The Economist Group is the leading source of analysis on international business and world affairs. We deliver our information through a range of formats, from newspapers and magazines to conferences and electronic services. What ties us together is the objectivity of our opinion, the originality of our insight and our advocacy of economic and political freedom around the world.  We are recruiting an Intern to work in our Economist Impact division. The successful candidate will be based in Singapore and manage multiple work streams to support both the CS and Events business across a range of initiatives.   How you would contribute:  Coordinate outreach among our sales teams and senior executives to prospective clients for both Contents Solutions and our key global event franchises  KEY TASK:-  1) Content Solutions: Research and gather accurate data for sales prospects in (in priority order) Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and Thailand. This includes internet based research, calling clients to get accurate data. Success KPIs being placed on the swiftness, accuracy and volume of data collected.  2) Events: Research global organizations to identify a list of companies that would be likely candidates to sponsor various Economist Events   3) Draft emails and other communications to senior executives at prospective client organizations.   4) Coordinate outreach communications and follow up between Economist senior executives to senior clients.   5) Provide day-to-day support for SEA CS Assist with sales prospecting Assist with powerpoint presentations for proposals Assist with coordination of external vendors  The ideal skills for the role are:    Excellent verbal and written communications skills Strong organizational and project management skills, including strong attention to detail and ability to manage tight deadlines Proactive thinking and planning; ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks Creative problem solving, innate curiosity and tenacity to follow through Desire to learn about marketing services
jobFunction: Business Development, Sales, and General Business
industries: Publishing

jobTitle: 2022 Analytics & Sales Internship for 2023 Analytics & Sales Graduate Programme
description: Bloomberg is the market leader in providing high-quality data, news and analytics to professionals in business, finance and government. With over 19,000 employees in 176 locations around the world we are a truly global organization entering new markets, launching ventures and pushing boundaries. The transparency Bloomberg brings to the financial markets is integral to our culture, our offices and our interactions with one another. We're measured by the quality of our contributions, not by a title. We don't need an open-door policy- we sit in open work spaces, shoulder-to-shoulder.  Who We Look For  You have an understanding of the drivers behind market moving stories and events. You're a solution-finder, with a real passion for providing exceptional customer service in a fast-paced environment. With a desire to build a career in a client-facing role, you understand the importance of credibility and building relationships. Join our comprehensive Analytics & Sales summer internship program, where you will rotate between both departments over the course of ten weeks, gaining an insight into what our graduate role has to offer!  What is the role?  It's rare to find a role that gives you such early exposure to global financial market participants. Our Analytics and Sales program offers you the unrivalled opportunity to join our team, where you are depended upon to provide fast and accurate solutions to incoming client queries. The support we give to clients is a key aspect of Bloomberg's value proposition and you will play a critical role here. Partake in our comprehensive training program, covering all aspects of the financial markets: economic principles, market players and asset classes - while teaching you all there is to know about the functionality and analytical tools Bloomberg has to offer. Upon a successful period in Analytics, you'll have the platform to further your career across the company. The majority of Analytics members take up opportunities within our Enterprise Sales team. In this role you will be working with existing and new clients to increase Bloomberg's engagement and presence through offering market leading solutions. You'll play an important part in maintaining Bloomberg's position as a market leader and driving business growth. You will support the top decision makers in the world of finance, government and business across APAC.  Analytics  We provide 24/7 support for Bloomberg Professional Service users all over the world and across multiple industries. Reaching us via our 'Instant Bloomberg' chat system, clients access unparalleled customer service where we answer their questions and help them maximize the value of Bloomberg. We're a calm voice in a busy, volatile market. Our clients rely on us to support them in making better, faster decisions using the power of Bloomberg Professional Services. On any given day we respond to over 12,000 queries in more than 15 languages. From educating a portfolio manager on Bloomberg's risk management solutions to helping a trader discover new sources of market liquidity - the variety of problems we solve is immense. Bloomberg plays a critical role in the workflow of our clients therefore when we're asked a question we strive to exceed their expectations by providing a timely, accurate and quality service. Analytics works in conjunction with Enterprise Sales to deliver on strategic initiatives, supporting product roll-out and on-boarding clients. We want to ensure our clients are making the most of our service and using tools and features that allow them to work smarter. Bloomberg is constantly innovating and Analytics plays a key role in ensuring clients are educated on new products and enhancements by proactively reaching out to up-skill clients through technology, on-site training and seminars.  Sales  In Sales, we're the face of Bloomberg for our clients. Consultative and entrepreneurial, we're responsible for managing client relationships, whilst striving to continually grow our revenue by identifying new business opportunities. We work collaboratively across departments to ensure the company continues to innovate and develop our product as well as ensuring we're delivering the best customer service. We spend our time with our clients, understanding their business goals and outpacing their expectations. Guided by curiosity and purpose, we work to understand their workflows and advise on the most appropriate Bloomberg solutions for them from across our range of enterprise offerings. We work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing market and to be successful, it's crucial we stay one step ahead, knowing our customers, pre-empting their needs and presenting them with ground breaking solutions, before they even know they need them. We're discovering new business leads by making prospecting calls and networking. The Enterprise sales team is relied upon to defend our position as a market leader in their respective regions and contribute to year-on-year growth. Colleagues from across the company depend on us to communicate new solutions and Bloomberg offerings to the market. We demonstrate how Bloomberg will help our clients make the best investment/trading/business decisions, making their day to day business smoother and more profitable.  Internship Program  Completing our 2022 Summer Internship program (10 weeks between May to July 2022) is an integral and important part of assessment process for 2023 Graduate Program.  The Summer Internship Program Consists Of  a week of classroom based financial product and functionality training, to broaden your knowledge of the global financial markets and our market leading Bloomberg solutions. After your training, you'll join a team where you'll immediately begin collaborating with interns on Analytics and Sales projects.  You'll have the opportunity to interact with clients, making valuable contributions by taking part in sales campaigns, promoting product features and prospecting for new business. Hands-on individual and group projects will allow you to experience how your full-time career could evolve.  To round out your experience, you'll attend lunch and learn sessions, designed to teach you about our diversified group, and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet Bloomberg leaders at a variety of networking events. Of course, we also want to give you the chance to get to know your peers, so you'll also take part in volunteering activities and social events with interns from other departments.  This Is An Entry Level Role Where You'll Need To be a current penultimate year tertiary student who will be available for a 10 weeks summer internship from May to July 2022, and will be available to start their full-time employment with us in 2023. A demonstrable interest in financial markets and the aspiration to work in the financial/fintech services industry(example: academic course or work/internship experience or extracurricular activities) Real ambition to pursue a client-facing career, with a strong interest in sales Stakeholder management exposure through school or work/internship Strong critical-thinking and problem-solving skills The resilience to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic fast-paced environment Business proficiency and fluency in English We'd Love To See Work experience in a client facing role Interest in technology and/or programming This is a future opportunity for our 2023 graduate hiring program with a 2022 summer internship opportunity.  Does this sound like you?  Apply if you think we're a good match.  Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate and are inclusive of age, disability, colour, gender, gender identity, marital status, national origin, race, religion and belief, parental or caring status, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, sexual orientation, veteran status.  As Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer, please let us know if you require any adjustments to be made for the recruitment process by emailing access2@bloomberg.net.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: In the role of Assistant Restaurant Manager / Management Trainee, you will lead the outlet under your charge to deliver excellent customer service and dining experience.  Job Scope Maintain outlet service quality and display good customer relation skills Ensure food quality and presentation are up to standard and manage service recovery Manage peak periods effectively with good hosting and queue management skills Display good supervisory skills with ability to assign and delegate duties among staffs Plan outlet schedule and deployment Manage staff discipline and performance issues Execute outlet administrative duties and management reporting Maintain restaurant hygiene and upkeep Achieve sales target and manage maintenance, labour and food costs Job Information Working Hours: 5 days/week (2 off days per week, no split shift) At least 2 years experience in F&B, preferably with managerial experience Possess high standard of customer service and willingness to learn Salary will commensurate with experience Staff meal provided Company is expanding with good growth opportunities Welfare & Benefits Monthly Sales Incentive Performance Bonus Annual Salary Increment Annual Leave Medical Leave Medical Benefits Staff Dining Privilege Career Advancement Opportunities Outlet Teambuilding Activities Work Locations (All locations near MRT) Heartland Mall (Kovan MRT) Waterway Point (Punggol MRT) Djitsun Mall (Ang Mo Kio MRT) Eastpoint Mall (Simei MRT) Heartbeat Bedok (Bedok MRT) Bukit Timah Shopping Centre (Beauty World MRT)
industries: Restaurants, Retail, and Hospitality

You will support the top decision makers in the world of finance, government and business across APAC.  Analytics  We provide 24/7 support for Bloomberg Professional Service users all over the world and across multiple industries. Reaching us via our 'Instant Bloomberg' chat system, clients access unparalleled customer service where we answer their questions and help them maximize the value of Bloomberg. We're a calm voice in a busy, volatile market. Our clients rely on us to support them in making better, faster decisions using the power of Bloomberg Professional Services. On any given day we respond to over 12,000 queries in more than 15 languages. From educating a portfolio manager on Bloomberg's risk management solutions to helping a trader discover new sources of market liquidity - the variety of problems we solve is immense. Bloomberg plays a critical role in the workflow of our clients therefore when we're asked a question we strive to exceed their expectations by providing a timely, accurate and quality service. Analytics works in conjunction with Enterprise Sales to deliver on strategic initiatives, supporting product roll-out and on-boarding clients. We want to ensure our clients are making the most of our service and using tools and features that allow them to work smarter. Bloomberg is constantly innovating and Analytics plays a key role in ensuring clients are educated on new products and enhancements by proactively reaching out to up-skill clients through technology, on-site training and seminars.  Sales  In Sales, we're the face of Bloomberg for our clients. Consultative and entrepreneurial, we're responsible for managing client relationships, whilst striving to continually grow our revenue by identifying new business opportunities. We work collaboratively across departments to ensure the company continues to innovate and develop our product as well as ensuring we're delivering the best customer service. We spend our time with our clients, understanding their business goals and outpacing their expectations. Guided by curiosity and purpose, we work to understand their workflows and advise on the most appropriate Bloomberg solutions for them from across our range of enterprise offerings. We work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing market and to be successful, it's crucial we stay one step ahead, knowing our customers, pre-empting their needs and presenting them with ground breaking solutions, before they even know they need them. We're discovering new business leads by making prospecting calls and networking. The Enterprise sales team is relied upon to defend our position as a market leader in their respective regions and contribute to year-on-year growth. Colleagues from across the company depend on us to communicate new solutions and Bloomberg offerings to the market. We demonstrate how Bloomberg will help our clients make the best investment/trading/business decisions, making their day to day business smoother and more profitable.  Internship Program  Completing our 2022 Summer Internship program (10 weeks between May to July 2022) is an integral and important part of assessment process for 2023 Graduate Program.  The Summer Internship Program Consists Of  a week of classroom based financial product and functionality training, to broaden your knowledge of the global financial markets and our market leading Bloomberg solutions. After your training, you'll join a team where you'll immediately begin collaborating with interns on Analytics and Sales projects.  You'll have the opportunity to interact with clients, making valuable contributions by taking part in sales campaigns, promoting product features and prospecting for new business. Hands-on individual and group projects will allow you to experience how your full-time career could evolve.  To round out your experience, you'll attend lunch and learn sessions, designed to teach you about our diversified group, and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet Bloomberg leaders at a variety of networking events. Of course, we also want to give you the chance to get to know your peers, so you'll also take part in volunteering activities and social events with interns from other departments.  This Is An Entry Level Role Where You'll Need To be a current penultimate year tertiary student who will be available for a 10 weeks summer internship from May to July 2022, and will be available to start their full-time employment with us in 2023. A demonstrable interest in financial markets and the aspiration to work in the financial/fintech services industry(example: academic course or work/internship experience or extracurricular activities) Real ambition to pursue a client-facing career, with a strong interest in sales Stakeholder management exposure through school or work/internship Strong critical-thinking and problem-solving skills The resilience to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic fast-paced environment Business proficiency and fluency in English Business proficiency and fluency in Thai to manage the respective clients. We'd Love To See Work experience in a client facing role Interest in technology and/or programming This is a future opportunity for our 2023 graduate hiring program with a 2022 summer internship opportunity.  Does this sound like you?  Apply if you think we're a good match.  Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate and are inclusive of age, disability, colour, gender, gender identity, marital status, national origin, race, religion and belief, parental or caring status, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, sexual orientation, veteran status.  As Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer, please let us know if you require any adjustments to be made for the recruitment process by emailing access2@bloomberg.net.
