description: Whether you're an investment professional, an expert in sales or a technology specialist, you'll find a culture at MFS that supports you in doing what you do best. Our employees work together to reach better outcomes, always favoring the strongest idea over the strongest individual. We put people first and show care and compassion for our community and each other. Because what we do matters – to us as valued professionals and to the millions of people and institutions who rely on us to help them build more secure and prosperous futures.  Job DescriptionAbout MFS  In 1924 MFS Investment Management established the first mutual fund in the United States. Today, MFS offers a wide range of products and services to investors, including more than 70 mutual funds, fixed and variable annuities, separately managed accounts, and retirement plans to retail customers, institutional investors, and insurance offerings. At MFS we hire talented individuals and allow them to work in an environment that fosters teamwork. We strive to make MFS a company where our employees can grow and succeed. While MFS provides a supportive work environment, we maintain high standards of accountability to ensure that employees meet our standards of excellence. We value intelligence and hard work. We value the perspective you bring. We will reward you for your good ideas, your work ethic, and your experience. We believe that our unique culture directly benefits our business.  International Equity Research Analyst Summer Intern  As a member of our 80 person equity research department, you will be solely responsible for fundamental research on one particular global industry with the objective of developing specific company and stock recommendations for the portfolios managed by MFS. A summer analyst is expected to work independently in the structuring, development and communications of investment recommendations. Our analysts draw upon a wide variety of information sources such as company literature, business publications and Wall Street research. The emphasis; however, is on original industry and company research including attendance at conferences and field trips to company facilities and interviews with corporate management at all levels. Analysts are expected to perform as the “in-house” expert on their particular area(s) of concentration.  A summer analyst is given responsibility for one global industry in Asia (usually 4 -5 companies). Industry assignments are based on the needs of the firm. There is a short, 3 day, training program at the start of the internship to reinforce some of the basic skills necessary to do the job. Following that you will work with a senior analyst who provides guidance and assistance in the development of analytical and valuation techniques. The goal of this relationship is to enable the investment intern to effectively generate and communicate investment recommendations. The internship is generally 10 weeks in duration (June – August). This position will be located in Singapore.  Analysts With a Good Track Record And Solid Performance Have Three Career Options Available  In the long-term, the MFS analyst path has a great deal of flexibility in career options. a long-term analyst that moves across various sectors a dedicated sector analyst, managing a sector and sector money become a diversified fund manager Qualifications Singapore internship is based in Singapore, local work authorization preferred If any applicant is unable to complete an application or respond to a job opening because of a disability, please contact MFS at 617-954-5000 or email talent_acquisition@mfs.com for assistance.  MFS is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and it is our policy to not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state or local laws. Employees and applicants of MFS will not be subject to harassment on the basis of their status. Additionally, retaliation, including intimidation, threats, or coercion, because an employee or applicant has objected to discrimination, engaged or may engage in filing a complaint, assisted in a review, investigation, or hearing or have otherwise sought to obtain their legal rights under any Federal, State, or local EEO law is prohibited. " Click here to view the 'EEO is the Law' poster and supplement ."

jobTitle: Data Operations Intern - Data Analyst (6 months Internship)
description: Who are we?  Here at ADDX, we believe in a future where everybody can access financial ecosystems easily, fairly, and safely. That is why we’ve built the world’s first fully regulated platform for digital securities, licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.  In 2021, we raised USD 50 million in Series A funding led by Japan Investment Corporation and Development Bank of Japan. Among other esteemed investors, we are backed by Singapore Exchange and Heliconia, a subsidiary of Temasek.  We have gone through a total re-brand and promise this to be an exciting time. An integral part of a fast-growing team enabling investments in unicorns, pre-IPO companies, and hedge funds, your role is to innovate and discover new solutions.  If you believe in a future of fair financial markets, just like we do, we’ve been waiting for you at ADDX.  Who are we looking for?  Named the Most Innovative Fintech by Global Brands, we are redefining private market investing and are looking for a Data Operations Intern (Data Analyst) to join our Technology team.  Responsibilities Provide day-to-day support, including administration and analytical tasks Act as an analyst for system enhancements and/or projects Perform data validation to assure integrity, accuracy and consistency, identify the root cause of data inconsistencies and process defects, and implement timely corrective actions Conduct data collection and analysis using SQL, Snowflake, PowerBI and Python Automate data collection and aggregation processes to build reporting dashboards Collaborate with data engineers, product managers, and operation teams to provide statistics or business data that can help to drive business insights Work with subject matter experts and Data/ Business Analysts to understand business questions, processes, and related data Integrate data from a variety of business subject areas: finance, sales, product, marketing and publicly available data Analyse data to develop predictive models and identify data patterns and trends Develop appropriate visualization which addresses business questions Document processes and research, standards, guidelines, and best practices for teams utilizing the solution Requirements First year graduate or 3rd year undergraduate in Software/Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related fields. Understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and IT High resilience and strong communication skills Self-motivated, willing to learn and adapt quickly to deliver the end results Preferably someone who can commit full-time for min 6 months or more starting from Jan 2022 Due to our limited capacity, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Financial Services

jobTitle: 2022 Analytics & Sales Internship for 2023 Analytics & Sales Graduate Programme (Bahasa Indonesia Speaker)
description: Bloomberg is the market leader in providing high-quality data, news and analytics to professionals in business, finance and government. With over 19,000 employees in 176 locations around the world we are a truly global organization entering new markets, launching ventures and pushing boundaries. The transparency Bloomberg brings to the financial markets is integral to our culture, our offices and our interactions with one another. We're measured by the quality of our contributions, not by a title. We don't need an open-door policy- we sit in open work spaces, shoulder-to-shoulder.  Who We Look For  You have an understanding of the drivers behind market moving stories and events. You're a solution-finder, with a real passion for providing exceptional customer service in a fast-paced environment. With a desire to build a career in a client-facing role, you understand the importance of credibility and building relationships. Join our comprehensive Analytics & Sales summer internship program, where you will rotate between both departments over the course of ten weeks, gaining an insight into what our graduate role has to offer!  What is the role?  It's rare to find a role that gives you such early exposure to global financial market participants. Our Analytics and Sales program offers you the unrivalled opportunity to join our team, where you are depended upon to provide fast and accurate solutions to incoming client queries. The support we give to clients is a key aspect of Bloomberg's value proposition and you will play a critical role here. Partake in our comprehensive training program, covering all aspects of the financial markets: economic principles, market players and asset classes - while teaching you all there is to know about the functionality and analytical tools Bloomberg has to offer. Upon a successful period in Analytics, you'll have the platform to further your career across the company. The majority of Analytics members take up opportunities within our Enterprise Sales team. In this role you will be working with existing and new clients to increase Bloomberg's engagement and presence through offering market leading solutions. You'll play an important part in maintaining Bloomberg's position as a market leader and driving business growth. You will support the top decision makers in the world of finance, government and business across APAC.  Analytics  We provide 24/7 support for Bloomberg Professional Service users all over the world and across multiple industries. Reaching us via our 'Instant Bloomberg' chat system, clients access unparalleled customer service where we answer their questions and help them maximize the value of Bloomberg. We're a calm voice in a busy, volatile market. Our clients rely on us to support them in making better, faster decisions using the power of Bloomberg Professional Services. On any given day we respond to over 12,000 queries in more than 15 languages. From educating a portfolio manager on Bloomberg's risk management solutions to helping a trader discover new sources of market liquidity - the variety of problems we solve is immense. Bloomberg plays a critical role in the workflow of our clients therefore when we're asked a question we strive to exceed their expectations by providing a timely, accurate and quality service. Analytics works in conjunction with Enterprise Sales to deliver on strategic initiatives, supporting product roll-out and on-boarding clients. We want to ensure our clients are making the most of our service and using tools and features that allow them to work smarter. Bloomberg is constantly innovating and Analytics plays a key role in ensuring clients are educated on new products and enhancements by proactively reaching out to up-skill clients through technology, on-site training and seminars.  Sales  In Sales, we're the face of Bloomberg for our clients. Consultative and entrepreneurial, we're responsible for managing client relationships, whilst striving to continually grow our revenue by identifying new business opportunities. We work collaboratively across departments to ensure the company continues to innovate and develop our product as well as ensuring we're delivering the best customer service. We spend our time with our clients, understanding their business goals and outpacing their expectations. Guided by curiosity and purpose, we work to understand their workflows and advise on the most appropriate Bloomberg solutions for them from across our range of enterprise offerings. We work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing market and to be successful, it's crucial we stay one step ahead, knowing our customers, pre-empting their needs and presenting them with ground breaking solutions, before they even know they need them. We're discovering new business leads by making prospecting calls and networking. The Enterprise sales team is relied upon to defend our position as a market leader in their respective regions and contribute to year-on-year growth. Colleagues from across the company depend on us to communicate new solutions and Bloomberg offerings to the market. We demonstrate how Bloomberg will help our clients make the best investment/trading/business decisions, making their day to day business smoother and more profitable.  Internship Program  Completing our 2022 Summer Internship program (10 weeks between May to July 2022) is an integral and important part of assessment process for 2023 Graduate Program.  The Summer Internship Program Consists Of  a week of classroom based financial product and functionality training, to broaden your knowledge of the global financial markets and our market leading Bloomberg solutions. After your training, you'll join a team where you'll immediately begin collaborating with interns on Analytics and Sales projects.  You'll have the opportunity to interact with clients, making valuable contributions by taking part in sales campaigns, promoting product features and prospecting for new business. Hands-on individual and group projects will allow you to experience how your full-time career could evolve.  To round out your experience, you'll attend lunch and learn sessions, designed to teach you about our diversified group, and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet Bloomberg leaders at a variety of networking events. Of course, we also want to give you the chance to get to know your peers, so you'll also take part in volunteering activities and social events with interns from other departments.  This Is An Entry Level Role Where You'll Need To be a current penultimate year tertiary student who will be available for a 10 weeks summer internship from May to July 2022, and will be available to start their full-time employment with us in 2023. A demonstrable interest in financial markets and the aspiration to work in the financial/fintech services industry(example: academic course or work/internship experience or extracurricular activities) Real ambition to pursue a client-facing career, with a strong interest in sales Stakeholder management exposure through school or work/internship Strong critical-thinking and problem-solving skills The resilience to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic fast-paced environment Business proficiency and fluency in English Business proficiency and fluency in Bahasa Indonesia to manage the respective clients. We'd Love To See Work experience in a client facing role Interest in technology and/or programming This is a future opportunity for our 2023 graduate hiring program with a 2022 summer internship opportunity. description: Description  Working at West means having an opportunity to work by the side of our patients and customers, our global team members and the communities in which we operate – which all help contribute to a Healthier World.  At West, we are by the side of patients. The work we do impacts patients’ lives each and every day – our products are a critical part of healthcare delivery and we are proud of the role we play to improve patient health. We work by the side of our team members. We come together as one global team to deliver for our customers and help them address their challenges. We are a diverse, close-knit community of professionals, where everyone has a voice and opportunity to learn and grow through mutual trust and respect. With a 95 year plus history, we have a track record for success, which includes reported sales of $2.14B in 2020. We serve by the side of our community. Giving back is in our DNA—our team members across more than 50 sites globally are involved with hundreds of charities that have special meaning to them through our West Without Borders team member-led giving program.  Job Summary  In this role, you will be responsible to support Director, Engineering for Singapore site. Support in technology transformation and automation master plan for Singapore site. Investigate and explore technology implementation, establish budget and timeline. Prepare necessary project documents for execution and implementation of master plan. Coordinate cross functional teams to obtain requirements and good understanding of process flow to support the master plan. Communication and interact with local site and vendors on all necessary activities to support project. Collaborate with cross functional team on project management and necessary activities for successful investigative study  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Work with internal and external team resources to: Identify project requirements in engineering and technology transformation Develop detailed master plan with budget, timeline, project scope and identified technology Ensure technical requirements for assigned projects are achieved Ensure that all required documentation deliverables are satisfied and delivered Collaborate with cross functional stakeholders (Process Engineering, Engineering, Production, Tooling) to establish project requirement and establish implementation plan Interface with cross functional team to establish and communicate program priorities, status and needs of assigned projects towards committed scope, time resource and budget Follow applicable West project management process & methods to manage scope, time, and budget using the agreed documentation and protocols. Maintain clear communication paths with all stakeholders Develop and maintain required project management documents associated with assigned projects Exhibits regular, reliable, punctual and predictable attendance Other duties as assigned Basic Qualifications BS in Engineering, Electrical, Mechanical, Chemical, or equivalent technical degree Project Management skills Demonstrated experience in preparing business case with financial justification Must speak English. Any other Asian language will be added advantage West is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you have a special need that requires accommodation in order to apply to West, please send an email to Apply.Accommodation@westpharma.com . Where permitted by law, an offer of employment with West Pharmaceutical Services, or any of its subsidiary or affiliate companies, is contingent upon the satisfactory completion of background screening and/or a pre-employment drug screening.

description: Position Purpose  This person is tasked with the full duties of managing a restaurant – which includes customer service, inventory management, managing a team, recruitment and retention.  Principal Accountabilities  In addition to following company policies and procedures, principal accountabilities include, but not limited to:  ▪ Exposure to the fundamentals of running a business  ▪ Opportunity to take on a management role with a market leader in the delivery business  ▪ Authority to make decisions to improve guest experience & drive topline sales.  ▪ Get a hang of the basics of running a restaurant; Demonstrate ability to perform duties at every station in the restaurant.  ▪ Confidently resolve guests’ disputes and restaurant issues, as well as running the shift single-handedly without the help of a restaurant manager.  ▪ Be very familiar with the business operations and would be able to provide training to new staff.  Responsibilities Handle full operations of the restaurant outlet Responsible for the hiring & retention of full-time and part-time crew members Plan staff strength and roster Lead a team of dedicated service providers Manage inventory control and usage ▪ Adherence to all personnel policies, Equal Employment Opportunity, security and safety procedures by all.  ▪ Administer the performance review process for all employees.  ▪ Leads the development and training of all outlet employees.  Workplace Safety/Security  ▪ Enforces all workplace safety policies including contractor management at all times.  ▪ Through consultation, ensures that all workplace safety policies and procedures are maintained and adhered to.  ▪ Ensures only approved equipment and substances are purchased. Where this is not possible, conduct risk assessments on non-approved items.  ▪ Undertake risk assessments on all restaurant specific issues, where the absence of such could put employees and customers at risk.  ▪ Have emergency procedures in place and undertake regular practices of those procedures.  ▪ Ensures all security procedures are executed.  ▪ Maintains all physical plant aspects of the restaurant following documented inspection and testing. This is to include landscaping, building, equipment, etc.  ▪ Ensures continuous improvement in Workplace Safety.  ▪ Ensures any workplace safety and security concerns and issues are being addressed in a timely manner.  Administration  ▪ Administers and verifies all deposits.  ▪ Administers in-outlet payroll procedures.  ▪ Accuracy of monthly reports.  ▪ Enforces people policies and procedures.  ▪ Ensures that all daily paperwork, weekly inventories and statistical reports are completed accurately and on a timely basis.

jobTitle: Director, IoT & Digital Solutions Hub (Asia Pacific)
description: Date Posted  2021-01-07-08:00  Country  Singapore  Location:  8 Kallang Avenue #07-01/09 Aperia Tower 1, Singapore  In this new & strategic position, the Digital Hub Leader will be responsible for driving the development & deployment of digital solutions and services for Otis in the APAC region in order to create a competitive edge with our customers. Reporting to the Executive Director, Marketing & Corporate development for Asia Pacific, you will be part of a global organization working in very close collaboration with our global product marketing, engineering, digital technology teams & other similar hubs in integrating global digitalization strategy, tools, capabilities and best practices to deliver value to our customers and field teams.  You will be also be responsible for set up and expansion of the Asia pacific digital solutions hub & lead a development and deployment team that works collaboratively across our countries in understanding customer requirements and develop, localize & commercialize solutions utilizing global product platforms.  Key Accountabilities Lead the development of IoT offerings and other related digital solutions with the overall implementation, management and monitoring of these solutions and their financial implications. Build and manage a team of focused on development (UI/UX innovation, API integration, IoT end-to-end architecture, data analytics and machine learning) & a deployment team (program managers, field service experts, & marketing). Work with the APAC Product Management and Services team to capture local market needs and transform them into technical and product development requirements and programs. Provide technical leadership to solution architecture (hardware, software, and communications), sensor strategy, device selection, rules-based diagnostics, user interface technologies, data architecture, and interface to the cloud. Partner with Otis WHQ Digital, engineering and Regional Sales and Marketing to define and deliver compelling content to Otis customers in the region. Collaborate with APAC engineering centers to integrate components into elevator and escalator systems in the region. Partner with the Otis Chief Engineer IoT to deliver cloud-enabled app and desktop applications Develop and refine alternative type of UI/UX solutions based on the OTIS digital infrastructure. Support further innovative passenger experience developments Maintain knowledge of all related technology in external companies, technology developers and 3rd parties to assure that best practices in the IoT space are integrated into Otis. To Success In This Role, You Should Ideally Possess At least 10 years experience within the information technology and systems space. A degree in an applicable engineering discipline (system engineering, electronic, software engineering, IT). An advanced degree in Engineering would be a plus. Strong experience in developing and managing techno commercial projects and provide technical expertise in the following areas: IoT Based predictive maintenance systems, analytics and database software, IT infrastructure (network, hosting, cloud etc) Experience in setting up similar digital hubs. Excellent command of the following software technologies: OS/Middleware: Embedded Linux, etc… Languages: C, C++, Java Protocols low energy-mesh RF and wired (ex BLE, Zigbee, LoRa, CanBus…), IoT integration (REST APIs, MQTT, HTTPs,…) Database like MS SQL, Cassandra, etc Model based software architecture (DOORS , UML, Rhapsody, GitHub, Jenkins…). Machine learning frameworks: TensorFlow / Python / Matlab. General knowledge on standard Cybersecurity would also be appreciated. Experimented in agile/scrum development at scale. Collaborative leader and effective people manager. Proven ability to manage and lead teams, either directly or through influence, particularly within the areas of executive communications, change management communications. Otis is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.  Privacy Policy And Terms  Click on this link to read the Policy and Terms

description: About NCS  NCS is a leading technology services firm with presence in Asia Pacific and partners with governments and enterprises to advance communities through technology. Combining the experience and expertise of its 10,000-strong team across 49 specialisations, NCS provides differentiated and end-to-end technology services to clients with its NEXT capabilities of digital, cloud, platforms as well as core offerings in application, infrastructure, engineering and cyber security. NCS also believes in building a strong partner eco-system with leading technology players, research institutions and start-ups to support open innovation and co-creation. For more information, visit ncs.co.  Track Introduction  In NCS CorpLabs, we are driven by curiosity to understand real-world problems, innovative spirit to solve them using deep technology and to create impact by deploying them at scale. We leverage the latest technologies to create ground-breaking products that help accelerate our clients’ Digital transformation agenda. We have deep expertise in: robotics, IoT, computer vision, audio intelligence, speech analytics and much more.  If you love developing Machine Learning algorithms, rapid prototyping, collaborating with researchers and technology experts and create new product ideas, join us as an intern!  Do visit our website to know more about the awesome stuff we are building.  Cognitive Technologies: https://www.ncs.co/en-sg/services/intelligent-platforms/cognitive-technologies  Extraordinary starts here. Powering innovations that transform industries and advance communities: https://youtu.be/Uz5Uk8RANNs  We value Curiosity Can-do attitude Openness and collaboration Honesty and ownership Scientific rigor - Data driven approach Nimbleness - Rapid exploration and validation of ideas  You will have the opportunity to learn About the latest state-of-the-art ML methods applied to computer vision and predictive analytics for IoT. How to apply such techniques to different use cases in a real-time manner. AI product development from ideation to prototyping. From subject matter experts, product management, users, sales team, etc. to solve real business problems.  Ideal Candidate Pursuing a Diploma/Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Information Technology/Engineering related field. Proficiency in Python programming and familiar with Linux OS. Experience in developing algorithms using ML libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow.
industries: Information Technology and Services

jobTitle: 2022 Credit Management Long Internship (Jan - June), Vietnamese Speaker
description: In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 18,000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets, BNP Paribas provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.  Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 68 markets with more than 193,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region. excluding partnerships BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced, diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits, as well as a working environment where you’re valued as part of the team.  https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/  Coverage & Territories Credit Management is a team of credit analysts supporting Relationship Managers to analyse and monitor the credit risk of corporate clients, and write proposals to recommend approval of credit facilities for these clients.  The position of the intern is to assist credit analysts in fulfilling in their responsibilities elaborated below.  Responsibilities  Collaborate with Relationship Managers and Product Partners to: Gather appropriate client information to be able to present and mitigate risks. Spread financial statements, propose an appropriate counterparty rating and recovery rate on facility using the Bank’s internal systems Deliver a complete, synthetic and coherent up-to-date counterparty and credit risk analysis, based on facts and compliant with the Bank’s guidelines. Complete Credit Proposals enabling the Credit Committee to make an informed decision. Support the Relationship Manager / Front Officer in credit process-related matters Portfolio monitoring : follow-up of financial covenants, risks alert, core data checks. Keep updated with credit methodologies and policies. Share information and develop industry intelligence. Presentation of credit proposals to credit committees. Meet clients jointly with Relationship Managers, when and where possible, to deepen the understanding of a credit. Participation in discussions on potential deals. Participation in projects linked to improving credit process efficiency. To contribute to any other portfolio or credit administrative and statistical works as required by management from time to time Requirements Penultimate student in Singapore Good command of written and oral English Ability to read Vietnamese Ability to interpret financial statements Primary Location  SG-06-Singapore  Job Type  Internship  Job  SALES DEVELOPMENT  Education Level  Not indicated  Experience Level  Beginner

jobTitle: 2022 Analytics & Sales Internship for 2023 Analytics & Sales Graduate Programme (Vietnamese Speaker)
description: Bloomberg is the market leader in providing high-quality data, news and analytics to professionals in business, finance and government. With over 19,000 employees in 176 locations around the world we are a truly global organization entering new markets, launching ventures and pushing boundaries. The transparency Bloomberg brings to the financial markets is integral to our culture, our offices and our interactions with one another. We're measured by the quality of our contributions, not by a title. We don't need an open-door policy- we sit in open work spaces, shoulder-to-shoulder.  Who We Look For  You have an understanding of the drivers behind market moving stories and events. You're a solution-finder, with a real passion for providing exceptional customer service in a fast-paced environment. With a desire to build a career in a client-facing role, you understand the importance of credibility and building relationships. Join our comprehensive Analytics & Sales summer internship program, where you will rotate between both departments over the course of ten weeks, gaining an insight into what our graduate role has to offer!  What is the role?  It's rare to find a role that gives you such early exposure to global financial market participants. Our Analytics and Sales program offers you the unrivalled opportunity to join our team, where you are depended upon to provide fast and accurate solutions to incoming client queries. The support we give to clients is a key aspect of Bloomberg's value proposition and you will play a critical role here. Partake in our comprehensive training program, covering all aspects of the financial markets: economic principles, market players and asset classes - while teaching you all there is to know about the functionality and analytical tools Bloomberg has to offer. Upon a successful period in Analytics, you'll have the platform to further your career across the company. The majority of Analytics members take up opportunities within our Enterprise Sales team. In this role you will be working with existing and new clients to increase Bloomberg's engagement and presence through offering market leading solutions. You'll play an important part in maintaining Bloomberg's position as a market leader and driving business growth. You will support the top decision makers in the world of finance, government and business across APAC.  Analytics  We provide 24/7 support for Bloomberg Professional Service users all over the world and across multiple industries. Reaching us via our 'Instant Bloomberg' chat system, clients access unparalleled customer service where we answer their questions and help them maximize the value of Bloomberg. We're a calm voice in a busy, volatile market. Our clients rely on us to support them in making better, faster decisions using the power of Bloomberg Professional Services. On any given day we respond to over 12,000 queries in more than 15 languages. From educating a portfolio manager on Bloomberg's risk management solutions to helping a trader discover new sources of market liquidity - the variety of problems we solve is immense. Bloomberg plays a critical role in the workflow of our clients therefore when we're asked a question we strive to exceed their expectations by providing a timely, accurate and quality service. Analytics works in conjunction with Enterprise Sales to deliver on strategic initiatives, supporting product roll-out and on-boarding clients. We want to ensure our clients are making the most of our service and using tools and features that allow them to work smarter. Bloomberg is constantly innovating and Analytics plays a key role in ensuring clients are educated on new products and enhancements by proactively reaching out to up-skill clients through technology, on-site training and seminars.  Sales  In Sales, we're the face of Bloomberg for our clients. Consultative and entrepreneurial, we're responsible for managing client relationships, whilst striving to continually grow our revenue by identifying new business opportunities. We work collaboratively across departments to ensure the company continues to innovate and develop our product as well as ensuring we're delivering the best customer service. We spend our time with our clients, understanding their business goals and outpacing their expectations. Guided by curiosity and purpose, we work to understand their workflows and advise on the most appropriate Bloomberg solutions for them from across our range of enterprise offerings. We work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing market and to be successful, it's crucial we stay one step ahead, knowing our customers, pre-empting their needs and presenting them with ground breaking solutions, before they even know they need them. We're discovering new business leads by making prospecting calls and networking. The Enterprise sales team is relied upon to defend our position as a market leader in their respective regions and contribute to year-on-year growth. Colleagues from across the company depend on us to communicate new solutions and Bloomberg offerings to the market. We demonstrate how Bloomberg will help our clients make the best investment/trading/business decisions, making their day to day business smoother and more profitable.  Internship Program  Completing our 2022 Summer Internship program (10 weeks between May to July 2022) is an integral and important part of assessment process for 2023 Graduate Program.  The Summer Internship Program Consists Of  a week of classroom based financial product and functionality training, to broaden your knowledge of the global financial markets and our market leading Bloomberg solutions. After your training, you'll join a team where you'll immediately begin collaborating with interns on Analytics and Sales projects.  You'll have the opportunity to interact with clients, making valuable contributions by taking part in sales campaigns, promoting product features and prospecting for new business. Hands-on individual and group projects will allow you to experience how your full-time career could evolve.  To round out your experience, you'll attend lunch and learn sessions, designed to teach you about our diversified group, and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet Bloomberg leaders at a variety of networking events. Of course, we also want to give you the chance to get to know your peers, so you'll also take part in volunteering activities and social events with interns from other departments.  This Is An Entry Level Role Where You'll Need To be a current penultimate year tertiary student who will be available for a 10 weeks summer internship from May to July 2022, and will be available to start their full-time employment with us in 2023. A demonstrable interest in financial markets and the aspiration to work in the financial/fintech services industry(example: academic course or work/internship experience or extracurricular activities) Real ambition to pursue a client-facing career, with a strong interest in sales Stakeholder management exposure through school or work/internship Strong critical-thinking and problem-solving skills The resilience to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic fast-paced environment Business proficiency and fluency in English Business proficiency and fluency in Vietnamese to manage the respective clients. We'd Love To See Work experience in a client facing role Interest in technology and/or programming This is a future opportunity for our 2023 graduate hiring program with a 2022 summer internship opportunity.  Does this sound like you?  Apply if you think we're a good match.  Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate and are inclusive of age, disability, colour, gender, gender identity, marital status, national origin, race, religion and belief, parental or caring status, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, sexual orientation, veteran status.  As Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer, please let us know if you require any adjustments to be made for the recruitment process by emailing access2@bloomberg.net.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Bloomberg is the market leader in providing high-quality data, news and analytics to professionals in business, finance and government. With over 19,000 employees in 176 locations around the world we are a truly global organization entering new markets, launching ventures and pushing boundaries. The transparency Bloomberg brings to the financial markets is integral to our culture, our offices and our interactions with one another. We're measured by the quality of our contributions, not by a title. We don't need an open-door policy- we sit in open work spaces, shoulder-to-shoulder.  Who We Look For  You have an understanding of the drivers behind market moving stories and events. You're a solution-finder, with a real passion for providing exceptional customer service in a fast-paced environment. With a desire to build a career in a client-facing role, you understand the importance of credibility and building relationships. Join our comprehensive Analytics & Sales summer internship program, where you will rotate between both departments over the course of ten weeks, gaining an insight into what our graduate role has to offer!  What is the role?  It's rare to find a role that gives you such early exposure to global financial market participants. Our Analytics and Sales program offers you the unrivalled opportunity to join our team, where you are depended upon to provide fast and accurate solutions to incoming client queries. The support we give to clients is a key aspect of Bloomberg's value proposition and you will play a critical role here. Partake in our comprehensive training program, covering all aspects of the financial markets: economic principles, market players and asset classes - while teaching you all there is to know about the functionality and analytical tools Bloomberg has to offer. Upon a successful period in Analytics, you'll have the platform to further your career across the company. The majority of Analytics members take up opportunities within our Enterprise Sales team. In this role you will be working with existing and new clients to increase Bloomberg's engagement and presence through offering market leading solutions. You'll play an important part in maintaining Bloomberg's position as a market leader and driving business growth. You will support the top decision makers in the world of finance, government and business across APAC.  Analytics  We provide 24/7 support for Bloomberg Professional Service users all over the world and across multiple industries. Reaching us via our 'Instant Bloomberg' chat system, clients access unparalleled customer service where we answer their questions and help them maximize the value of Bloomberg. We're a calm voice in a busy, volatile market. Our clients rely on us to support them in making better, faster decisions using the power of Bloomberg Professional Services. On any given day we respond to over 12,000 queries in more than 15 languages. From educating a portfolio manager on Bloomberg's risk management solutions to helping a trader discover new sources of market liquidity - the variety of problems we solve is immense. Bloomberg plays a critical role in the workflow of our clients therefore when we're asked a question we strive to exceed their expectations by providing a timely, accurate and quality service. Analytics works in conjunction with Enterprise Sales to deliver on strategic initiatives, supporting product roll-out and on-boarding clients. We want to ensure our clients are making the most of our service and using tools and features that allow them to work smarter. Bloomberg is constantly innovating and Analytics plays a key role in ensuring clients are educated on new products and enhancements by proactively reaching out to up-skill clients through technology, on-site training and seminars.  Sales  In Sales, we're the face of Bloomberg for our clients. Consultative and entrepreneurial, we're responsible for managing client relationships, whilst striving to continually grow our revenue by identifying new business opportunities. We work collaboratively across departments to ensure the company continues to innovate and develop our product as well as ensuring we're delivering the best customer service. We spend our time with our clients, understanding their business goals and outpacing their expectations. Guided by curiosity and purpose, we work to understand their workflows and advise on the most appropriate Bloomberg solutions for them from across our range of enterprise offerings. We work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing market and to be successful, it's crucial we stay one step ahead, knowing our customers, pre-empting their needs and presenting them with ground breaking solutions, before they even know they need them. We're discovering new business leads by making prospecting calls and networking. The Enterprise sales team is relied upon to defend our position as a market leader in their respective regions and contribute to year-on-year growth. Colleagues from across the company depend on us to communicate new solutions and Bloomberg offerings to the market. We demonstrate how Bloomberg will help our clients make the best investment/trading/business decisions, making their day to day business smoother and more profitable.  Internship Program  Completing our 2022 Summer Internship program (10 weeks between May to July 2022) is an integral and important part of assessment process for 2023 Graduate Program.  The Summer Internship Program Consists Of  a week of classroom based financial product and functionality training, to broaden your knowledge of the global financial markets and our market leading Bloomberg solutions. After your training, you'll join a team where you'll immediately begin collaborating with interns on Analytics and Sales projects.  You'll have the opportunity to interact with clients, making valuable contributions by taking part in sales campaigns, promoting product features and prospecting for new business. Hands-on individual and group projects will allow you to experience how your full-time career could evolve.  To round out your experience, you'll attend lunch and learn sessions, designed to teach you about our diversified group, and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet Bloomberg leaders at a variety of networking events. Of course, we also want to give you the chance to get to know your peers, so you'll also take part in volunteering activities and social events with interns from other departments.  This Is An Entry Level Role Where You'll Need To be a current penultimate year tertiary student who will be available for a 10 weeks summer internship from May to July 2022, and will be available to start their full-time employment with us in 2023. A demonstrable interest in financial markets and the aspiration to work in the financial/fintech services industry(example: academic course or work/internship experience or extracurricular activities) Real ambition to pursue a client-facing career, with a strong interest in sales Stakeholder management exposure through school or work/internship Strong critical-thinking and problem-solving skills The resilience to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic fast-paced environment Business proficiency and fluency in English Business proficiency and fluency in Japanese (at least N1 level) to manage the respective clients. We'd Love To See Work experience in a client facing role Interest in technology and/or programming This is a future opportunity for our 2023 graduate hiring program with a 2022 summer internship opportunity.  Does this sound like you?  Apply if you think we're a good match.  Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate and are inclusive of age, disability, colour, gender, gender identity, marital status, national origin, race, religion and belief, parental or caring status, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, sexual orientation, veteran status.  As Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer, please let us know if you require any adjustments to be made for the recruitment process by emailing access2@bloomberg.net.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: You will be part of our Sales + Marketing Team!   Your Role  You will be responsible for supporting the Marketing and Communications team under the Asia Pacific Sales and Marketing functional unit. You will learn to work with various stakeholders in assigned projects; that will hone your strategic and creative thinking skills.   Your Responsibilities Support the Asia Pacific Sales and Marketing team with engaging and fresh communication activities. This includes internal and external communication, strategic sales campaigns and managing the employee engagement platform. Work closely with the Regional Communications Manager to understand our stakeholders’ brief and execute engaging communication plans. Develop ongoing communication campaign and assets, including but not limited to slides, briefing documents, microsites and visual/video assets. Produce and write high-quality and engaging stories for internal and external audiences, and making them available on external web pages and social media platforms. Use analytics and tools to advise and inform social media engagement/content plans and support in monthly media coverage reports. Organise and support internal events within Kuehne+Nagel Asia Pacific. Engage with stakeholders within Kuehne+Nagel Asia Pacific.  Your Skills And Experiences Pursuing a bachelor’s degree, preferably in Communications, Marketing, Journalism or Business. Computer skills, including proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office and social media. Ability to write creatively is critical, prior writing or journalism experience will be highly advantageous Detail-oriented and organized with strong written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated ability to work individually and in a team environment Able to commit for 6 months (January 2022 to June 2022) Good Reasons to Join  At Kuehne + Nagel, you get to grow your expertise, shape processes and deliver innovative solutions. We are continuously building our local and global network and our product portfolio, creating career opportunities in different fields of work worldwide. As a leader in the logistics industry, we provide a collaborative and IT-driven environment where you will work with motivated and customer-centric colleagues across the world. req80535

description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  Are you passionate about helping those around you become more effective? Do you think about technology as a way to disrupt and reimagine how businesses operate? Is building business-focused software with modern software engineering techniques and a hacker mentality intriguing to you? Facebook is seeking a talented, full-stack Enterprise Engineer Intern to join our Enterprise Engineering group and help build applications & systems to scale the company and to enable our employees to make the world more open and connected. Enterprise Engineers work on applications & systems for various groups, including sales, marketing, recruiting, and HR. Systems we build are used by all Facebook employees as well as advertisers and agencies. We create Enterprise software the Facebook way: We build it on the facebook.com tech stack by implementing complex UIs to encapsulate business processes, designing interactive visualizations for business analytics, and securing backends to store sensitive data. At the same time, we work on real-time and big data infrastructure to process the business graph and audience data on Facebook, and generate insights through machine learning and natural language processing. This role requires a passion for finding innovative, end-to-end engineering solutions to complex business problems. This is a fixed 12 week summer internship based in Singapore.  Responsibilities Create elegant enterprise software applications using PHP Implement web interfaces using XHTML, CSS, and JavaScript Build report interfaces and data feeds Minimum Qualification Experience in C++, Java, Perl, PHP, or Python Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Bachelors degree in Computer Science or a related field Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment Preferred Qualification Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op High levels of creativity and quick problem solving capabilities
industries: Internet

description: Whether you're an investment professional, an expert in sales or a technology specialist, you'll find a culture at MFS that supports you in doing what you do best. Our employees work together to reach better outcomes, always favoring the strongest idea over the strongest individual. We put people first and show care and compassion for our community and each other. Because what we do matters - to us as valued professionals and to the millions of people and institutions who rely on us to help them build more secure and prosperous futures.  Job Description About MFS  In 1924 MFS Investment Management established the first mutual fund in the United States. Today, MFS offers a wide range of products and services to investors, including more than 70 mutual funds, fixed and variable annuities, separately managed accounts, and retirement plans to retail customers, institutional investors, and insurance offerings. At MFS we hire talented individuals and allow them to work in an environment that fosters teamwork. We strive to make MFS a company where our employees can grow and succeed. While MFS provides a supportive work environment, we maintain high standards of accountability to ensure that employees meet our standards of excellence. We value intelligence and hard work. We value the perspective you bring. We will reward you for your good ideas, your work ethic, and your experience. We believe that our unique culture directly benefits our business.  International Equity Research Analyst Summer Intern  As a member of our 80 person equity research department, you will be solely responsible for fundamental research on one particular global industry with the objective of developing specific company and stock recommendations for the portfolios managed by MFS. A summer analyst is expected to work independently in the structuring, development and communications of investment recommendations. Our analysts draw upon a wide variety of information sources such as company literature, business publications and Wall Street research. The emphasis; however, is on original industry and company research including attendance at conferences and field trips to company facilities and interviews with corporate management at all levels. Analysts are expected to perform as the "in-house" expert on their particular area(s) of concentration.  A summer analyst is given responsibility for one global industry in Asia (usually 4 -5 companies). Industry assignments are based on the needs of the firm. There is a short, 3 day, training program at the start of the internship to reinforce some of the basic skills necessary to do the job. Following that you will work with a senior analyst who provides guidance and assistance in the development of analytical and valuation techniques. The goal of this relationship is to enable the investment intern to effectively generate and communicate investment recommendations. The internship is generally 10 weeks in duration (June - August). This position will be located in Singapore.  Analysts With a Good Track Record And Solid Performance Have Three Career Options Available  In the long-term, the MFS analyst path has a great deal of flexibility in career options. a long-term analyst that moves across various sectors a dedicated sector analyst, managing a sector and sector money become a diversified fund manager Qualifications Singapore internship is based in Singapore, local work authorization preferred If any applicant is unable to complete an application or respond to a job opening because of a disability, please contact MFS at 617-954-5000 or email talent_acquisition@mfs.com for assistance.  MFS is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and it is our policy to not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state or local laws. Employees and applicants of MFS will not be subject to harassment on the basis of their status. Additionally, retaliation, including intimidation, threats, or coercion, because an employee or applicant has objected to discrimination, engaged or may engage in filing a complaint, assisted in a review, investigation, or hearing or have otherwise sought to obtain their legal rights under any Federal, State, or local EEO law is prohibited. " Click here to view the 'EEO is the Law' poster and supplement ."

jobTitle: Data Operations Intern - Data Analyst (6 months internship)
description: Who are we?  Here at ADDX, we believe in a future where everybody can access financial ecosystems easily, fairly, and safely. That is why we’ve built the world’s first fully regulated platform for digital securities, licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.  In 2021, we raised USD 50 million in Series A funding led by Japan Investment Corporation and Development Bank of Japan. Among other esteemed investors, we are backed by Singapore Exchange and Heliconia, a subsidiary of Temasek.  We have gone through a total re-brand and promise this to be an exciting time. An integral part of a fast-growing team enabling investments in unicorns, pre-IPO companies, and hedge funds, your role is to innovate and discover new solutions.  If you believe in a future of fair financial markets, just like we do, we’ve been waiting for you at ADDX.  Who are we looking for?  Named the Most Innovative Fintech by Global Brands, we are redefining private market investing and are looking for a Data Operations Intern (Data Analyst) to join our Technology team.  Responsibilities Provide day-to-day support, including administration and analytical tasks Act as an analyst for system enhancements and/or projects Perform data validation to assure integrity, accuracy and consistency, identify the root cause of data inconsistencies and process defects, and implement timely corrective actions Conduct data collection and analysis using SQL, Snowflake, PowerBI and Python Automate data collection and aggregation processes to build reporting dashboards Collaborate with data engineers, product managers, and operation teams to provide statistics or business data that can help to drive business insights Work with subject matter experts and Data/ Business Analysts to understand business questions, processes, and related data Integrate data from a variety of business subject areas: finance, sales, product, marketing and publicly available data Analyse data to develop predictive models and identify data patterns and trends Develop appropriate visualization which addresses business questions Document processes and research, standards, guidelines, and best practices for teams utilizing the solution Requirements First year graduate or 3rd year undergraduate in Software/Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related fields. Understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and IT High resilience and strong communication skills Self-motivated, willing to learn and adapt quickly to deliver the end results Preferably someone who can commit full-time for min 6 months or more starting from Jan 2022 Interested applicants are strongly encouraged to apply at: https://jobs.lever.co/addx/2e9db8ea-0a43-435f-b74a-f4cc094f3140  Do note that only applicants who apply via the above link will be considered.  Due to our limited capacity, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: The IoT Solution Specialist will play a leading role in developing and expanding data driven solutions across the Internet of Things topic. You will work in a team, enabling the customers through digital transformation by leveraging the state-of-the-art machine learning, signal processing, and other data analytics techniques as well as the modern big data and IoT techniques.  Responsibilities As an IoT Specialist, you will lead of development system diagram, current loop design, signal process improvement, etc. As an IoT Specialist, you will take a pivotal role in helping to grow client relationships in the IoT/M2M segment, supporting our commercial teams in meetings with existing and potential customers through your subject matter and industry expertise. You will write analysis which gives our clients unique insight into emerging opportunities across enterprise and consumer IoT services, including vertical insight in the maritime, oil and gas, power and renewables industry etc. You will collaborate with the broader team of analyst and domain experts to use their market and technical knowledge to fulfil projects. You will lead to clear technical, competitive and security blockers to accelerate IoT solution sales and customer usage. You will be the thought leader in IoT space, sharing your expertise, coaching others, and leading by example across technical communities Actively contribute on QA activities and ensure our solution has good quality Qualifications Excellent knowledge of IoT markets and technologies. The expertise and ability to integrate complex elements and customer requirements into innovative technical architectures in the Internet of Things space integrating with the customers architecture required 6+ years of related experience in IoT technical roles required. High-level expertise in IoT Integration platforms or complex industrial system integrations. Knowledge in sensor network data protocols such as MQTT, AMQP, HTTPS, OPC UA, Modbus over RS485 and TCP . Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field preferred. Certification in IoT and cloud platform technologies preferred. Certification in information security preferred. Understand Quality Assurance process Experience Energetic and outgoing, committed to innovation. Creative and exploratory Team-player reaching out to relevant parts of our organization Ability to put the right amount of curiosity and efforts into emerging technologies and trends, quickly measure the “what’s in it for us” factor Practical experience with implementation on Marine, Oil and Gas industries is highly valued. Continuously seeking inspiration through external communities, meetups and conferences Sociable, creating a good atmosphere and recognize that feedback is the fuel of high performing teams Cross business area collaboration
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Oil & Energy

jobTitle: 2022 Global Trading Solutions Analyst Summer Internship Program in Singapore
description: Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.  We Offer  Join us as a Singapore summer analyst in our Global Trading Solutions (GTS) franchise! This is a 10-week program designed to give students a taste of life at the world's leading integrated Wealth Manager and Investment Bank, with the potential to join the Graduate Program.  Over the course of the internship you will make valuable contributions to the bank's work, develop skills, expand your knowledge and grow in confidence. Your participation in the real-world business challenges presented by Sales and Trading across multiple markets in real-time will allow you to expand your experience and build valuable networks across the wider firm.  Program Elements Include One day orientation followed by first week training Mid-term and final review to gauge your progress vs. your objectives Summer speaker series, where you'll hear from senior representatives across different divisions of the Investment Bank/Global Trading Solutions Mentorship from an experienced member of the business A balance of work, social events and networking opportunities Submit your application and complete the online assessments by October 3, 2021. Roles will be available in sales, structuring or trading; please note any specific preference on your CV/resume.  Your field of responsibility  This internship will see you join as an intern in our equity derivatives and fixed income business. There will be invaluable hands-on experience to improve your personal development, such as performing analysis, pricing and other associated activities in support of the creation and structuring of tailored client solutions, in order to service a variety of clients across the institutional and retail client base.  Your future colleagues  Be part of the dynamic and innovative environment that is the trading floor, providing fully cross-asset product offerings to our institutional, intermediary and ultra-high net worth clients.  We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm's D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values.  You Offer  You will be graduating between December 2022 - June 2023 with an undergraduate or Master's degree, and must be available between June - August, 2022. Whatever your background, you have keen interest in financial markets and a good understanding of market-making principles and market structures.  You Have Written and spoken communication skills in English A good understanding of market-making principles and market structures Familiarity of coding languages or completed courses in statistics, mathematics, physics or engineering Knowledge in Artificial Intelligence techniques for quantitative roles Excellent analytical skills, initiative, and a proven problem solver Experience working in a team, collaborating with others to achieve strong results You understand the value of diversity in the workplace and are dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds are treated equally and can bring their full, authentic selves to work to realize their full potential.  Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents. GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company.  For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com.  Project Title : Customer Facing, Salesforce - GLIDE  Project Objective / Purpose: By this project, we are building One GF Solutions for our customers  Project Description GLIDE stand for Globalfoundries Integrated digital Experience, which is combination of 7 projects together Intern Resource will place under this program to understand salesforce platform capability help customers query to respond day 2 day basis on technical front Project Outcome One GF Solutions for customer Required Qualifications BS, MS on IT, Computer engineering or software development. Preferred Qualifications Having Salesforce experience on coding and configuration for sales cloud and service cloud will be preferred. This internship is only applicable to Students seeking for 6 months credit base internship from Jan to Jun 2022. # Please submit educational transcript and resume to your appplication.  GLOBALFOUNDRIES is an equal opportunity employer, cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We believe having a multicultural workplace enhances productivity, efficiency and innovation whilst our employees feel truly respected, valued and heard. As an affirmative employer, all qualified applicants are considered for employment regardless of age, ethnicity, marital status, citizenship, race, religion, political affiliation, gender, sexual orientation and medical and/or  physical abilities. description: Kabuke is a unique Japanese Sake Gastrobar concept with a strong following in bustling downtown Telok Ayer.  We are currently expanding and are looking for a Trainee Sake Sommelier to promote our beverage offerings. You will help deliver a high-quality menu and drive beverage sales in our establishments.  As a Trainee Sake Sommelier, you will have the opportunity to acquire a strong knowledge of sakes and have a passion for building rapport with our customers. Additionally, you will build good contacts with suppliers and assist in maintaining an exciting range of sakes, traditional and modern, in our sake menu. You will gain a good understanding of the food menu and be able to work with our Head chef for appropriate sake pairings to provide customers with an experiential dining experience.  You should also be team player and assist the Restaurant Manager in the management of the front of house. You must be enthusiastic to share your knowledge and train other members of the team so that they are equipped with the skills to present the sakes to customers.  JOB SCOPE  Beverage Programme Maintain an exciting range of sakes Build strong relationships with various suppliers Plan and administer special sake promotions Ensure customers’ feedback are reflected in sake selection Provide training to members of staff Daily Operations Ensure correct use and maintenance of glassware Ability to pair food with sakes Ability to promote sakes to customers Assist Restaurant Manager and team in various aspects of daily operations when required Benefits Attractive salary package Monthly and annual performance bonus Annual leave and public holidays off Insurance and medical benefits Location 5-mins from Telok Ayer and City Hall MRT Requirements Interest and passion in Sake Excellent customer service experience and F&B knowledge, with the ability to describe ingredients and dishes Some familiarity with Japanese food and sake Strong leadership, motivational and people skills SSI Kikizakeshi certification. Diploma in F&B or Culinary Arts will be an added advantage
industries: Restaurants, Food & Beverages, and Hospitality
